39523999.review:
Okay, having just perfected it, it's time to review it since I now know everything about the game!  Ooorah!

[b]Graphics 8/10:[/b] The game has a certain comic book/cartoony feel to it.  That's to be expected given the source material, but it doesn't terribly detract from the game.  Some of the colors could be a bit more vivid, or at least more lifelike.  The other major negative is that most of the character CGI models (primarily used in the heaviest attacks) look WRONG compared to the usual models.  The only characters who look correct in their CGI modes are Alumon and Calibretto.  Monika's face has cheeks sharp enough to make me think of Maleficient instead of her usual rounded goodness.  Gully's gritting teeth that are the size of rocks.  Garrison looks like a thug with all those wrinkles.  Knolan looks like a thug who's turned into a raisin.   But at least the skins you can buy in-game look good.  Pity they couldn't have kept those base models for the CGIs.

[b]Sound 6/10:[/b] The music is suitably creepy in places.  Some of the more rousing elements seem to be missing though.

[b]Characters 8/10:[/b] Most of our familiar characters are back from the comics.  Some of the character development only makes sense if you've read the comics.  There are some details added in, like [spoiler] Monika and Garrison's apparent long history[/spoiler].  Alumon is completely new to the series though.   His story makes some sense, but [spoiler]it seems unresolved in the game's conclusion[/spoiler].

[b]Gameplay 7/10:[/b] The overworld maps are pretty basic, which hurts some of the concept.  But it keeps it being easy to move around.  In the dungeons you get some more options and also is where you'll find the bugs.

[b]Combat 8/10:[/b] Combat is turn based, tactical combat.  Each character gets their turn based on their Haste rating.  What's clever about combat is that abilities (spells) have cast times, and actions (basic attacks) do not.  They also seem to trigger cooldowns, which means you have to put some thought into who does what and when, but you can see how ability use will move the character's turns up or down in the queue.

[b]Story 4/10:[/b] The story is a bit weak, truthfully.  There's no strong connectivity to the comics aside from the character usage from what I can see.  WHY the characters are travelling here is missing.  Even reading the comics won't help you on this one.

[b]Summary 41/60:[/b] The game gives you a fix if you need a decent RPG that you can bounce into and bounce out of (it has an autosave feature that triggers...almost all the time) as time allows.  You might not find a lot of challenge in it, but the game does tease well a potential sequel.  A decent game to buy on sale, and nearly to buy fullprice.

[u]Pros:[/u] Autosave feature, low-moderate difficulty.
[u]Cons:[/u] Only 3 save files and no way to rollback files short of Alt-F4, the crafting system is intriguing but has some issues, there are some balance issues between the characters.

39523676.review:
VERY AWESOME JRPG when played at 2x-4x speed using Cheat Engine. DO NOT PLAY at 1x speed. You'll hate it if you do.

I hesitated a bunch before buying this, since it was the year of Divinity Original Sin 2 and a few other solid offerings also worth playing. I'm really glad I bought Battle Chasers Nightwar.

I spent about 32 real world hours enjoying this old style hack and slash JRPG. It was 80+ hours according to in-game time, guess I was 3x speed a lot. Finished with all Ultimate Weapons and Bursts. 

The story is weak, but the art is FANTASTIC. (I've never read the comics.) The exploration of both the world map and "exploration areas" is fun. If you ever played the older Final Fantasy games, you'll love this.

The really enjoyable parts are the turned based combat and crafting system. Combat is classic Final Fantasy / Phantasy Star / etc., where you min/max/tradeoff stats outside of combat, then build up combos using character abilities (spells etc.) in combat. The interplay between the various characters is awesome, combining buffs, debuffs, heals, shields, and attacks so that your characters complement each other.

I normally hate crafting, but they made it super intuitive. Get stuff, hold the 'A' button. They force you to think through stat tradeoffs instead. Inventory management in this game is better than nearly all other RPGs. It was always helpful and never got annoying. Small thing missing was a text search for items. (Where did I put my ancient vampire fangs?) I only had to grind for crafting ingredients twice and each time took less than 10 minutes at 3x speed.

You generally do not need to grind levels in order to progress. (Heard this was fixed in an October 2017 patch.) You do need to fight lots of mobs between dungeons to be ready for the next dungeon, but you'll get that exploring the world map. You may need to grind a bit to get all the best stuff (I'm looking at you, Arena), but you won't feel the grind with Cheat Engine set at 4x speed.

New Game+ is dumb so you'll bail after beating it. Be sure to enjoy everything before the final battle. In NG+ you retain items and perks, but lose your level, then fight all the same enemies again and try "Mythical" dungeon difficulty. Devs copped out, missed opportunity.

In case the devs are reading: you messed up the speed of the game. Let players change it so the 100th time Knolan casts Time Warp they don't have to sit through that cool 15 second animation again. 39492424.review:
[h1]Battle Chasers - Nightwar[/h1]
or [b]"The wasted potential JRPG"[/b]

Battle Chasers tries to be a classical JRPG. In some parts, it's done really well, others are really disappointing.

[b]Story & Characters:[/b]
The characters are really well designed. Some are pretty unique but all of them are interesting and likeable. It would be very interesting to play a game with those characters. Sadly, that game, is not this game. The game seems to be the sequel of the comic series, so the part where the story begins and how the characters meet and why they travel together is not part of this game. This game also does not conclude the story. It starts a different storyline that itself is also not concluded in this game. There is very few character interaction and character developement. So it's like an epic JRPG storyline, but without an interesting beginning, a satisfying ending or meaningful character developement in between. The rest is "must defeat bad people, must find artifact" and some hints that there has been meaningful developement in the comics.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
The battles are sideview with strategical focus on the turn order, so from the FF series, FF-10 is the most similar with it's CTB system. The tactics are not that much about elementary resistences like in typical JRPGs, but more about synergies between abilities and effects. I like that a lot. The dual-mana system is a very fresh and great idea as it prevents that very passive mana-sving gameplay most JRPGs have. All characters have different mechanics and skills and the character progression systems allow interesting customization and really cool cross-character combos and tactics. The enemies are well made and each have their own abilities and mechanics, so the battle part is really fun. 

What i like a lot are the dungeons. Within the dungeons, the characters have dungeon abilities and the dungeons itself have puzzles and secrets and also their own mechanics, which makes playing them pretty fun and interesting. At least the first time.

Now to the worst part of the game in my opinion: the Grind. 
Enemies give really low EXP. And playing the story parts does not give enough EXP to continue the story, so sometimes a little grinding is required. And by a little i mean a fight gives like 27 exp when you need 2000 for a levelup. It almost seems like it's done on purpose to double the playtime. From the six characters, only the three in the group get exp. So in ordner to use the others, more grinding is required. Equipment is crafted and gained as random loot, so more grind. 

[b]Graphics and Design:[/b]
The game looks really great. I love that comic style. Some places look good while others look beautiful and all dungeons have their own unique design and style. The animations are particularly good. In all progress fights, it's nice to watch and play. But while grinding, i sometimes wished they were a lot shorter.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
I finished the game in roughly 30 hours. I cheated my EXP to gain some levels when i just could not take the damn grind anymore. Some elements of the game are really good and fun, but the grind is too much. With a more lively plot, more character developement and less grind this would have been a pretty good game. It's a sad conclusion because the art is really good and the combat is well done and the aninmations are great and the designs are pretts good. 
I would not recommend this, i actually want my time back and i should have quit this hours ago instead of finishing it. :-(

39490901.review: Ive finished the game twice. There is no grind to it. Some dungeons I had to finish twice while looking for better gear, but most of the time I only finished the dungeon 1 time. As I finished the first playthrough in 38 hours and the 2nd playthrough took me another 22 hours.

39487727.review:
とりあえず、クリアしたのでレビュー。

父親から伝説の篭手を譲り受けた少女ガリー。
その篭手が持つ力を狙う勢力から彼女を守る一行の物語。　公式日本語対応。

・GOOD
【グラフィック・世界観】
これは完全に好みの問題だが、良かった。敵の死に方もそれぞれ凝っている部分もあったりボスにもそれぞれ必殺技が設定されているのでボス戦も楽しかった。

【戦闘・システム】
戦闘はRPGながら60FPSなので滑らかに動くのは良い。装備はハクスラ気味であり、鍛冶やエンチャントもある。申し訳程度でも釣り要素もあったり寄り道要素で宝探しやボスもいる。　戦闘では一発技のスキルよりもバフ・デバフの状態異常や強化が重要であるためそれを管理しながら順番によって戦略を考える必要があるため戦略性もあるだろう。

・BAD
【シナリオ、演出】
正直シナリオは王道なので何の新鮮味もない。一応流れとしては主人公にあたる少女の篭手に関わる話かとも思うがそうでもない。EDも戦いはこれからだ的なやつなのでゲーム中ではシナリオが完結しない。また、ムービーとしてモーションアニメが入るが音量調整がガバガバなのでセリフよりも圧倒的に効果音がうるさい。

【移動速度・テンポ】
正直、移動速度は遅い。2倍くらいあって丁度良い感じだと思った。ダンジョンなどを探索する事が多いのでそれは強く感じました。また戦闘におけるテンポも悪いです。最初は感動するようなモーションやスキル演出も中盤になる頃には度重なる戦闘で飽きてしまいますが、これがスキップできない。これは致命的だと思いました。必殺技のような存在であるバースト技のムービーもスキップ出来ないです。シンボルエンカウントであるとはいえ、戦闘回避はなかなか難しいのでせめて演出などスキップ可能にしてテンポを良くして欲しかった。


・総評・
基本的には良く出来ているゲームだと思います。TRPGのようなギミックやサブ要素もあり、戦闘自体も楽しいですがシナリオや演出、テンポも悪さが目立つ作品だと思いました。潜在力があるので磨けば良ゲー以上になる可能性は持っていると思いますが上記の要素から手放しでオススメ！とは言えませんが。

39487717.review: beautifully rendered game, and Voice acted in a fun and comic book style.  Interesting mechanics that will sit well with those who enjoy turn based RPG combat.

39482701.review:
Ein tolles Spiel. 
- Taktieren mit einer großen Fertigkeitenauswahl bei rundenbasierten Kämpfen 
- Sammeln von neuen Gegenständen für die Charaktere 
- Auswahl bzw. ständige Anpassung von Charakter-Vorteilen an das eigene Teamsetting
- Auswahl zwischen mehreren vorgefertigten Charakteren
- Die Story wird gelegentlich mit netten Gesprächen und Zwischensequenzen verfeinert. Die Story ist meiner Ansicht nach nicht komplex, aber dafür fällt es leichter, sich die eher kürzeren Texte durchzulesen und den Haupthandlungsstrang zu verfolgen. 

Das Spiel samt Kampfsystem und Charaktergestaltung erinnert sehr an den alten Super Nintendo Klassiker "Lufia". Mir gefällt das, da ich solche Spiele früher geliebt habe, und Battle Chasers eigene Ideen und eine größere Auswahl an Kampftechniken anbietet.

Verbessern könnte man meiner Ansicht nach aber noch Folgendes:
- Damit man das Angebot mehrerer Charaktere (die man nicht alle gleichzeitig mitnehmen kann) besser ausnutzen kann, sollte man automatisch alle Charaktere leveln können, so dass man sie im Abenteuer ohne Stärkeeinbußen austauschen kann. Das würde für die manchmal auch etwas eintönigen Kämpfe mehr Abwechslung erlauben.
- Das Balancing im Bezug auf die Gegnerstärke sollte teilweise angepasst werden. Manchmal ist man für Gegner trotz Mitnahme sämtlicher Kämpfe und XP zu schwach, und kassiert dann gelegentlichl eine kaum abwendbare Niederlage. In einigen Situationen sind dafür auch zu schlechte Ausrüstungsgegenstände verantwortlich. Gut wäre es in diesem Zusammenhang, wenn der Schmied bessere Items anbieten könnte und man beim Selbst-Schmieden Items für alle Charaktere herstellen kann.

39454425.review:
I've played tons of turn-based RPGs (I'm an old gaming vet) from the entire Final Fantasy series to Chrono Trigger, Super Mario RPG...ahhh it's too early to remember them all.   So just know that I have some experience with turn-based rpgs.  

The character designs are attractive and so are the level designs.  I didn't like how the world map traveling was linear.  It made it feel like you were detached from the world and looking at a game board or something.  It should have been a free roam type world view (ala FF).

The story was semi-interesting and made you want to keep playing to find out more, but the combat...


...is a bit boring.  I know turn-based rpgs are a bit of an outdated format, but it could still be engaging and fun.  Just look at Super Mario RPG:  A simple perfectly timed button press as your character attacks allowing them to do more damage was an engaging mechanic that made it feel like you had more control on how well your team performed.  Combined attacks in Chrono Trigger...you get my point.  There is nothing else Battle Chaser's combat other than straight up command - attack/spell, command - attack/spell.  Even the "supers" are just command - attack...nothing special.

I got bored and never finished.  

I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who craves innovation in their turn-based rpgs.

At about 31 hours in, I think I'm 75% through, but I am looking forward to new game plus.  Great for completionists.

39446564.review:
I have never written a review for a game on Steam before Battle Chasers: Nightwar, but felt this game was good enough to warrant my first one.

This game was absolutely worth the price of admission.  I enjoyed the art style, voice acting, combat and crafting.  It's just long enough without making you feel like you are making a career out of playing it.  It took me right at 40 hours to beat it, although I probably could have done it in 30 if I wanted to.  

I have read review that said they felt like they had to grind some.  I never felt like I was grinding out levels.  Abilities come at a even pace throughout the game and if I had to make one knock on the game its that there are probably too many abilities per character.  Each character has about 16 core abilities of which I used about 8.  

I can't say enough about the art style and combat animations, they are really bright and eye catching without getting overly repetitive.  Although they could have given us a wider variety of npc models, but the ones they had were fun and well done.  My favorite was the Brawler, which reminded me of Mike Tyson's Punch Out characters.

The game plays alot like a Final Fantasy game, with enough of its own personality to set itself apart.  The player characters weren't deep, but they were quite fun to play.  I played a party of Calibretto, Garrison and Red Monika mostly.  I may play it again with the other characters to get a feel for them.  One of my favorite things was that the player characters go against type to some degree.  The little girl, they all want to protect, is the tank.  The massive robot is a healer.

Overall 9.5/10

39425553.review:
I really wish steam had a neutral vote option, as this game does not deserve an outright thumbs down. It's charming in some aspects and has some nice ideas (go look at positive reviews for those), but it is also plagued by major issues that bog down the experience, two major ones being:

1) Difficulty/levelling/gear curve. It's all over the place. Gear heavily dictates what you can and cannot take on. And it doesn't progress linearly - at certain levels, there are major power spikes, which results in you having to slog trough a bunch of mind-numbingly easy fights, or, alternatively, finding out you're undergeared and you need to grind a bunch of trivial content to progress. It's usually the former. Late game is a good example - once you acquire a legendary weapon, the rest of the game becomes just a matter of idly mashing one button to victory. I beat the damn final boss in four attacks without even being max level.

2) Animation speed. For the love of god, please add an option to speed up the animations (preferably by up to x4). The animations are nice, but I don't want to watch a underleveled slime I encountered in the overworld tickling my hero for the 1000th time. I'd  give this game a thumbs up right now despite all the issues if they had that option. You can't even minimize the game without pausing it, forcing you to endure even the particularly long animation (like most burst (ultimate) abilities).

Then there is a plethora of other, smaller problems, such as newly acquired heroes not scaling up automatically to your other heroes (who the hell wants to spend 2-4 extra hours grinding up a low level guy they just acquired to find out if they like him or not?), shops and alchemy being absolutely useless, Newgame+ being completely pointless and so on.

All in all, wait for this game to be polished up a bit more before buying, unless you have a tolerance for similar JRPG-like nonsense.

39420492.review:
Fantastic game until the final boss. Grinding rewards you well throughout the game and gives the player a good enough reason to do so. However the final fight is a huge change of perception in that achieving max level and going out of your way to complete the quests for the legendary weapons do not aid you any different than having green weapons. The final boss can only be defeated using meta loadouts, cheese, or waiting long enough to have great RNG against it. The boss is comparable to wizpig in that the level of unfair difficulty slams you in the face out of nowhere. From what i've gathered, this fight was dissapointingly simple at launch and was patched to address the lack of difficulty.

This is game breaking for me and I am left frustrated being unable to see my time investment go full circle. Until this fight I never thought I would join the list of negative reviews for this game, which for the most part are people complaining about millennial QOL or grinding. Hopefully this fight is patched because this game is a great sleeper hit.

39412586.review:
There's one thing this game fails at:

Dramatic tension. They don't have any real build up to what's going on. I partially blame this on the fact that there was a pre-existing comic, so I assume that most of the people who have read the entirety of Battle Chasers might have a better clue of what's going on, but for those of us who are not in the know: it could use some serious work.

One moment I'm fighting werewolves, the next weird steampunk trains, and then suddenly I'm at it with vampires and I'm never really given a whole lot of detail as to why I should be caring about this struggle. "There's a big bad evil guy and he's gonna do something bad!" isn't really enough. I never worry for the characters. I never worry for the world. I never worry for anything, and that's worrisome.

If you're looking for a story akin to those epic tales spun by the old Square during the Final Fantasy games of the Playstation 2 era and backward, you'll want to look elsewhere.

Combat is fun though, so there's that.

39410784.review:
Many other reviews labeled this game as "grindy", and I will say this.  You get out of it what you put in.  There are plenty of sidequests, crafting, legendary weapon quests, ultimate skill "hunts", and multiple dungeon difficulties with scaling rewards.  If you want to stroll through this game on "ezmode" you can, or, like I did, you can get over 50 hours out of a single playthrough and still have new game + waiting for you.

Battle chasers does a great job combining aspects of a modern dungeon crawler with old school turn based jrpg elements.  The dungeons are enough in number and do a bit in random generation, so if you want to play multiple times you don't get the same cookie-map stamped out each time. 

 I found the combat entertaining, even for someone usually not thrilled with turn based, because of the different combinations and character builds you can do with your teams  The characters play off each other offensively bylayering different combat status on enemies and can defend using anything from dmg shields to healing-by-attack.  

Overall, great maps, great characters, good side-systems and the atmosphere and dialogue breathe like a comic book.
One of my favorite purchases off steam so far, definitely recommend picking up especially if it is on sale because of the immense value.  I milked over 60 hours out of a single playthrough and had as much fun with combat and exploring in hour 60 as the first.

39409448.review:
Un estilo visual muy propio de THQ, recuerda a Darksiders muchas veces, muy cuidado y por lo que pude ver bastante fiel al comic original. Los mapeados y modelados simplemente se ven geniales.
Un sistema de combate por turnos clásico, poco que agregar, con unas animaciones geniales.
Lo que me me llamó la atención es la mezcla de mecánicas que posee este juego, por un lado un mapa del mundo a lo "Final Fantasy", por otro lado mazmorras y zonas de exploración en las que los personajes tienen habilidades especiales y por ultimo el sistema de combate por turnos.
Personajes con un punto de profundidad gracias a las secuencias de conversaciones que saltan al descansar en la posada, punto a favor. En general la narrativa esta bien.
Y poco mas que agregar, crafteo, encantamiento, jefes, loot, exploración, niveles, habilidades... lo tipico de los rpg.
Muy recomendable!

edit: la verdad que al final la historia me interesó MUY poco y termine salteando todas las cinematicas, lo mas flojo, pero todo lo demas compenza muchisimo.  8/10

39402150.review:
Gotta say, this game took me by surprise.

I bought it not expecting much as I am not a big fan of the genre -- but I was blown away!

Positives:
- Beautiful visuals with amazing 2D cutscenes
- Lush sounding voice actors for the characters
- It's difficult but not Dark Souls level of difficult
- Many different perks & abilities to utilise
- Hours & hours of content with a New Game+
- 6 different playable characters to choose from
- A load of side content/quests to do in-between dungeons
- Many different monsters to fight with different looks/abilities
- Re-playing a dungeon is slightly different everytime 
- Fishing!!!

Negatives:
- Some animations take waaaaay too long and can be boring to watch
- A lot of items are an absolute ball ache to craft
- There are only 8 dungeons, would be nice to have a lot more
- There are a lot of text conversations that I wish were voice acting
- Long sessions on the game can get boring pretty quick
- A LOT OF GRINDING

Overall it is a smashing game and would recommend this game to anyone.

39359299.review:
Bought this game on a whim when it was on sale a few weekends ago. Forgot about it, then remembered when I saw it in my library. What a terrible thing to forget about, because this game is amazing so far. 

TL;DR: As of 2 hours in I highly recommend this game to any classic JRPG fan. It is VERY solid and a pleasant surprise.

I only have 2 hours played, up to the first major dungeon. This game oozes JRPG goodness. The production value is incredible to be honest. Music, art, gameplay all meshes very well. Just the normal attack command feels powerful, as your characters jump to the enemy and performs a satisfying attack with their main weapon. The skill system seems very well done so far, with a rewarding value called overstrike I think. The more you use your standard attack, the more this charges. As it fills, your characters are able to burn through this temporary bar in place of MP, giving you a way to conserve MP and still experience your skills nearly every battle. I REALLY enjoy this aspect, as a lot of time in JRPGs I feel like I should be saving my MP for bosses.

It seems like there are many different models for new equipment, another great attention to detail that feels good. There is a crafting system as well which I haven't really experienced yet, but it seems simple enough. 

I won't touch on story just yet, since I have barely scratched the surface. But I will update this as I get further in. All I can tell is that this group of heroes seem to have been together for quite some time, and their personalities reflect this. This game does not start you with a main hero, by them self, slowly recruiting characters as you progress, a trope I'm glad to see absent.

39356951.review:
I had no prior knowledge of Battle Chasers, I bought it during a Steam Sale on a whim. It was only after I got hooked that I did more research, eventually I found out it was a comic book from the late '90s and this game was Kickstarted. 
To be honest I am not a fan of Kickstarters but I loved Battle Chasers: Nightwar from start to finish. Also I'm not a hardcore JRPG type, I've dabbled in Final Fantasy here and there but thats about it and rarely ever do I finish an RPG.


PROS:
* Artstyle is terrific!
* Each character is unique and fills a roll.
* Dunegon Crawling aspects.
* Turn Based RPG Combat.
* Loot, Treasure, Lore, Achievements!
* Weapons affect appearance. 
* Unlockable Skins!
* Perks/Talent Points and character Builds. 
* Tons of side quests and mini games.

CONS:

* [b]Difficulty[/b], at certain points the game feels like you hit an impossible wall. later in the game you become an unstoppable god. Leveling and difficulty curve is not smooth at all. Most of the time I found myself out leveling all the interesting loot in the game.

* [b]World Map[/b] is not an open world. I understand the world map was most likely designed this way due to limited resources but I personally feel the game would have benefited greatly from an open world concept when traveling.

* [b]Fishing[/b] as a mini game the fishing was quite bland, I myself finished all the fishing related quests and acheivements. It could have been more interactive.

* [b]Tutorials[/b] I beat the game without crafting anything, I would have used this feature more had it been explained better through quests. I found many crafting tables in dungeons but failed to realize their intention until it was too late. Recipes could have gotten some attention as well as enchnating and alchemy. 


I would love to see a sequal to Battle Chasers: Nightwar with a longer story, an open world map and better difficulty curves.

39354155.review:
Bellissimo RPG con combattimenti a turni come nella miglior tradizione dei vari FInal Fantasy.

Il gioco presenta un livello di difficoltà medio, e in alcuni casi dovrete dar fondo a tutta la vostra abilità strategica per uscire vivi da uno scontro. Sistema di looting appagante che spinge a rigiocare uno stesso Dungeon più volte per poter guadagnarsi un bel bottino. 

I Dungeon possono essere esplorati in 3 difficoltà diverse. All'aumentare della difficoltà, ovviamente, aumenta anche la complessità: più scontri, più stanze da ripulire, più trappole e più chance di raccogliere oggetti rari o frammenti di storia aggiuntivi.

Sistema di crescita del personaggio abbastanza profondo. Non c'è la possibilità di customizzare le abilità da imparare, dato che queste vengono automaticamente aggiunte alla lista di quelle utilizzabili durante il combattimento. Esiste però la possibilità di scegliere fra svariati potenziamenti, suddisivisi in 2 rami per ciascun personaggio (di solito uno per l'attacco, e l'altro per la difesa o i poteri di utilità).

La storia, almeno per il momento, non mi ha soddisfatto particolarmente. Sono però certo che col passare del tempo riserverà grandi sorprese. I dialoghi sono comunque sempre pieni di momenti esilaranti che vi strapperanno più volte un sorriso.

Ultima nota di merito per la grafica. Stile cartoon davvero ben fatto, con animazioni fluide e diversi effetti.

39338665.review:
首先说明，评测只代表个人喜好。游戏还是很优质，如果觉得下述缺点无所谓的话还是推荐入手。

但是！！！！我还是想狠狠心给个差评！因为老子的玻璃心碎了！

应该有八小时整，简单的先说说游戏的优点吧，其他评测都有不再啰嗦。

1.画面精美，音乐恰到好处，配音优质

2.战斗打击感强

3.战斗系统设计巧妙，有许多独立机制，特别是过载系统及爆发系统。以至于到五六个小时的时候一度下决心要把这游戏尽快通掉。

下面我来锤一锤缺点吧：

1.首先我要说的是，这游戏只能上场三人！！！从开场CG到剧情铺垫，前部分始终是寻找剩下的两名同伴，这也让我十分期待是否可以在一场战斗里同时控制五人。但！是！在木桶里找到了法师之后，法师的等级低于我的队伍等级，一身垃圾绿装。这就不说了都可以练，一看技能机制果断放弃，弱的一笔。过载低下，技能伤害平庸，而且多数技能释放速度缓慢，还没出手坦克就已经gg了，十分影响游戏体验。

换句话说，五个人对应五套独立的成长体系，等级、天赋、装备，一个坑一件。坦克是女主，机器人和法师可以充当奶妈及半个输出，战士和女盗贼可以当作纯输出。但是只能上场三人的话！就说明你必须要舍弃两个人！不着重培养的话传奇宝箱注定与你无缘，但是如果固定三个人，还有什么意思呢。

2.人人都说好的地下城模式，我看到了浓重的Torchlight的影子。作为上帝视角来操控的回合制游戏，这一项作为加菜，仁者见仁吧。

3.打造系统极度鸡肋，打造材料到处掉，但是游戏里所有打造的内容，都必须在地下城里寻找操作台才能进行。exm???? 8小时只遇到了一个附魔制作台，花钱买的一堆锻造书有个锤子用哦。

4.整个剧情让人没有动力玩下去，只是知道：哦我要去叹号那里，那里有任务。其余时间就是控制小人在地图上沿着线走啊走。走回主城也没有归属感，反而觉得战斗界面更亲切，emmmmmm.......

大概就是以上了，以后如果突然想玩了可能会改好评。

39319124.review:
Battle Chasers: Nightwar is a well constructed yet ultimately shallow classic style RPG.  It looks beautiful and sounds great but will leave RPG veterans largely underwhelmed and wishing for more.  To me it really felt like a beautiful looking mobile app minus micro transactions rather than a full on PC RPG garnering a $30 USD price tag.  For $5 or $10 this game has some value but just doesn't pack enough content to be worth a mid tier game price.  

Pros:  
- Looks and sounds fantastic
- Voice acting is adequate if not incomplete
- Does resemble classic style RPG's drawing on elements from Final Fantasy and even Super Mario

Cons:
- Ultra grindy, does not meet the content.  Reminds me of Diablo clones that push a constant dungeon hack with the only reward being minor gear improvements.  
- Story is pretty generic and not a lot of it. 
- Battle system was clearly not tested well and can be super frustrating and non-sensical.
- Difficulty spikes happen without notice or reason

My biggest frustration with this game is that it possesses no rule set to ground it as a turn based classic RPG.  Veterans of the genre will be accustomed to a standard rule set which grounds the game strategy in a form of logic the players can accept and adapt to.  Battle Chasers has no underlying rule set.  Instead it just makes up whatever rules it feels like at any given moment to spike difficulty at you.  This creates a "cheap" or "cheated" feeling as a player.  

For example the rules of combat heavily limit the player characters you control.  On your turn you can choose to perform a basic action (base attack, defend, or buff) or you can opt for "special" abilities.  Special abilities take time to cast and are sometimes more powerful than your base ones but not always.  However enemies have all kinds of multi strike attacks and massive status effects.  Sometimes they get multiple turns per round all seemingly for no reason.  Huge damage hits happen seemingly without warning and you can wipe alarmingly fast against innocent seeming trash mobs however you can rarely ever hit this hard until the very high levels.  Even then though lvl 30 (max) characters never can hit as hard as the most powerful trash mobs in the game.  A specific of this are the Hangmen.  Hangmen can damage you just by it being their turn.  Once their turn pops your characters take 1-2 hits of damage for no discernible reason.  Then the Hangman will cast or strike.  Hangmans basic strike is a double hit the hammers you with heavy damage each strike.  Again no reason why they hit you for double strikes.  They are also very large characters which move slow yet have an extremely high haste rating making them attack frequently.  There is no combat logic here nor does anything in the story rationalize why these regular mobs are so powerful when your superior level heroes suck in comparisson.  

Because of this lack or a coherrent combat rule set the player will ultimately criticize a very odd combat mechanic which is the "Ability" wait timer.  Base attacks are single strike attacks only and are generally quite weak but can be deployed the second it is your turn.  However unlike any other RPG I have ever played the "special" abilities force your player to drop down the combat queue further.  I suppose this was done to simulate casting time but it creates an odd dynamic to combat where sometimes the spell you wish to cast takes as many as 5 or 6 turns to get off whereas other times its almost instant.  This requires to player to adapt to the style and cast ahead of when you might want to.  Healing is particularly challenging because you cant be as reactionary.  One of your characters may get crushed with a devastating attack yet your healer has to wait several turns to cast the heal.  It's infuriating watching your enemies get priority attacks on almost dead characters.  

Whats worse to the mechanics believability is that most of the "special" abilities aren't all that special.  By the later levels you hit so hard with your base attack it's very hard to bother messing about with waiting to attack.  This makes the grind even more painful as you just spam the same base attack over and over and over.  The majority of abilities are worthless in comparrison and when even attempting to cast them forces you to take unneccessary damage and its a bad formula.  It means a big chunk of the combat mechanic is worthless....

Now lets couple all of that with the lack of much story and very slow combat animations and you have a bad combination of elements for a satisfying RPG experience.  Combat animations are brutal.  Probably 2/3rds of the time spent in battle is spent just watching the same animations over and over.  You get sick of fighting slimes due to how slow they move when they attack and you can't speed this up.  Since the game has very little story or cut scenes it's basically a battle grind for most of the game and that means just watching the same stuff on repeat.

A few other issues I have are that the game really hammers home that it was kickstarted and pushes in doners names and stories etc which seem to have no place there.  The crafting system is completely out of place and borderline broken.  It's a horrible interface, makes little sense, and it isn't even really needed to finish the game.  They should have just omited that in favor or more quality story time or content.  Also I experienced a bad bug every now and then where the game would drop video and force me to guess if I was saving or hard crash out of it.  All in all it just feels that the devs ran out of kickstarter money and released the game unfinished and untested.

In conclusion I just really wanted to like this game and I love grindy RPG's but this game feels too unfinished, too unpolished to warrant an entry in a serious RPG collectors library.  It's nothing but a cheap mobile rpg that was pushed onto consoles and PC's via kickstarter.  If it hits $5 maybe its worth an impulse buy but you will get bored of it probably faster than I did.  If they hadn't wasted so much time on the worthless crafting system and diverted that money to developing more story this could have been something.

39317376.review:
[b]Overall:[/b] I had a lot of fun playing this game, and would gladly play a sequel.  A more involved story and a party-wide leveling system would make it truly great.  Recommended if you like JRPGs.

[b]The good:[/b] the game plays like a tribute to classic SNES-era JRPGs, and does that well; the gameplay reminded me a lot of Chrono Trigger and FF6.  The combat is tactical without being punishing - you'll want to pay attention to buffs and debuffs and learn how to best make use of your party's abilities, but it's not like you'll die in every battle if you don't use the exact perfect strategy.  The graphics do a good job of capturing the comic's look, and I like the artistic look of the overworld map.  I had no problem with the voice acting, and I think the music's done well - it's more ambient than anything else, but it adds some good atmosphere.  The crafting system is easy to use and very useful, unlike in some games where such systems feel tacked on.  Finding bits and pieces of lore in dungeons adds to the world, and there's a good assortment of side quests and treasure hunts to do if you feel like tracking down all the hidden stuff.

[b]The okay:[/b] part of why I say the crafting system is useful is that crafting is essential.  You won't find enough upgrades by running the dungeons, but you will get plenty of parts, so it's easy to get undergeared if you don't buy the new crafting books and make more stuff.  I neglected to do this, and found that a dungeon I was headed to was ranked as "impossible" for me even at the lowest difficulty level, because I hadn't found enough gear and had to go craft some. 
 The story itself is pretty weak - most of it is just running after one bad guy or another, with no personal stakes for the characters and no character development among the party at all.  Part of why I like JRPGs is that they're usually story-heavy, and as much as this game was clearly inspired by them, it was disappointing to feel like the story was an afterthought for the game taking us on a tour of the world's dungeons.

[b]The bad:[/b] my one major issue with the game is that you have to level each party member separately.  This means that you either have to do a lot of extra grinding to level up everyone, or pick a team and stick with them.  I went with the second choice, because I didn't feel like playing through everything in the game twice, but it felt like I wasn't getting as much out of the game by not being able to play all the characters.  If the whole party leveled up together, so you could swap them out depending on what you were fighting or who you felt like playing, I would have no major complaints about this game.

39314684.review:
[code]Эта игра называется [b]Гринд[/b], она про [b]гринд[/b] и посвящается [b]гринду[/b]![/code]

Сюжет в этой игре, как завещал сэр Кормак - для галочки. Многие пишут про отсылку к оригинальным комиксам - но из-за игры читать комиксы? Пойду руки помою...

Так, я вернулся, теперь о игре. Приятная рисовка, красивые локации, неплохая анимация. Бои в стиле пошаговых RPG, причем японских. Героев оригинального комикса забрасывает на остров, который набьет оскомину. Мы будем ходить по нему долго и нудно, причащаясь к сюжету в так называемых данжах. Вся цель игры - нагриндить материалов, чтобы сковать оружие покруче и пройти дальше. Дроп с боссов как правило не интересен, потому что пока мы ходили и собирали материалы, то уже первысили их уровнем и разбираем их на ура.

В целом - неплохая игра. Она позволит скоротать пару вечеров в нещадном уничтожении врагов, собирании компонентов и апгрейде собственных бойцов. Не лишина минусов, коих много. 
[list]
[*]В распоряжение нам дают трех бойцов, всего их шесть. Мы можем менять состав пати, но это нахрен никому не нужно - ведь те три бойца, с которыми мы игру начинаем прокачаны лучше, чем последующие три. Только для интереса и ачивки, не более.
[*]Дроп. Падает такая шляпа неинтересная, чо проще скрафтить свою - благо новые рецепты открываются с ростом уровня.
[*]Сюжет. Его нет по сути. Сюжетные вставки выглядят убого по сравнению с основной игрой. Не мотивирует нисколько по сравнению с возможностью нагриндить на новый шмот.
[/list]
В целом игра для тех, кто Плюшкин по жизни - собирать, доставать и крафтить, чтобы иметь. Скорее положительно к ней отношусь, отличная игра для того, чтоб после работы с отключенным мозгом потыкать кнопки на джойстике. Абсолютно развлекательная тема, которая не несет ни новой идеи, ни учит чему-то доброму, разумному, вечному. Плюс дорого. Вторая часть не за горами.

P.S. А еще тут есть рыбалка, вот она крутая!

39309828.review:

39280046.review:
I picked up Battle Chasers: Nightwar not really knowing much about the game. I just loved the art style and the fact that it was a turn-based RPG. I took a gamble and I think I can safely say I landed a huge winner.

Aside from its absolutely gorgeous aesthetics, Battle Chasers is a game that harkens back to the classic RPGs of the SNES and PS1 eras. The game starts off a little slow at first, but after the first couple of hours, once you have some levels and more characters in your party, combat becomes quite dynamic and intricate. It is turn-based, but by no means sluggish or dull. Enemies start getting more and more ruthless later on, with big damage spikes, lots of annoying status effects and more. Combat feels a bit like Final Fantasy VI and Chrono Trigger, and that's a compliment.

One of the best parts of the game is the fact that your experience is extremely customizable. You have a party of three heroes, which you can choose from a pool of six. Each hero has two Perk Trees (think World of Warcraft talent trees). As you level, or find perk tomes, you get more points. These allow you to specialize your characters. Glass cannons, tanks, healers, support, you name it, you can build it.

This level of customization extends beyond the heroes themselves. You can craft armor and weapons with stats you prefer, and there's a whole host of enchantments you can put on your gear, from special status procs, offense vs defense, and more.

If you liked some of the old school western or Japanese RPGs, there's a good chance you'll love this. It's fun, charming, surprisingly deep, and you can choose the difficulty of the dungeons. Give it a chance. You won't regret it.

39271666.review:
Battle Chasers: Nightwar está bien, aunque tampoco destaca demasiado en ningún aspecto. Quizás el más flojo de todos es el de la trama, ya que es enormemente genérica, con personajes que tampoco están muy desarrollados ni nada. No se si en los comics esto será así, pero al menos narrativamente me parece que el juego está algo desaprovechado. A nivel de juego es un RPG de estilo japonés bastante clásico, que funciona bien aunque requiere algo de grindeo para ir sacando todo porque muchas cosas son aleatorias, asi que para obtener todo lo que una dungeon puede ofrecer a menudo hay que repetirlas. El numero de enemigos está bastante bien, con sus jefes y demás, lo cual es un punto a favor. Como suele ocurrir en estos juegos, la personalización de los personajes es limitada porque los atributos suben automáticamente con el nivel, pero las combinaciones de dotes distintas sin son personalizables y entre ellas y el equipo si tienes cierto grado de personalización de los miembros de la party. El hecho de que los que no estén en combate no suban px, sin embargo, juega en su contra, ya que al final recompensa siempre usar los mismos tres personajes ya que el resto se van quedando atrás.

Gráficamente el juego no es la panacea, pero si captura relativamente bien la estética de un comic. Aunque las escenas de video son un poco flojas para lo que podrían haber hecho, como con la intro. La isla donde se desarrolla el juego también es bastante genérica, con unos entornos y diseños que podrían haber estado en cualquier juego. El sonido si cumple bien, en ese sentido ninguna queja. Y no me encontré con ningún bug en toda la partida, lo cual también es un punto a favor.

El resultado es un juego que no está mal y resulta entretenido, aunque podría haber dado mucho más. Un 6,5.

39264380.review:
This is a very good game but with many minor flaws.

Major negatives:
- It is very repetative, if you don't like the combat in this game, then you should not play it.
- The characters you don't use dosen't level up with the rest of the party.

Minor negatives:
- The only mini game (fishing) is not very fun.
- It can be really frustrating to find things like locations for minor quests since you cant look at the map for names on dungeons - internet is your friend.
- The arena fights is on a timer in a turnbased system for some reason - and you can face some enemies with really slow animations or defensive abilities like the slime that multiplies wich is extremly slow.
- Fights can't be speed up, and is a big time sink.
- Some of the characters didn't get much of a place in the story and are just there - adding a comment on whats happening now and then. Especially Red Monika hardly had anything intresting or personal happening in her story.
- The story is your basic fantasy story.
- Very slow crafting for some reason.
- Unclear how effective your defence and haste stat actually is. 
- Moving on the world map is slow and need better fast travel options.
- A little bit of an underwhelming final boss.
- Sequel batied.

+ Combat is very good for the most part. In the late game i found myself doing the same thing over and over again however, but in the majority of the game you had to vary your tactics untill you unlocked some of the final abilities wich easily trumps the rest of the skillsets. (at least on Red Monika and Gully that i played. With Calibretto i had to change what heals he used depending on the type of enemies the party faced)
+ The "Mana building" abilities you can use during battle + your mana reserve system is a very good, intresting system.
+ You can chose on what difficulty you want to play your dungeons. I went for the hardest difficulty, and until the late game where my characters got very overpowered it was very hard. 
+ Artstyle, artworks, animation and graphics are very good.
+ Good music.
+ Some characters had nice personal stories. 
+ Easy system to understand.

All in all: 7/10 (holding them to high standards)
I'm looking forward for their next game : )

39260348.review:
Franchement, j'ai été très déçu par ce jeu, on m'avait vendu un systeme de combat original et très preneur, et au final, à part le fait qu'il faille utiliser des compétences quasi inutiles avant de lancer de vrais attaques (si on veut pas perdre sa mana, qui part très vite), rien de neuf sous le soleil.
Bon, on va quand même voir les points positifs : 
-C'est assez joli, pour peu qu'on apprécie ce style graphique.
-Les personnages sont cool, assez diversifiés.
-Le système de talent peut plaire.
-La difficulté est assez bien dosée.
-Une vf jusque dans l'audio (assez rare dans ce type de jeu pour le souligner)

Passons maintenant aux choses qui fachent :
-C'est LENT, même pour un J-rpg : c'est lent d'xp, les combats sont lents, avoir du stuff c'est lent, les déplacements sont lents, tout le jeu à l'air d'être au ralenti.
-Le système de combat : si l'idée peut paraitre sympa, ça devient vite pénible à force de se taper les attaques ultra faibles (ou défenses)  pour pouvoir ensuite lancer des vrais attaques (je suis pas non plus fan des delais sur les attaques mais ça c'est trop personnel pour le mettre vraiment en négatif).
-Les quêtes secondaires ne sont pas interessantes.
-L'histoire est très (trop?) basique : vous êtes le bien, vous combattez le mal, point.
-Le système de craft est lui aussi lent, et inninteressant, en particulier pour les potion, on préfèrera même acheter des potions au prix cher que de les crafter gratuitement vu le temps que ça prend.

Bref, l'un dans l'autre, je dirais que c'est pas un mauvais jeu en soi, mais tellement sur-évalué que je ne peux décemment pas le recomander.

总之等续杯吧....

39222083.review:
I want to like this game. but sadly i cant. It has all the right peices but never fits them together nicely 4/10
So Positives:
The art and design is Amazing 10/10 its really the hook of this game

Negatives:

The crafting system is interesting but ultimatly redundant( if ur grinding in this game, save urself the trouble and just steam roll the storyline, anything u make will imediatly get out classed and prolly doesnt have the stats u want to build into anyway)

Exp gains stop after uve over leveled the monsters. so if u set a dungeon to legendary on ur first go ull have out leveled the region by the time uve finished making repeats pointless/tedious

The Music is un engaging. its like the composer didnt want to be heard, and nothing kills an epic boss fight like quiet peaceful music. its the whole game, un-assuming to nonexistant even the final boss doesnt get anything weighty.

Story: Characters dont get developed at all, u get a few lines of exposition ham-fisted in and off u go to do an epic quest that non of the character even have a stake in (most of the game its "lets just find our friends and leave"). they have ecent Voice Actors that they barely use and when they do the dialogue is so cut together u feel like everyones having a conversation to themselves.

oh and the bosses are a cake walk its the stupid power-combos of minions that will get u.

TLDR: All the right ideas All the wrong execution. 
Should u get it? prolly not unless u really like banging ur head against a wall dungeon crawlers
Will i get the next one if they do battlechasers 2? Yes because i think they can get it right

39219588.review:
Ну что могу сказать, после всего времени проведённого в игре, в целом только положительное))
Неплохой представитель в Jrpg жанре, что для TIQ не свойственно, насколько мне изветсно, тем не менее люди делавшие игру постарались на славу,  ( Airship Syndicate респект и уважение), из плюсов могу отметить, красивую картинку, глаз не мылится, рисовка декораций и окружающего мира на высоте, боевая система почти полностью копирует основыне элементы игр жанра Jrpg, например игр серии Final Fantasy, но тут она немного упрощена, в угоду времени наверно, без особых тонкостей и заморочек, которые так любят японцы, сюжет незатейлев и прост, без какого либо вау* или вот это поворот* эффекта, но тем немение, заставляет переживать героям и ощущать своё участие в происходящем, понравилась фишка с данжами, отдельные локации в виде подземелий с различной степенью сложности, опять же, люди которые над этим работали, подошли с явным знанием дела, ну или большой долей интузиазма, что бы не спойлерить, скажу так, за всё время игры, мне не встретилось ни одного одинакового подземелья, каждый раз что то новое, регенерация уровней и событий работает на ура!, так же по всей игре разбросанно достаточное количество секреток, некоторые в виде карт сокровищь, и привязаны как правило к каким то локациям, некоторые нужно искать или открывать по мере прохождения, что позволяет глубже погрузится в мир игры, и насладится ей с полна.

Но не без минусов, мне не очень понравилось постоянное принуждение к качу, игра как бы говорит, ты должен фармить хр, больше, боооольшеее, а после капа по лвл, интерес пропадает, надеюсь с длс кап повысят хотя бы на 10ку, разачаровал и город, наше основное место дислокации, нпц там присутствующие, практически бесполезны, у кузнеца вечно нечего покупать, кроме рецептов для крафта, которые становятся не нужны после 2-3 лвл, да и в данжах можно шмот поднять, алхимической лавкой почти не пользовался, надеюсь на нг+ в ней будет больший спрос, лавка наложения чар, то же как то не особо зашла, ближе ко второй половине игры, в общем тут, по всем пунктам минус, как по мне.

Ох, чуть не забыл, рыбалка, вот где можно отвести душу, к слову сказать, тут это не просто какой то второстипенный процесс, рыбалка тут приносит реальную пользу, так что, только самые лучшие удочки, и самая вкусная  наживка)))

7.5 из 10

Where the hell did this game come from?
This is a traditional old school RPG with current artstyle based on a comic from the 90s from a developer that does not make RPGs... WHY IS THIS GAME AS GOOD AS IT IS?

I'm not gonna say it is flawless, crafting is a mess and the game desperately needs a fast forward feature like PC versions of Final Fantasy games have

But this game is very good despite that!, its traditional RPG, not the current millenia bullshit of games being called RPGs just cause they have leveling and gear... combat can be as tough as you want, literally, dungeons have 3 difficulties and while normal monsters are kinda easy, the bosses are rightfully more interesting and somewhat challenging if you are not ready.

If you somehow knew abbout battle chasers before get it right away, otherwise it can wait for a discount unless you need an urgent fix of good ol' modern retro RPG.

Yaşı tutanlar bu diyeceklerimi anlar.. 90'lı yılların başlarında ve ortalarında gameboy ile iyi-kötü haşır neşir olmuşların "(elde etmek zor, Almanya'dan gelen eş dost akraba ya da babası yurt dışına çıkmış kerataların  ellerinde bik bik bik oynadığı sizin ise eve dönüp dandik tetrise talim ettiğiniz o günlerin teknolojik harikası mobil oyun konsolu)" bir şekilde denk geldiği jrpg tarzı oyunların günümüze uyarlanmış hali..çok da özgür olmayan haritasında belirli güzergahlarda gezip, karşınıza random yaratık gelip kestiğiniz bilindik jrpg oyunlarını bildiniz di mi? hani şu pokemonun ülkede kasırga gibi estiği ve pc ye uyarlanmış gameboy emulator lerle oynadığınız o tür...işte tam olarak bu şekilde anlatılabilir. bu türün içinde barındırdığı 'sıra tabanlı' olgusunu da unutmamak lazım tabi..klasik heroes migt and magic benzeri battle sahneleri vardır ilgililerine duyrulur..

Hikayesine gelince oyunu henüz 40 dk kadar oynamış biri olarak net birşey söyleyemeyeceğim..tahminlerimi ve baştaki gelişmeleri şimdilik kendime saklayacağım..

Oynanış oldukça basit ve sizi yormayan bir yapıya sahip.. ister mouse la click babam click yapın isterseniz klavyeden yönlendirin..pc başındaki yayılma şeklinize göre rahatlıkla karakterleri kontrol edebiliyorsunuz..8989898 tuşa birden basıp kombo çekmek isteyen arkadaşlar varsa şimdiden söyleyeyim büyük hayal kırıklığı yaşatır.

Müzikler efsane olmuş.. fantastik kurgu ve dungeon ortamına kesinlikle ritim tutan bir atmosfer oluşturyor size..huzur ve gerilim iç içe..

Ufaktan da karakter çizimlerine geçecek olursak, zaten çizgi romandan uyarlama.. karakterler kendi klasmanlarına uygun tipler ve çizgileri mest ediyor... ufak çaplı çizgi roman havasını bozmadan biraz torchlight 2 yi de andırmadı değil bana...neyse özetle, kısa süreli tecrübeme göre bu oyunu öneririm arkadaşlar... en azından şans verin derim..indirimdeyken aldım şanslıydım ancak olmasaydı da parasını hak eden bir oyun olduğunu düşünmekteyim..yardımcı olabildiysem ne mutlu..almış olanlara ve alacak olanlara şimdiden iyi eğlenceler...

39177911.review:
This is a game that will undoubtedly give the old timers Jrpg fans a good fix of nostalgia. The game boasts a lot of what drawn me to the genre 20 smth years ago. Simple but well crafted mechanics which gives the game all its depth. 
But let's try to be concise :

PROs:
-Easy to understand, yet rich and gratifying to master battle system.
-Challenging... the first half of the game.
-The story while neither original or really compeling, benefits from a straightforward and efficient storytelling.
-Great art, from the comic like cutscenes to the carrefuly crafted battle animations.
-Enough content to fit the prizetag, especially if you engage in the various sidquests.

CONs:
-Halfway through the game the difficulty really starts nosediving. The battles changes a lot, going from pretty long drawn out startegic batlles, toward straightfowrward slaughterfests. You rarelly need more than two rounds to wraps things up. A bit a of a letdown here.
-And that's pretty much it...

As you see the good seem to far outweight the bad, yet i can stress enough how much the difficulty drop lessened the experience for me. 
Still a very good niche-game overall.

39155306.review:
One of the top RPG's ive played to date. I've played most the good ones (The FF series, Chrono Trigger, Mario RPG, etc)
The animations are fluid and aesthetically pleasing to the eye. With the combination of the sweet visuals and great gameplay it hooked me instantly. There is great story writing going on with this game which will get you invested in finding the lore pieces, the perks you get for being invested in the lore and fighting enemies was a huge plus for me as most games of the past never really had a system of this calibre.

With all that being said the depth of the gameplay is immense. I found myself trying different perk builds and combinations between characters to get the most broken effects possible or just finding a fun way to take down groups of enemies at once. There are tons of combo potentials and party variations between how you spend your perk points between each character. Not once did I think any character wasnt viable. Battle Chasers: Nightwar has done an excellent job on making sure each character brings something unique to the fights or dungeon explorations.

There are tons of puzzles and secrets in the game that make you go off the mainquest to do and upgrade your characters proficiency in battle. Lots of boss fights and different mechanics to take into account, its never stagnant.

Excellent RPG and goes down in my top 3.
10/10 Would recommend.

39128769.review:
Edit *My review of this game currently remains largely unchanged at this time. However, if you view the comments on this review, you'll see that the developer addresses many of my concerns in a future patch that has not yet gone live. As such, I've changed my review to recommending the game and plan to revisit it in the future.*

Having spent about 15 hours on this game, I think I've reached my limit with it. Maybe I should have known what I was getting into with a JRPG but the grind in this game is significant and not terribly interesting. All the parts of this game that look great: combat, style, story, characters; they are great. The part that isn't great is that every time you finish a story beat, you have to complete a dungeon. And often, you'll have to complete that dungeon at least twice (or grind on the world map, or grind the fishing minigame) in order to be sufficiently powered for the next one.

If you like grinding, almost nothing I have to say will be a problem for you. Literally, almost everything else is great. Here are the small list of things that aren't:

You can only have three characters in your party at a time and the benched party members do not gain passive experience. If you're already wearing thin on the grind, you definitely won't be swapping party members as you need to take those underleveled teammates into dungeons to level them up to be effective again.

The game can sometimes not be very forthcoming with gear for a specific character, leaving you in a lurch of crafting/swapping characters, both of which can demand a fair amount of grinding.

Spots of high difficulty aren't very well labeled and you may find yourself feeling stuck between a rock and a hard place simply because it's not clear that you probably shouldn't be where you are.

If none of that is a problem for you, you will like this game. Simply put, it isn't a game that I have the fortitude or the time to finish.

39122841.review:
It was great to start with but I've really hit a wall at level 10 that has totally taken my will to play away. 

Basically they seriously beef up the enemy damage values so you go from playing an early final fantasy to playing a version of Shin Megami Tensei in terms of your ability to survive fights. Then it gave me a sidequest that was not possible for my team to complete that took half (~250) my gold away when i died to the boss I had zero chance of beating. Which really stops you wanting to take risks and explore when you get about 10g per fight!

Oh and there's a terrible "random loot" system rather than a thought out curve of getting useful appropriate stuff, so if you find yourself stuck with a few greens well below your level you're just stuffed and underpowered unless you go back and grind dungeons for loot crates.

I mean, it's beautiful and has lots of character and energy, but it can be very abritrary and is then super punishing due to that.

Caveat Emptor, I guess. If you're really looking for a turn based RPG Persona 5 is out on PS4, and it's better on every front.

39103334.review:
A few things I like about this game:

1) Your characters' abilities aren't just many barely-different ways to do X damage.  Most attacks and abilities have implications, and if you've put together a good party and have a good idea what to do, you'll spend little time tossing out filler attacks.  Once you get a good cadence going, it feels nice.

2) Gear matters.  It's not like the kind of game where you gain a pile of gear and maybe +1% combat ability every half an hour; you grind for a bit and get some significant upgrades, and things really change.  Likewise, some of the perks you get later on open up some interesting new strategic options.

3) They're not afraid to toss harrowing battles at you, and see if you can do it.  Some fights can be a beast until you either outlevel or outsmart them.  The difficulty escalates and the game expects you to catch up.  Though it's not punishing, it encourages you to think.

4) Personally, I prefer a game where grinding is an option, even if it's required to progress - I'd say it is here - to one where it's not an option or not needed.  Here it comes in the form of repeating a dungeon run on a higher difficulty with better rewards, rather than running in circles waiting for screen shatters like an old JRPG.  The dungeons are fun enough to do twice and they're at least slightly different every time.

I'd take points off for a sort of humdrum story, at least as far as I've seen (here we go, another dark so-and-so who wants some sort of dark power... how dark), but I frankly care less about that.  That's what movies are for.

39092954.review:
ファミコン世代には値段相応に遊べるのではないか？という程度にお勧めできます。移動が遅すぎたりアイテム作成が面倒だったりと最近のゲームに慣れていると厳しいと思います。
肝心の中身ですが、古いタイプのMMORPGのように想定したとおりにプレイして下さいといったような作りで装備がLV制限でしかもワンランク上になるだけで性能がインフレしていく（敵と同レベルか以下だと敵も雑魚敵の攻撃で１～３発で倒されるくらい強い）ので工夫ではどうにもならない場合が多いです（１戦１戦は当然勝てますが宿を挟まずに連戦などを考えるなら）。そして戦闘は3人でPT外メンバーは経験値が入らない為いろいろなキャラクターを入れ替えて遊ぶのは単純にレベリングの時間が増えるだけで非推奨です。敵の攻撃が苛烈なのでメンバー固定してやられる前にやるほうが進めやすいと思います。シンボルエンカウント方式なので移動が遅いのがここでも苦痛です。
ここまで否定的な意見をしましたがそれでも2000円で純RPGっぽいこの作品はFCやSFCで遊んでた私にはたまらないです、漫画の不人気作品の打ち切りエンドみたいなのが気になりますが続編が出るのかもと期待して待ちます。

39092677.review: Pretty well put-together JRPG style game! I like it.

39092433.review:
Per quanto io mi sforzi, non riesco a dare un voto positivo a questo gioco; va detto che presenta diversi aspetti positivi, a mio avviso però insufficenti, vado a spiegare.

La veste grafica stile cartoon è eccellente; nulla da dire a riguardo, anche se non amate lo stile di per sè, qui resterete almeno convinti.
Il sonoro rispecchia perfettamente gli standard che vi aspettereste da uno strategico a turni stile jappo, azzeccati e di circostanza; niente di esaltante dal comparto doppiaggio, questo perchè i dialoghi doppiati sono veramente pochi, ma comunque buoni.
La giocabilità è il vero punto dolente. Iniziamo dalla gestione dei personaggi; non amo le statistiche a "rating", sono sempre poco chiare e qui la cosa non rappresenta l'eccezzione. Perchè dare a un oggetto per esempio, 100 critical rating? Non si capisce a quanto corrisponda, e col level up il valore cambia la propria resa; è vero che equipaggiandolo possiamo notare l'aumento di statistica, ma non sarebbe stato MOLTO più semplice scrivere +1% critico?
Le abilità dei personaggi; ottima la varietà, tante skill, diversi effetti e ben 3 finisher per ciascun eroe... ma proprio in virtù di ciò, risultano poco bilanciate, alcune le userete ogni fight, altre vi scorderete della loro esistenza.
Il sistema di leveling; in poche parole, grind noioso e finalizzato al solo scopo di ottenere XP. Nota a parte il fatto che avrete un roster di 6 personaggi e solo quelli attivi (ovvero 3 alla volta) ottengono XP, fastidioso ma aggirabile grindando con due pg alti e uno basso un dungeon di livello alto (noia a parte). Concludo la discussione sui personaggi dicendo che dei 6 disponibili, mi sembra che alcuni siano nettamente più forti di altri, ma su questo potrei aver sperimentato poco quindi non ci metto la mano sul fuoco.
Difficoltà; risibile per la prima run anche a livello di difficoltà più alto (leggo recensioni di persone che piangono per l'eccessiva difficoltà... vorrei capire a cosa hanno giocato, spero si riferissero a qualche versione alpha tarata male); con la modalità NG+ migliora la difficoltà, finalmente rappresenta una sfida, ma solo all'inizio, poi la curva precipita e vi ritroverete a un gioco dove con pochi accorgimenti sarete nuovamente imbattibili.
Trama poco sviluppata, sviluppo personaggi relegato a qualche sporadico dialogo durante la fase di riposo, in generale banalotta e confusionaria, sicuramente non un punto di forza.
Sistema di crafting; si rivela utile soprattutto a causa di quello che io reputo essere un difetto di game design; ovvero, siete in un dungeon con 3 personaggi e vi capiterà di droppare oggetti per gli altri 3. Tutto calcolato? Forse si, in generale comunque vi ritroverete a craftare spesso, e visto il grind richiesto per levellare, difficilmente sarete a corto di materiali se li utilizzerete con attenzione. Insomma il craft funziona e anche abbastanza bene, ma a mio avviso per il motivo sbagliato.
Piccola postilla sui nemici: troppo pochi e soprattutto poco vari; cambiare il colore di una skin non basta!

In conclusione è il tipico gioco per molti ma non per tutti, si presenta subito accattivante, grafica che cattura ed elementi tipici del genere. Poi però escono i difetti, la trama annoia e vi ritroverete a farmare dungeon inutili, riducendo quindi un gioco promettende a una questione di grind che diventa noiosa velocemente; peccato, con un po' di lavoro in più poteva diventare molto ma molto meglio.

39078879.review:
This was a purchase that happened quite suddenly. I saw it in the store, noticed the charming similarities to Final Fantasy, Breath of Fire, and other turn-based RPGs of yore and took a chance. I'm glad I did.

For those players who complain about having to grind out a few levels/good gear, there is no hope. RPGs are not for you. These type of games encourage exploration, re-exploration, and aiming for the best. If you want your characters doing incredible damage, it takes time and effort, and this is reflected in the gameplay. There are 6 playable characters, each with a substantial amount of depth in their skills, special abilities, and battle bursts. This game can be a walk in the park if you choose to make it so, but setting it to legendary difficulty will stretch any player.

EXAMPLE 1: I was kicking major butt at lvl 8, I thought I had good gear, and my party was strong. Lvl 10 slime hunt in the sewers? Give me a challenge! 15 minutes later, my party emerged, beaten and broken. Lesson learned: don't over-estimate your abilities.

EXAMPLE 2: Spent an hour farming Mana Rifts for a few pieces of gear. I'd worn myself pretty thin and thought I'd quickly run back to town after the boss and replenish my potions. An airship passing by had other ideas. The scurvy crew aboard laughed at my pathetic attempts to beat them and soundly thrashed me. Next lesson learned: always be prepared.

This is a wonderful game with plenty of challenge, lots of achievements to aim for (the bestiary... ugh) and a storyline worthy of your time.

Do yourself a favour, put your patience in a box and immerse yourself in this great game. For the price, I doubt you will be disappointed.

39065552.review:
An excellent RPG.

The gameplay and mechanics are well thought out and have a logic that makes it fun to keep going through the game.
The battles are challenging enough to be engaging, and levelling up, crafting items, and doing side quests is very rewarding.

There are some personal disappointments.  These aren't really cons to the game, unless you agree with my own logic, I just feel they give room for improvement if a sequel is done, and I hope one is:

- Heavy re-use of assets.  Now pretty much all  j-style rpgs will have their blue slimes, green slimes, and gold slimes, but this game shows it had a budget with how relatively few unique kinds of monsters there are.  There's really only 3 'groups' or 'factions' of monsters.  All of the dungeons fall into these 3 categories or a mix of them.  The good news, is that even though assets are getting re-cycled, the abilities and how the monsters feel does change up, keeping the battles interesting regardless.

- Character development.  The characters are all awesome with good personalities, but there's not much real development between them and the world.  They're cool at the start, and they're cool at the end, that's it.  I guess you need to refer to the comics if you want to see growth in the characters, which I do recommend, they were quite good, albeit unfinished.

- Character Choice.  The characters only level when you fight with them.  And since you can only have 3 in a team, it basically means you might as well just pick 3 and stick with them.  Levelling the others turns out to be a chore with no real reward other than switching up playstyles, but because you have to fight more for each character you use, the switching up playstyles loses its value.  It's a 'change of pace' that ends up being slower than if you didn't change the pace at all.

- Dungeon Difficulties.  Another tell-tale sign of the limited budget these guys were working with.  You basically have to run each dungeon twice.  You run it once on normal, then again on hard, just to get enough levels to be ready for the next dungeon's normal difficulty.  I was hoping it was set up in a way where the hardest settings for the dungeons were intended as end-game content, but they're not, they're actually just bridging the gap in levels from one dungeon to the next, which I feel is a great example of making extra work for the player just to make the game longer and feel like it has 'more content', when really they're just making you play longer.

Even with these disappointments, all in all the game was awesome and I whole heartedly recommend it to any who enjoy the turn based battle genre, this was definitely one of the better ones I've played recently.

8/10

39062917.review:
This won't be a fancy review.  Simply put, the game isn't balanced numerically very well.  Once you hit level 10, all the monsters and especially the bosses jump in power.  Unless you got extremely lucky with drops, you will be grinding trivial content for a couple hours to overpower things that will be under your level.  This is not fun.  It's badly implimented time gating in a single player RPG.  The the curve of power was more gradual I wouldn't have minded some grinding.  But enemies went from being very minor challeges at best to one shotting my characters.  I feel like I wasted my time and money on this game.

To nitpick the story for the first very small portion of the game, I came in blind and knew nothing of battle chasers beforehand.  The intro did nothing to get me to understand these characters or make them endearing in anyway.  Garrison just comes off as brash, short tempered and rude.  Gully might have some character later on, but she's not given enough to do or enough dialogue early on to really give any strong impression into her character.  And the robot is just a bland parenting personality.

The character selection seem incredibly limited and I don't think I would ever be able to remove the golem from the party.  His healing is too essential.  Gully seems like the main focus of the story, and a frontliner to take damage, so you really only have one spot to play around with.  That might change later on, but it doesn't give me any hope to enjoying the party further on.

39062713.review:
Amazing game, the revitalization of a classic jrpg style combined with art style of Joe Madureira (Darksiders) is working very very good. Dungeons are nice and offers a lot of play time, even worth revisiting for materials and xp.
Characters are interesting and quite versatile, progress is very rewarding and fights are cool from level 1. 
I thought initally that only a party of 3 chars will be dull, but no such thing. Skills, talents and gear all lead to choices and different paths. 
Mobs are very well done and AI is doing a good job overall. You'll be hit with abilities and skills which will make you rethink the strategy, and that is a strong point.
Technical stuff: works very well, minor bugs (attack power stat display for instance), some mobs blocked in textures but nothing major. Controls are ok, nothing special. Music and graphics are top notch. 
Personal opinion, I don't like the map style and gameplay, but dungeons and fights are very pleasing.
Game is addictive and very immersive and story is pretty cool.  
95/100 only because I don't like map gameplay. Get this gem, you'll not regret it.

39022172.review:
This is a worthy game.

However, there are a few things that that could be implemented as a quality-of-life change.
1. EXP sharing
I wish exp was gained for those outside the immediate party. When I run into a boss that requires a party reformation, I have to spend a lot of extra time leveling them up. 
2. Difficulty
Legendary mode does not live up to its name. Besides Deadwatch, which had those insane grave wardens running amok. It is also disturbing that the enemies in encounters are 4 levels higher but when I get to the boss he is 2 levels lower. Finally, I discovered you can escape a dungeon by doing "save and quit to main menu" and when you load it, it places you outside the dungeon. But that takes time. It would be easier if there was an escape rope kind of thing from pokemon.
3. Quick Save/Load
I don't see any other reviewers writing about this, so maybe I am missing something, but if there was a quick sdave/load feature it would be grand. For example, let's say I want to craft an epic item at 30%. If I fail, it would be cool if I could quick load and try again. This is a silly example, but you get what I mean.
4. World map, camera
Can we get some labels on there. 
The camera does not go as far as I want when exploring the world
5. Fountains
I don't know if this is intended but I wish the fountains that give buffs tell you what those buffs do before you drink them.
6. Bugs
Some stores I can't open the equip menu without leaving the store.
When crafting, some places it doesn't show how many you already have.
When I load in, the burst meter is empty
