39015964.review:
1st of all, I defeated the Final Boss in just 3 rounds......so anti climactic, but it was my own fault as i was using level Max(30) characters with 100+Perk Points and with Legendary Weapons + Max Gears (Debateable). I don't usually write a review for a game but because i like this game so much, gonna give it some hard love.

Story : 7/10 
- If you really pay attention, the story and lore is quite good but as for me, there was a hit and miss at some times. Most of the time it's because of my mood or the music which i will talk about later. 70% of the time i just skipped the lores because i just want to collect them for the rewards.

Music : 5/10
- Its decent. Lets just say i turned off the master volume and put on spotify after 3 hours. 

Voice Acting : 9/10
- It is really good! if i turned off the volume, i would replay the scene just to listen to the voice acting. All is good except Alumon which sometimes sounded like two different voice actors with different talents.

Mission : 10/10
- Its not open world so theres nothing wrong here. Get from Point A to Point B, plus you do get some side missions which are fun to do.

Characters : Interesting but "meh"
- I like the characters but they kinda felt flat. Example : Knolan, i don't know a thing about Knolan except that he is a angry old mage with a soft heart. that's all, theres nothing there to make the characters stand out to me. like if you ask me anything about the characters, i could only say the 1st impression i got from them and nothing more. Alumon, he is the one character i wanted to use since the 1st time i saw him in the intro but you get him in the late game and found out, he is not that much better than the 1st 3 characters that you used. thats another problem, when you get a new character, they are not the same level as the characters you are using, hence you need to level them up. i was level 15 when i 1st got Knolan which was level 9 like What The Furret? more on that later.

Dungeon : Fun but....
- The dungeons are fun because they procedurally generated and that makes grinding them less stressful but i will say that the Dungeon Events need fixing and 2 of the later Dungeons needs reworked or fixing.

RPG-ness : Its Good
- The Skill and Perk system is good and you can create a godlike character with a certain build with the correct types of equipments (I KO'ed the Final Boss using Garrison with 1 attack and 1 Burst Skill [Totalling in 3 Rounds])

Quest Logs : Needs adjustments
- Main Quest logs is fine but the side quest like the hunts needs to have some sort of log to read back on. Example : Legendary Weapons. You get all the clues for the weapons in 1 place at 1 time. so to remember all of them especially for the characters you don't use is kinda hard because theres no log or notes about them. Am i missing something here? because before the final boss i decided to collect the legendary weapons for the other characters but i can't seem to find anything to look back to. so the internet guide gods helped me there. not a big problem but something to improve upon.

Dungeon Skills : 
- Monica and Knolan's dungeon skills is as useless as trying to use Calibretto's Cannon Shot at close range (and sometimes even at long range)

Visuals : 10/10
- Nice style and beautiful background

Others:
- The game is actualy pretty short IMHO for a rpg, i played for 67.3 Hours based on my Saved Game stats but thats filled with alt+tab-ing out to watch Youtube or do something else and lots of it are from grinding a certain early Dungeon Event item or trying to grind some parts (which i later found out it was easier to just move on to the next area). lets just say you could speed run this at less than half of my time. NOT SAYING IT IS A SHORT GAME but it is pretty short for me because it is a RPG adventure game.
- I wish there was more skins for the characters, i only used the 1st 3 characters that you got for the entire game. i tested and tried the other characters and felt that the main 3 is better. so to makes things not looking dull or boring, i bought the skins for the 3 main characters and yay it keeps things spicy, until you get bored of them too. 
- The Collector, i avoided buying anything from him except fishing gears because i was afraid it would make the characters IMBA. which i was correct, i only bought fishing gears and the 3 skins (300) so i had lots of coins left, partly because i like grinding those airships. In the late game, because i have so many of the coins, i bought the perk books, i never bought anything else but only the perk books, and its only the perks books for the characters i was using. and man those perk books made my Garrison a God Of War type character that can dish out 4k damage crit, 2k damage regular attack, 4k confirmed damage on berserk. and thats how i breeze thru the late game. The Farseer i got 1 turn KO with Garrison and his level 3 burst skill.
- For the developers 
: PLEASE FIX OR CHANGE THE EVENT DUNGEON WHERE THE EXCLAMATION MARK ON THE MAP GOES AWAY IF YOU DONE OR SOLVED THE DUNGEON EVENT
: *Spoiler Alert* Alumon using Blood Magic IS NOT A PLOT TWIST OR SHOCKING REVELATION
- The Ending was so-so with a sequel bait to add salt to the wound

Final Thoughts:
- Bought at a Discount, so that's a plus for me, at full price i could not recommend this game, sorry. but at a discount? HELL YEAH!
- Did i have fun?  Answer = Yes
- Will you play again for the NG+? Answer = Maybe, if im bored or have nothing else to do because the only thing they provide for NG+ is a new difficulty setting.
- Would you give this game an award? Answer = No, because it lacks something to make it stand out. Lets just say that i probably enjoy playing FF7 today than this game. Good Effort tho
- Does this game scratch that RGP itch? Answer = Yes, kinda.
- Are you interested in the sequal? Answer = Yes, kinda.


Edited on 07.01.2018 (*Spoiler Warning*) :
- I've started playing the NG+, I'm several hours in and sorry to say, NG+ is broken.
- I didn't know the review section has limits so let me make it brief with the problems im facing
- You need to have Gully in your team if you don't want to miss out on loot in the dungeon and that means you can only swap 2 characters
- Knolan, Monika, Alumon are garbage compared to Callibretto or Garrison in terms of dealing damage or healing
- If you're using the garbage characters like me trying to spice things up in NG+, good luck finding equipments for them in the loots in the early game (I used them until level 16 and none of them are better than the main 3 characters)
- NG+ does not offer anything new except the monsters are higher in level
- The pirate ship is impossible to beat because they will always be 4 levels higher and i don't care what sort of equipments you have, they will always have the very high advatange in terms of stats. I think you can beat them when you finally able to craft and enchant your equipments to the max or max lvl but yeah, getting there....no thanks.

All in all, i would still recommend this game for RPG lovers but ONLY at a discounted price, i bought it at a 50% discount and NOW i think thats still a little bit too much for this game.
-

38974283.review:
I am not really the type for writing reviews, but this game deserves one. In my opinion one of the best games in this year 2017 for casual gamers! Thank you Airship Syndicate!

I read an article on gamestar about this game and put in my wishlist for serveral weeks. After it was in sale, I bought it and started playing it just by chance. That was right before christmas and after finishing the campaign (for the first time) today, I suppose it is a very fine christmas present!

I'm the type casual gamer, which starts playing a game, puts the entertainment to top priority and doesn't get sad when the game becomes boring and therefore gets dusty in my game library. I had my fun even if I didn't finish the game and it has been ages since I had a game which I urged to finish (due to irregularity in play time, too much content or too much grind). With Battle Chasers: Nightwar this changed in the last week. This game is so fun that I could not stop playing it until I saw the end.

Pro:

- right amount of grind for casual gamers: not so much that it gets annoying and not so little that it gets too easy and too fast earned
- right amount of complexity in character building: just deep enough that you have to think and spend some time about your builds but don't have to start a bachelor study of the game   
- simple but entertaining and not too detailed story, perfect balance of linear and freedom-based gameplay (side quest, fishing, treasure hunt, arena, ultimate weapon building, boss hunting) 
- beautiful graphics and art works
- good voice acting
- stable and almost (99,9%) bugfree (which is sadly not natural today)

Contra:

- Dungeon "Crimson Gardens" is way too long, especially if you have to play it multiple times for finding the right blood fountain (4 runs, after the 3rd I fought it was a bug)
- the difficulty level is fluctuating too much (gets it peek just until you find Alumon and after that it becomes too easy, especially after getting your first ultimate weapon)

I hope the developers will provide more content in the future and will trigger the rare occasion that I buy some DLCs ;). Again, thank you for the game and the fun!

38974105.review: 早先关注这款游戏，是看了商店页面的视频，画面精良，动作流畅，打击感爆表，而游戏自身素质也的确如此。但是，当我进游戏遭遇到的第一个敌人是个叫史莱姆的生物时，我眉头一紧，发现并不简单。果然，这游戏肝的成分太多了，战斗节奏拖沓先不说，由于前面没刷等级，导致今天越级打了个副本，小怪明明只比我高两级，却把我打得死去活来。七个小时见到了视频里的双枪辣妹，用了一阵子发现并不好用，每次潜行对面都是群伤，明明点了暴击天赋却打不出暴击，弃了，换回战士放血玩吧，结果发现战士等级已经被队友拉开一截。其实这些也都忍了，让我决心给差评的是，我一支平均等级17级的队伍，做主线的途中遇到一只二十级牧师小怪，小怪加盾还有时髦拉风的受伤回血，三位壮士一轮暴打下来，对面血满了。周旋了20分钟，他依旧活蹦乱跳，我怂了，逃了，删了。如果你喜欢刷刷刷的话，这款游戏会令你满意，但是，我不喜欢。

38931875.review:
Got this while on sale, am blown away by what I got.

This game is exciting to play, with beautiful graphics and a great soundtrack. It's too slow (easily remedied with cheat engine's speedhack), and you'll have a total of 6 characters, with great mechanics that seem to feed off one another. Each character has perks (talents) that you can cross and choose to create a character of your ideal design, vastly changing some of the effects of some of the skills.
Alot of how easy the game is will come down to gear, and strangely, levels. The first 17 levels was pretty tough for me, but after that, it was ridiculously easy. I'd replay this for sure, but I probably need a break after burning through it in 27 or so hours.

If it's on sale, or you enjoy rpgs, pick this game up. It's a gem, well worth adding to any collection. It starts off abit slow, but easily gets more and more fun with the full party. Back up party members do not get exp, but they catch up to your level extremely quickly.

I'd give this game an 8/10.

38903345.review:
Ich liebe dieses Spiel. Es hat mich von Anfang an in seinen Bann gezogen. Der Grafikstil ist absolut meins, die Story ist interessant, die Charaktere sehr liebenswürdig. Der absolute Hammer aber ist das geniale Kampfsystem. Das macht wirklich sehr viel Spaß und trotz der altbekannten JRPG Mechanik spielt es sich herzhaft erfrischend, anders und neu. 
Die Charaktere schalten mit jedem Levelup neue Fähigkeiten frei, zusätzlich kann man mit den sogenannten Vorteilspunkten individuell skillen.
Ich mag die Mischung aus dem Herumlaufen auf der Weltkarte mit den Kämpfen und dem Erkunden der Dungeons. Es gibt soviel zu entdecken.
Der einzige Kritikpunkt ist das manchmal etwas nervige Grinden im Endgame, aber da das Kampfsystem so viel Spaß macht, ist das zu verschmerzen. Blöd ist nur, dass immer nur die Charaktere leveln, die in der aktuellen Gruppe sind und so also auch kämpfen. Es gibt insgesamt 6 Gruppenmitglieder (die nach und nach freigeschaltet werden), allerdings kann man immer nur 3 in der aktuellen Gruppe mitnehmen. Möchte man also auch im Endgame immer die Wahl haben und problemlos wechseln können, muss noch mehr gegrindet werden, um alle Figuren immer auf dem gleichen Level zu halten - das hätte man vielleicht besser lösen können.
Vielleicht in der Fortsetzung, auf die ich wirklich inständig hoffe. Denn Battle Chasers: Nightwar hat (trotz seines bescheuerten Namens) mein Herz im Sturm erobert!
Absolute Kaufempfehlung, auch zum Vollpreis (oder gerade zum Vollpreis, schließlich wollen wir ein Sequel ;) )

38891477.review:
This was a refreshing game for me as I usually avoided turn based games, feeling like it makes for stale combat. But it was actually quite good for the most part. Other parts of the game kept me well entertained, such as the art style and soundtrack, which paired together nicely. The story was told fairly well and made me interested in the world, though I feel like the plot devices that kept you constantly moving to other parts of the overworld harmed the games flow. 

I can divide the game into 3 parts mentally. The beggining, where I felt enthralled and entertained by the world. The middle where I felt almost sad thinking that it could end soon. Then the final part where I wish it ended earlier. The game tended to drag at the end, where you are tempted by completion and upgrades that would ultimately make the end fight way too easy. 

Looking back at the rest of the game, I'm glad I played it. It was full of charm and good intentions, would love to see the issues I raised addressed in a sequel. I think this game was pretty good for a modern turn based RPG, whereas before I thought it to be a dead and out-dated system. It changed my perspective on the genre and has hopefully opened me up to enjoying more games like it in the future.

38852035.review:
[b]tl;dr[/b] - didn't finish, still enjoyed


Really enjolyed the comic-book style [b]art[/b], lent itself to lovely environments with nice color grading.  Also the concept of running across the map to get to different places worked quite well.

The music is pretty good too, nice [b]ambient[/b] tones as you're exploring and subdued beats during combat, I actually found even the combat could be quite relaxing.

The [b]characters[/b] are all interesting in their own way, though Gully/Calibretto reminded me of the two mains from Full Metal Alchemist; Garrison reminded me of Guts from Berserk. You can choose from six, and I did try working with different party combos, however the original trio was what kept working for me. 

At some areas I would notice a significant [b]fps drop[/b], and alt-tabbing out and back to the game would fix it.  I tried this on three different computers with the same result.  There's also a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/451020/discussions/0/1474222595297831465/]thread where you can post your specs[/url] for the devs to investigate. 

The not so good - The [b]level progression[/b] in the game is at odds with the actual story, so you will find yourself having to grind by running around the map or repeating dungeons before proceeding.  Many people don't actually mind it, so it's not a negative for all.  It's one of the things that "you're supposed to know".

[b]Loot[/b] is also at odds with your party members, for example I got a disproportionate amount of drops for Alumon, who I didn't play.  

Unfortunately the [b]grind[/b] and lack of gear drops did eventually get to me and I gave up at the final boss fight - if you have a look at discussion threads you will see the usual unhelpful [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9nDagqKL7Q]'git gud' style[/url] paraphrasing with people who have one shotted it with fully kitted out party members.  Ah well.


So - recommended but with some reluctance; it's a fun journey to go through.  Do watch some gameplay videos first, as many people also find the fighting animation style tedious after the initial novelty has worn off, I liked it though!

battle chasers is a turn based rpg. based off the comics.

pros - beautiful graphics and great sound
- fantastic animations and art style.
- interesting characters
- total flexbiility in how you level your character, you can move points in and out of any skill tree and not get locked in.
-replayability by offering the option of replaying dungeons on higher difficulty for better loot chance.
-uncomplicated crafting system

cons - you can only play with 3 characters at a time so the other 3 don't get exp. This seems to be in a attempt to give the game replayability through NG+ though I felt it was limiting to not be able to have more variety swapping heroes and experimenting through playing the first time through.

summary - really fun game, there isn't a "grind" as some people say, just doing the main story line and side quests I was at level cap before the end. I didn't find the battles repetitive because of how fluid the combat is.

38804137.review:
Short version: Excellent game with beautiful artwork and atmosphere and extremely well executed combat. Biggest complaint: insanely sexualized female characters.

Pros:
[list]
[*]Such. Good. Combat. Great variation of combat styles between different characters. Customizable without being overwhelming.
[*]Atmosphere is excellent. Environments are excellent. Artwork is excellent.
[*]Exploration was fresh and innovative. Excellent incentive to check every nook and cranny of a dungeon.
[*]Many hours worth of content. Granted, I took my time a bit, but even if I hadn't I would've gotten a solid 50 hours out of this campaign.
[*]Pacing was excellent. Progression was clear and rewarding.
[*]Simple yet fantastic crafting system.
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Female characters were SO sexualized. Like ridiculously, cringe-worthily sexualized. Gully was the only female character whose appearance wasn't just silly -- she's a badass. I'm not saying a female character can't be attractive, but damn, give these women some proper armor and personalities that aren't completely centered around being sexually appealing.
[*]Story was forgettable. Cutscenes were fun to watch because of the artwork and the voice acting was great, but the story itself wasn't fantastic. Not terrible by any means, just a bit achetypical.
[*]No option to speed up movement or combat. Sometimes I avoided using attacks with animations just so I wouldn't have to watch a ten second clip that I had seen a hundred times.
[/list]

Overall, this game was SO much fun. I highly recommend it.

38802521.review:
It could have been such a nice game. Nice setting. Interesting visual design. And some nice riddles in the dungeons. But the game mechanics are just not fun to me. Firstly I do not like games where you are not utilizing half the heroes you get. Especially if those that you are not using during a dungeon are not getting any experience and thus hopelessly falling behind in level making them even less attractive to play to a point where you would need to farm hours to get them up to the same level as the rest of the party.

So you are somewhat doomed to pick some three guys, which you also meet at totally different points of the story and hope you liked them. If not you either start again or farm your ass off to get the ones you did not use back up. Additionally I don't like the world map. You are running on a 2D map either running into encounters or trying to avoid them. And sometimes you find a little extra on it. But generally it does not do much to the game.

Then there is those arcade like options of pickign a dungeon in three varieties of difficulty which, depending on the diffculty you chose, give you better rewards. However, either you simply always go for the highest difficulty or you do the same dungeon several times in a row to get all rewards. Coming back later is usually not worth it because of the items being level dependant.

This is also a system which i do not like overall. Items being attached to a character's attributes like strength, dexterity or whatever I understand. But why would I not be able to wear a ring because i am only level 4 and not 15? How much experience can wearing one ring over the other require? This adds just another very artificially feeling hurdle in the game, that makes it even more of a grind, so that you can finally get the good equipment, which you can already buy or have in your inventory to put to use.

I wish they had gone for a totally different levelling and item system. Because this just breaks down the whole fun for me and made me simply uninstall the game at some point.

Another thing that was tiresome for me was that I was not able to speed up the fights in anyway. Either by accelarating time, cancel animations or even deactivate animations. Sure at first the animations are nice, but at some point you just want to get over with the fights.

However if someone does not care about such things, the game might still be worth playing. I however won't waste any more time on it than I already did.

38791321.review:
While the game is a lot of fun at the beginning it quickly becomes a bore; repeating the same dungeon over and over, acquiring new characters that are much lower level than your current ones and grinding them to match levels (really? why not just have them match levels), mundane crafting system, etc.  The bad turn based battle system is probably my biggest hang-up. The battle system is flawed in that it is not a true turn based game:  in this game, when you do ANYTHING other than a simple attack it puts you further down the turn list before anything happens, your hero just sits there "casting". These seemingly variable cast times make planning attacks, reacting to enemies, and complimenting other hero’s abilities extremely difficult. It should be that when you use any ability it is instant and the aforementioned ability you used reflects  your wait time until your next turn, with more powerful abilities putting you further down the waiting list (like almost all other turn based games such as FF10).
Overall I would recommend if you can pick up the game for a few bucks - it will undoubtedly entertain you for a few hours - but at its current price it just simply doesn’t deliver.

38783790.review:
我要严格。
老实说制作者应该好好反省下。
最突出的优点是美术和地图的结构设计，后者看起来很漂亮，很精巧。前者给10分都不嫌多。
人物的技能和天赋成长，既不过于花哨，又足够丰富，能让你依据自己的喜好搭配出几种各有特色的组合，同样的角色加点不同能完全改换打法，并且加点随时随地可以换，也是一个巨大的加分点。正因为这样，才能不断驱动着我的好奇心向前推进。可惜的是，优点的耀眼之处在一开始就向你展现了一大半，越往后，缺点的耀眼变得越瞎眼。

下面开始批评：
哎呀我都不知道从哪里批评好。
先说最无法忍受的，这游戏从中期开始平衡性血崩。
用一句通俗易懂的话来说，这游戏的平衡性简直就是煞吊。

在17，8级的时候，一个非精英的小怪大蜘蛛能一招秒我最脆的人，但是我的血量也有800，他一招就是898.而他这招2，3回合就能用一次，你只能祈祷他不用。而紧接着下一个地下城，中等难度，碰上一只精英怪，血量貌似有我们全部人加起来好几倍，能一个普通招打掉我防御技能全开，减伤70%的主坦1200血，而我总共1700血。他另一招是3回合后直接炸1700血。而就是这样的精英怪，中期并不少见，甚至能一套打你半血以上的小怪遍地都是。而他们还会扎堆，一旦扎堆你是一次打3个。刚刚我说的这个特别难打的精英怪就是和另外两只并不好对付的小怪一起扎在一块，费了老大劲才引开。
但是小怪这么厉害。boss却往往简单很多。这是这游戏一个非常莫名的地方。基本上除了等级高出几级的，平级的boss没有怎么难打。所以这就造成了一个荒唐情况，为了打小怪，你尝尝要恶意刷图刷到比对面高2，3级，然后等你能对付小怪了，你会发现boss简直就是弱鸡。这就让你的游戏体验极差。事实上，boss难一点，小怪更有梯度，减少数量增加质量会有趣的多。可惜这游戏小怪因为其恶心程度加上堆怪，让人变得非常烦躁。还有你堆怪就堆怪，你所有怪就那么几种，稍微换个皮肤就拿出来当新怪了，戴口罩的狼人把口罩涂灰就是高级口罩狼人了，怕不是王者荣耀皮肤都比你良心啊。

这是怪的问题，那么主角的问题呢？
前期你是3个人，一输出一奶一坦非常明显，这套组合你也能一直用到通关。但是中期又加进来3个人，平衡性又崩。先加来的法师等级首先就比你低，属性差，要先慢慢练级，练到跟你一样；而法师给人的感觉很难找准定位，奶不高，输出不算吓人，扛也别指望，非常尴尬。再后来加入了盗贼，属性相当好，是个高难度的可培养作为主力的好角色；最后加入的面具直接颠覆三观，上来等级就比你高，能奶能输出能加盾，而且每个都非常吊，自己还很硬，让你感觉你前面辛苦培养花的精力如同摸了鱼。所以后来我换成了小姑娘盗贼面具三人组，就感觉之前花掉了太多精力了，非常不舍。如果想每个人都试试呢？队伍经验不共享，明明剧情都是6个人，但是只能三人出战，你要想每个人都用，刷，像小粉刷匠一样地刷。

那么最后关于游戏的各项机制，就归在地图上吧，有些设计让人感觉这一定是做的时候脑子有驴。
比如，你在大本营，一开始的时候，你什么东西都不能造，有材料也不行。为什么？为什么？那么大铁匠在那他不让我打造装备？他胳膊比我头还粗他不让我打造装备？想做东西？必须要到各个地下城里面碰运气找到炉子才能做药做装备附魔。想在大本营做东西，必须得交大量的保护费，才给你使用，但是前中期一直缺钱，等你交足了保护费，都是中期以后的事了，我就不明白这个一开始就应该有的功能非要这样折磨我是什么意思。这还不算恶心的，
某些特殊的附魔，我还得特地大地图跑老远去一个偏远的火焰山洞才能附上，如果换装备就得重新跑一趟去附魔。自始至终都要这样跑路，而且这游戏有个特别无聊的钓鱼系统，钓完鱼以后卖钱还非要跑到一个特定的边角，走一段路才能过去卖鱼，似乎这游戏有些地方就是故意要浪费你的时间，故意不让你把时间花在刀刃上。

如果这些你都能忍受，你也会被糟糕的材料表设计逼得暴躁。你看着那些材料表，一定会发出啥玩意儿啊？在哪儿找啊？要这么多啊？这样三连。如果你想要打造装备，你需要做许多让你厌烦的重复劳动，然后还得自己照着配料表一个一个材料合成最后再合成武器。而这些装备的图也必须在商店买，打怪只能掉成品装备，可能好，可能不好，说不准。那我就刷呀，但是刷也不一定刷够，一遍地下城没刷够你就得再开一遍地下城，你能不能让我老老实实在一个地方刷干净了，或者，你把地下城不要总做那么老长？等我好不容易刷够了。我想做个药，发现往往还得回老家，然后发现瓶子不够要买瓶子……你做个药你还买什么瓶子，杰洛特身上带几百瓶魔药煎药他问我要瓶子了么？你不但要瓶子，你不同的药还用不同的瓶子，高品质还用高品质瓶子，出新药还要用新瓶子，群体跟单体又是不同瓶子，我怀疑药水奸商其实是这个世界最大的玻璃大王。等我把瓶子买齐了，我发现一些前期药水后期也有用，可是要做的时候发现需要的前期材料不够了，比如优质部件特别容易缺，但是大本营卖的完全不够，还要回去刷低级地下城，还不能跳过战斗……

这些东西我花了很久好不容易适应了，但是当我新加入角色，可以更换队伍以后，我发现它又来新的东西恶心我：既然剧情都是6个人一起，为什么我换一下队伍成员还必须回到酒馆？原来这游戏还有全息影像远程通话系统的？那三个人一直坐在酒馆，一边聊天一边通过远程视频投影看这边三个人打架？

所以他其实是把许多明明应当合在一起的功能硬生生拆分，细化，然后变得繁琐。以上帝的名义发誓，这招真是可真是比你老爹的屁股还要臭。

而所有这些结合起来，你就自然而然进入了一个死命刷的生活，还在刷的过程中不断被添麻烦。我不反对刷，但你不能让我一头栽在刷上面，而且还很厌烦，连走路速度都那么慢，刷也不能刷个痛快，可是不刷，你就只能用三个人，不刷，就没有材料，刷了，可能也记不住要什么材料……

综上所述，这游戏的正确玩法是地下城只走最简单的难度，通关即可。你越想深入去玩，他的诸多不合理越会让你觉得恶心，你要是浅尝辄止，反倒觉得非常不错。尽管他的美术是如此的迷人，但恰恰是加入了太多不必要的成分，让你不能深爱，对此，我只想说我很抱歉，甚至还想说声，打得不错。

更新：我又被平级的普通怪的一刀秒了，哇，真带劲儿！]

更新：终于，铁匠能让我在他宝贵的炉子打造装备了，前提是交2000保护费……一个一开始就应该有的东西硬生生让我憋到中期攒足钱才给，你这个简直是按照氪金手游的付费机制定做的。哦不，氪金手游都不会这么干。话说这让我想到另一个是15的狩猎挑战，那口井不断让你投钱，再投钱，再投食物，再投食物，再投酒，再投钱……哎，不开玩笑，你们做游戏的时候自己不数数这特么是第几次了吗？知不知道我每次为了一句话不说攒钱，就是买东西都要跑多远？而这还是完全没有必要的。而且15级的挑战，15级的时候我才几个钱，穷的叮当响，你狮子大开口要10000多钱，挑战完成奖励才几个钱嗨？

更新：我错了，boss完全看制作人想怎么折磨你，比如南部荒野的挑战，boss仅仅比我高一级，可以一招秒主坦以外任何人，或者将主坦打成接近空血。而这招每两回合就给你来一下，根本不给你任何行动机会，并且速度被动提高30%，也就是在你能使出任何加速技能之前直接先秒掉你一个人。完全没法打，后来我比他高一级再来挑战的时候，也是仅仅一级之差，又打得他不能还手……

更新：某些地方明显是根本没有推敲过。到了后期，荒野的戍塞，有一个地方是巫妖会无限刷骷髅复活，这个从设计初衷来讲，要么是拿来一直刷，要么就是不要恋战。但是特么的他刷新速度太快，你刚打完一个马上就刷出来另一个，而地形狭小，基本刷出来马上就遭遇战斗，于是乎就变成了我被强制性无限刷这个骷髅，这特么简直是脑子跟骷髅一样空才能干得出来的蠢事。


通关后总结：这个游戏确实能够吸引人，它本身有着一种抓人的魅力，但无奈不合理之处实在太多，就好像一朵看起来十分美丽的花朵，但是你凑过去闻的时候，发现它是臭的~
整个游戏的平衡性除了开头以外都是崩的，中期怪的实力陡然上涨，后期你的实力陡然上涨，中期你的遭遇变成后期怪的遭遇，可叹三小时河东，三小时河西啊。整个游戏的怪其实就那几种，全是一个模型翻来覆去的用，感谢史莱姆蝙蝠蜘蛛三劳模为我们贡献了大量的出场率，让我们在日后的怪物投票大选上能有一席之地，真正长相是boss的，技能又独到的boss才三个：战傀儡枪兵和凯灵顿绅士，还有最终boss卡卓尔，一个帅，一个谐，一个恶心霸道，基本上三个人的技能设计也完全符合这些特性，难以不给人留下深刻印象。可惜除了这三个，别的boss那张脸啊，我感觉啊，出门买个橘子都能碰上8个火车辗过的一模一样的尸体。很多甚至技能都差不多，就那个黄金大便战傀儡吧，你的大招不也正是加里布雷特三级爆发吗？你就是个涂成了黄金大便的加里布雷特啊。哇，自己抄自己这招有点妙啊。

而且这游戏的等级压制太厉害，一级就能见到很大的差别，3级等级差基本可以直接秒怪，所以我30级三把神武器打最后一个地下城的时候汗都不淌；因为这个等级压制特性，往往你去打boss的时候，你已经经过了各种恶心小怪的历练，等级比boss高，boss房前还能把血和蓝补满，甚至经常是带着满爆发去打，着就造成了boss战基本没啥难度；也因为这个等级压制特性，最后的卡卓尔难打就不奇怪了，唯一的一个31级怪，但是我们最高也就只有30级……打了2次，第二次还是靠空条承太郎的女儿空条格莉的3级爆发欧拉欧拉欧拉欧拉立了大功，8000多瞬发穿刺伤害真的强，用来斩杀是任何技能都比不了的，特别是卡卓尔buff太多，只有这招他防无可防。

只可惜打完以后，我连故事的开头都给忘了，剧情实在没什么存在感。而且最迷的地方是，解除封印的维鲁斯强大到血魔卡卓尔都要用西方记者的速度赶去消灭他，有着可以摧毁血魔的力量，那么他当初为什么要和血魔签订契约？他不恰恰是签订契约才获得了无与伦比的力量么……最后以为打完了卡卓尔还要打一仗维鲁斯解决这些疑惑，但是就这么没了，狗屎。我还想看漫画呢？如果还有续作，我想我不会再买了，因为故事通篇下来实在不怎么诱人，游戏过程也只有美术让人陶醉……

不过有一说一，美术确实让人惊叹连连，特别是后期地下城的大场景，大气，美轮美奂。每个地下城都是根据其背景精心设计的，就连机关都完全符合地城的建筑风格，每一个地下城的互动元素都不尽相同。我一直觉得这么考究的场景用来做回合制太可惜了，我认为他们做了一个绝赞的冒险框架，做成塞尔达系列那样的动作冒险或者是2.5D风格的类银河战士恶魔城的，会很好地发挥出自己的优势；结果他们做了回合制，但是核心却走了偏，回合制重要的打怪升级，剧情发展，以及避免不了的刷子过程，都做得不尽人意，甚至还有点单薄。整个游戏最大的乐趣在于一些新怪的初见，一些新技能的配招，还有就是每个地下城的探索发现，实际体验下来，很快会厌倦，就陷入了短暂的新鲜和长时间的消磨如此的循环，所以我也说，这游戏不去深究更好，因为这样更紧凑，你的厌倦期会更短；如果他不是回合制，而是以动作冒险，加解谜来做，把现在的地下城做的更像自由组合的沙箱，那么将会非常的有趣。可惜的现在本末倒置了。所以，这游戏到底适不适合玩，首先还是要看你的耐心，以及是否能容忍那些缺点，而只要优秀的美术和还算不错的人物成长就够了，实际上我觉得他反而很适合众多肝度高的手游玩家，相比之下，这个家伙的质量就要高出许多了，没有肝不下去的道理。

38743317.review:
On peut dire que le jeu est sympatique à première vue. Les graphismes sont beau, le système de combat est intéressant. Mais c'est tout... Tout le reste du jeu est très mal fait.

L'histoire est classique, y a un méchant, faut tuer le méchant. Aucun rebondissement, aucune intrigue.

Le déplacement des personnages sur la carte et dans les donjons sont très lent. Et même le système de combat commence à devenir lent à force quand vous devez combattre des petits groupes de monstres sans intérêts et que vous ne pouvez pas passer les animations.

Vous obtiendrez dans le jeu 6 personnages jouables mais vous ne pouvez en sélectionner que 3. Alors choisissez les très bien car seulement vos 3 personnages avec lesquels vous combattez vont gagner de l'expérience. Cela veut dire que vous allez faire un donjon, et les 3 autres que vous n'aurez pas utiliser vont devenir obsolètes. Ils seront tellement nul que vous préferez garder vos personnages que d'essayer d'autres compositions. C'est n'importe quoi étant donner qu'il y a énormément de points de talents et de sorts différents, et tout cet aspect du jeu vous sera bloquer juste parce que tout le monde ne gagnent pas de l'expérience. Vous pouvez très bien aller faire xp vos vieux personnages dans d'ancien donjon. Mais ça revient au premier point, c'est lent, très lent. Faire des combats que vous gagnerez facilement sera lent, faire xp vos vieux personnages sera aussi très lent.

Il y a un système de craft, mais il est lui aussi très lent et mal fait. Personellement, dans mes 10 premières heures de jeu, je n'ai pu faire aucune arme car je n'avais pas certains matériaux, alors que vous en avez à la pèle dans les donjons et sur la carte. Et pour craft un item, il faut laisser son doigt appuyer sur une touche pendant une dizaine de secondes. C'est normal pour une arme, mais c'est aussi le cas des consommables. Vous voulez faire des potions de soins ? Et bien amusez vous à laisser votre doigt pendant 10 secondes sur une touche pour ne faire qu'une seule potion, et impossible d'en faire plusieurs à la fois. Donc faire seulement 10 potions vous prendra environ 2min. Et c'est reparti pour un tour pour les potions de mana...

Bref. Si vous aimez vraiment ce style de jeu, et que la lenteur et le farm ne vous dérange pas, il vous plaira peut être. Sinon, passez votre chemin car moi je le trouve vraiment lourd. Je me force vraiment à essayer de le finir.

38702325.review:
THIS REVIEW IS MY OWN UNBIASED OPINION - I was not compensated or rewarded for this review in any way.

Let me start off by saying I had this game on my Wishlist for 6+ months or so before it was released, and then for some reason (I don't remember why) I took it off, then found it on Steam again and immediately bought it post-release.  I feel like an idiot for ever taking it off my Wishlist; here's why:

If I had to pick just one game on Steam that I'd write a review for, it would be this one.  This game blew me out of the water.  Right from the start, watching the intro sequence and jamming to the amazing opening soundtrack, I was hooked.

The visual art and audio soundtracks for this game are top-notch in my opinion, and incredibly catchy.  Characters in the game are fully voiced for the important dialogues, which pulls you into the story even more.  The main set of characters as well as side characters (quest-givers, merchants, etc.) have fleshed out personalities and look very unique.

Gameplay is broken down into several parts.  First you have the overworld, essentially a guided map you run around on to collect loot and encounter enemies and enter towns (think games like old-school Final Fantasy or Golden Sun, if anyone remembers that title).  On the overworld, there's 2 different types of areas I've encountered: 1) Explorable Areas: These look like dungeons and play like dungeons, however there's no difficulty-select and they usually have something to do with the story or side missions. 2) Dungeons: Parts of the game you enter and choose a difficulty in order to receive a tiered chest reward at the end.

In both the Dungeons and Explorable areas, you can choose which of the characters in your party you actually run around with, and each of them has a special ability you can use to help yourself or hinder your enemies (or both in some cases).  For example, Garrison (the swordsman that's reminiscient of Guts) has a dash that helps you avoid trap damage, and if you initiate combat with an enemy using it, it gives Garrison a nice Haste buff.  Different characters have different abilities.  I love being able to run around as who I want and switch at-will.

Combat begins when you interact with an enemy either through using one of those special abilities I mentioned, simply walking into an enemy, or an enemy seeing you and running into you.  Combat is 100% turn-based (none of that ATB stuff where it's semi-timed), so you can take your time planning your strategy.  Your characters have regular abilities that generate Overcharge (mana that goes on top of your regular mana and gets used first), then special abilities that are more powerful and cost mana, you can also use items, and then there's Burst actions, but I don't want to spoil that for you.  As far as I've seen, you cannot skip through combat animations, but that didn't bother me much because they're pretty fast anyways.

There is quite a bit of character customization (not appearances though); you get to find different pieces and tiers of gear for each character, two different Perk trees you can invest points into to alter the core functionality of the characters, and from what I've seen equipping different weapons actually changes the way their weapons look in combat, which is a nice touch.

The game also features a fun fishing mini-game to collect fishing materials, lots of crafting items and things to craft, and tons of little pieces of lore you can find and read if you wish.  It even rewards you for finding all the lore pieces in a "set".  Additionally, as you battle enemies of the same type/genre, you gain knowledge of the enemy; their abilities, what they drop, etc. and you also gain permanent boosts to stats, which is pretty unique and cool.

The dialogues in the game are clever and fun to read, and the important dialogues are fully voiced, which I loved.  Less important dialogues are not voiced, which makes sense.

I honestly have no idea how anyone could not enjoy this game, or at least appreciate how much work went into it.  I will be putting LOTS of time into this game, especially since I'm a sucker for good turn-based RPGs.  I'm so happy I found this game on Steam.  If I could afford it, I'd buy 10 more copies and give it out to my friends, no joke.  If they ever make a sequel to this game, I'm buying it immediately.

Please developers, don't let this gem of a franchise be history - keep it alive!!

OVERALL RATING: 10/10

38658586.review:
Good game if you like JRPG-style games. No bugs that I noticed. Pros & Cons: 

Pros: 
- Animation of various attacks, characters, and enemies is consistent and high-quality. Some of the enemy designs caused me to stop playing and just look at them for a bit. Really well-done with a consistent art-style. 
- Comic Book Influence: Characters and enemies have comic-book sytle speech bubble quips in combat. Boss fights and plot points are shown through illustrated comic-panel style movies. 
- Six distinct characters, each with their own abilities you gain through levels. Each character also has two-perk trees where you can adjust point distribution every fight (if you wanted to). 
- Combat: A well-implemented turn-based system. You have to watch which enemies are coming up and what attacks they are preparing. Buffs and debuffs matter, as does the rare strategic block. 
- Pretty cool dungeon system. There are 8 "big" dungeons, semi-randomized each time you "run" them. They each have events and lore. To see most of the dungeon possiblities, you would have to run a dungeon two or three times. You can set the difficulty level for the dungeon at the start, which prevents you from just facerolling it the second time. 
- Respectable loot system, which allows for multple character specializations. Each dungeon appears to have a pool of loot, and rng determines what you get on a given chest/enemy drop. 

Cons: 
- That high-quality animation? Yeah... you can't speed it up. On easy fights when you are over-leveled, nothing you can do to speed it up. Minor in the scheme of things, but there.
- You will have to repeat some content to stay leveled up. (I would think this is obvious, because its a JRPG-style game, but some people have no patience for any grinding.)
- Quibble: Movement on the overworld map is slower than it needs to be.

38649820.review:
I wanted to like this game. The artwork and animation is very well done and fun. Combat has glimpses of challenge and creativity, but overall devolves into a grindfest. The graphics entertain, but the repeatitiveness gets very old very fast and results in a lot of filler beween anything engaging. In fact, much of the game seems geared to running up hours logged over actual interactions for the player. 

I selected Insane difficulty for dungeons since otherwise it was already feeling monotonous, but unfortunately the general increase in interesting battles was all too frequently brought to a sudden halt when a seemingly unwinable encounter appeared with no discernable warning. 13 levels in, ability to win fights seems dramatically weighted towards levels over choices in battle, leaving a very small window where you are rewarded for attentiveness. 

I think the developers have a lot of potential for future games, but this one was executed poorly when it comes to valuing the players time. Shorten it by 3/4, focusing on more challenging battles (quality over quantity), and I probably would have raved about it.

38646224.review:
A very cluttered, mixed bag of flawed, underpolished gems.  There are great assets and innovations here, but the glacial pacing was a deal-breaker for me.  Luckily, another review pointed me to Cheat Engine's speed hack feature, where doubling the speed easily makes the game itself twice as good.  It is practically a requirement to keep Nightwar fun, since your characters run at the speed of frozen molasses and most combat is made of sitting even stiller.  Watching a slime slowly waddle over to a cahracter, smack them, and slowly waddle all the way back while everybody politely keeps quiet is almost a comedy act.  One that stops being funny after the 50th time when you can feel yourself aging to death.

Since bug fixes and improvements are still going, I'm hoping the pacing is something they'll tinker with.  And maybe give an official solution that keeps the sound effects in sync.  Another bad design choice is the inventory order.  Since every item, including consumables, has multiple tiers that aren't even kept next to each other, you end up with a shambling mess from which you'll never find that emergency healing item.  I guess the game being stingy with its money can help keep you from hoarding.  But that's not a real solution when juggling buffs through both consumables and equipment is an intended element.

If it sounds like I'm dwelling on the flaws, it's mainly to counterbalance the game's much more obvious first impression: its graphics and music are gorgeous.  Along with an innovative combat system, the developers really knocked those out of the park.  The combined atmosphere is enchanting and moody, and you'll definitely get your money's worth there.  It's just that the current flaws, it's hard to appreciate the beauty without a DIY solution.  With one, the dungeon crawling and resource gathering is fun enough to justify the price.  Since the great framework is already there, if the studio can keep polishing the system, this game might evolve into something amazing.  Here's hoping it turns into Super Battle Chasers Turbo, without being a separate purchase.

The fighting in the game shines because of the countless side effects every attack has, but I doubt I could express their appeals through words.  There's enough text on screen for each buff and debuff just playing the thing.  So instead, I'll point out that most of the writing outside those, is... not great.  BC's writing was never its appeal, being slammed for its cliches since the old days.  Most of the main cast isn't just made of broad stroke tropes, but are directly based on '90s anime and video game characters.  Gully even had Sephiroth for a brother, because for all his skill, Joe Mad's scripts were Deviantart accounts.

You won't see much originality in the plot or character interactions, since all the depth is in the mechanics.  Honestly, you won't find much of a story period, since everybody and everything just stays a collection of premises and homages that don't go anywhere.  The collectible dungeon flavor text somehow has more storytelling than the entire franchise after two decades.  As much as the soundtrack helps sell the stilted interactions, I do wish the writing improved, shedding some of the '90s excesses like Marureira's art did.  (Calibretto's robo-pants and Red Monika's watermelons used to look way more crammed in and out of place.)  That said, since the cast looks and plays great, it's not as distracting as it should be.  Nightwar knows to keep the focus on the gameplay, and the characters functions as a cool looking excuse for it.

38626461.review:
Невероятная игра. Не жалею ни одного потраченного на нее рубля.

[h1]Околоигровое[/h1]

[b]Пошаговость[/b]
Так получилось, что мне было очень сложно найти пошаговую RPG, в которой между ходами время не продолжает идти.
Есть знаменитая серия "пошаговых" JRPG Final Fantasy, но по каким-то причинам боевка там сделана таким образом, что игрок не может отойти от игры во время боя - минимум что предоставляют игры типа JRPG это пауза хода только во время того, как игрок выбрал действие, но еще не активировал его. Тоесть, пока игрок не нажал "обычная атака" или "способность", и не начал выбирать между "ударом рукой" и "огненным шаром", противники просто будут продолжать месить игрока. Получается недопошаговая RPG.
Эта игра именно то, что я искал. Когда у меня сложный бой, я могу спокойно посидеть и подумать какой-же ход будет наилучшим в данной ситуации, противники не будут совершать свои ходы, пока мой персонаж не совершит действие.

[b]Ввод в игру, история, лор[/b]
Battle Chasers не вводит игрока в свою историю получасовым туториалом с лором и диалогами. 
Вот тебе минутный ролик с тем, что произошло только что, а теперь играй. 
Диалогов не много, они интересные, соответствуют сюжету, раскрывают персонажей, а главное - они короткие. 
Знаете вот эти долгие вводы игрока в JRPG игру? Прежде чем начать играть, тебе нужно пройти испытание - прочитай/прокликай (ты их даже прокликивать будешь очень долго) вводные диалоги, которые нельзя разом пропустить, а уже потом, играй. Я понимаю что это настраивает атмосферу, вводит игрока в мир и его историю, но вот вам Battle Chasers, отличный пример как можно делать все то же самое не грузя игрока всем этим.
По подземельям разбросаны записки разных историй, связанных с событиями этого мира. Состоят они из 3-5 частей, за сбор которых вам дадут небольшую награду, ну и все это сохраняется у вас в менюшке в удобном порядке.

[b]Мир и визуальная составляющая[/b]
Игра прекрасна. Красивые арты, уместные анимации, хорошая озвука. Она доставляет эстетическое удовольствие. Не смотря на то, что подземелья генерируются, нет никаких нестыковок. Очень редко бывает когда лич воскрешает скелета в месте, куда невозможно добраться, или монстр появляется на дереве, но таки случаев было за мои 50 часов игры - 3 раза. В подземельях встречаются легенькие головоломки, которые совсем не надоедают.

[b]Перевод[/b]
Мне очень нравится играть в игры и смотреть художества именно на русском языке, пусть это будет даже одноголосый перевод. Я понимаю английский язык, но все-равно люблю именно перевод. 
В Battle Chasers есть русская озвучка! Часто вижу как игры переводят, а иногда даже и озвучивают на множество разных языков, кроме русского, а тут и он есть. Это редкость и нам стоит ценить такие моменты.
Я очень часто слышу о том, что "перевод плохой", "лучше смотреть в оригинале" (не конкретно в этой игре, а вообще о кино/играх) и не понимаю этого, поэтому не буду говорить однозначно что озвучка хорошая, я обратил на это внимание и мне понравилось.

[h1]О механике игры[/h1]

[b]Персонажи[/b]
В формате "армии" игрока может быть максимум 3 персонажа, как и всего может быть максимум 3 персонажа противника.
Всего существует 6 различных персонажей. В начале вам доступно только 3 их них, а остальных, по одному, вы открываете проходя сюжет. 
У каждого персонажа есть 2 ветки талантов. Одна ветка повышающая урон персонажа, другая различная форма поддержки (чтоб персонаж стал танком/хилом/бафером/дебафером). 
Характеристики персонажей в принципе стандартные, ничего необычного тут нет. Снаряжение влияет на характеристики.

[b]Система заряда[/b]
В игре, помимо маны, персонажи могут набирать "заряд" используя обычные действия. Это такая временная мана, которая накапливается сверх лимита маны персонажа. В начале всегда траититься заряд, мана тратиться только если заряда нет. Существуют специальные способности, которые зависят от этого заряда. Очевидно, что в обычных битвах выгоднее в начале набрать заряд, и тратить его вместо маны. С другой же стороны, если вся мана потрачена, вы ее замещаете в рамках одного боя этим самым зарядом. Заряд не сохранается между битвами, не считая специальных талантов, которые позволяют переносить часть заряда, или генерировать его в начале боя.

[b]Способности[/b]
Повышая уровень, персонаж получает очки талантов, которые можно потратить на способности из ветки талантов, а достигая определенного уровня, еще и новую способность. Самое интересное что таланты можно в любой момент (кроме боев) свободно перераспределять. 
Вы проходите подземелье? -Наверно вам будет выгоднее хилить группу в конце каждого боя. 
Вы видите что сейчас будет босс? -Пожалуй, стоит перераспределить лечение в конце боя на что-то более полезное для конкретной битвы.
Какими способностями пользоваться, вы будете выбирать исходя из прокачанных талантов.
Я бы изменил некоторые таланты, так как есть те, которые мне кажутся абсолютно бесполезными, и в итоге пришел к тому, что одна ротация способностей преобладает над остальными. Способности с периодическим уроном слишком слабые - ударив несколько раз обычной атакой получается больше урона, так как бои не проходят достаточно долго, чтобы периодические способности имели большое преимущество. Способности с массовым уроном слишком медленные, они хоть и наносят урон всем, делая общий нанесенный урон от способности большим, но на много выгоднее зафокусить цели по одной, чтобы быстро их убрать.

В общем и целом, я рекомендую эту игру, а если вы еще и любитель пошаговых RPG, то просто обязаны ее попробовать.

+++ Be sure to do dungeons once on all difficulties if stuck
++ Unique combat system and supporting mechanics

+ Music & Sound support the game well. Interesting color keyboard effects integration

- Quite r-e-p-e-t-i-t-i-v-e. You can skip fights with enemies 4-5 levels lower with you on the worldmap
- Limited choice of items compared to the materials required
- Game ends in a cliffhanger either setting up part 2 or DLC

38560031.review:
If you're a fan of Joe Madureira, the Battlechaser series, or the Darksiders series.. then you've probably already bought this game or planning to get the game. 

Graphics: Art is amazing in most cases. You feel like you're in Joe Mad's world as you fight monsters and bandits. Occasionally the art (especially the cut scenes) looks incomplete or done very lazy, but overall it's amazing work from the team. 

Gameplay: After playing Divinity: OS 2, this felt a bit of a letdown. Aside from some bugs and such, It's a basic JRPG game. Nothing special but fun to waste some time on (now that they fixed the grind). Game also plays a bit slow (this is more noticable in the Arena Mode where there's a timer). Fishing is only good for shadow coins.. which are good to buy books that give perks. The perks are great, bursts are fun, sometime character voices happen and that's nice. 

Story: I think this the weakest part of the game. The heroes crash on an island that happens to have dracula and his creator trapped on it. The villainess Destra is trying to free.. er.. both? I dunno. But the heroes decide to stop her before she frees them. That's about it. Very little character developement happens in the game.

38558023.review:
This game far exceeded my expectations. There's real attention to detail here and the fun unlocks made me strive to be more completionist than I am in a lot of games. Neat combat system, outstanding dungeon design that changes each time you enter the same dungeon, a variety of viable party setups.

I'm not often surprised at games, but these developers really did it right. Highly recommended, can't wait for some DLC or a sequel!

38531980.review:
久しぶりにちゃんとしたＲＰＧをやった気持ちになれました。
まだ、2周目に入ったところですが、2周目エンドのトロフィー以外は取りました。
ハクスラ（？）要素は何となくありますが、次のダンジョンで手に入る装備が強すぎて意味をなしていません。
また、1周目でトロコン寸前のレベルカンストまで行くと最後のダンジョンとラスボスが弱すぎてなんだかなぁ・・・
トロコンの為にはダンジョン周回や、明示されていない仕様を画面から読み取らねばなりません。
おかげで、図鑑埋めとバウンティトロフィーの為にレベルカンストしてしまいました。
特にバウンティは召喚に必要なアイテムが一つノーヒントですのでかなりキます。
もっさり感ですが、戦闘は気になりませんでしたが歩きの速度は1.5倍にはして欲しいと思います。
もっさりとノーヒントを改善してくれれば次も必ず買います。（匂わす感じのヒントはかなりＧＯＯＤです）

プレイ時間はかなり放置してましたので、クリアまでは30時間もあれば余裕だと思います。

38525007.review:
Что надо понимать перед покупкой - это консольная рпг. Это вам не герои меча и магии и не Kings Bounty.

1. Бой: максимум 3 на 3. Пошаговый. При этом двигаться персонажи не могут. Стоит тройка ваших персонажей на поле, а напротив от 1 до 3 противников. По очереди совершают ходы. Ход заключается в выборе способности и выборе цели ее применения. Персонажи подают реплики, совершают анимации. И это все.

2. По глобальной карте группа перемещается строго по дорожкам, на которых расставлены враги и призы. В подземельях - как в Kings Bounty - свободное перемещение по трехмерному макету.

3. Почему же я рекомендую эту игру? Дело в ненапряжной немрачной атмосфере, красивой отрисовке, качественном переводе на русский язык. Отлючить мозг, полюбоваться.. Не то, чтобы было что то сверхъординарное, но мне понравилось.

Забавно, конечно, в 2017 году наблюдать игру, в которой управление и поле боя беднее, чем в первой HOM, вышедшей под DOS. Borderlands давным-давно открыл дверь и показал, каким должны быть современные ролевые игры, но по этой дороге никто не пошел. Можете, кстати Borderlands 2 вместо этой игры купить, если еще не покупали, она не дороже, а то и дешевле и если вы не подлый консольщик, для которого любое действие чревато перенапражением мозга! :)

38493084.review:
[h1][Introduction][/h1]
I dropped Battle Chasers shortly after its initial release because it just felt painfully slow and while I liked the game as it is, it felt like wasting time. There is a reason that games like these get an optional speed up function these days. However, after picking it up again and using a little trick to speed up the game, I quickly realized what I have been missing out on.

As always, these are my own thoughts and opinions, please look at other reviews too before you make a purchase decision.

[h1][Negatives][/h1]
Let’s begin with my biggest problem; frequent battles who drag the games length out longer than it needs to be. While it was nice seeing those juicy animations the first few times, it quickly became a burden. This could easily be fixed with an optional speed up button, but so far they have not implemented one and I had to use Cheat Engine as a replacement.

The second problem I have has to do with the otherwise awesome crafting system in which you can only create one item at a time, making it a huge pain if you just want to craft a stack of potions for example. Also, your success chance gets reset after each crafted item and one has to to add materials each time when wanting to craft another epic potion, it’s annoying.

[h1][Gameplay][/h1]
Battle Chasers’ combat offers a surprising amount of depth where each character has four primary attacks that are instant and generate overcharge, but what you build up is reset once the fight is over. Additionally, there are 12 primary skills per character that are much stronger but have casting time and need mana or overcharge resulting in a surprising amount of strategies at your disposal. Similarly to Final Fantasy’s limit breaks, Battle Chasers allows the use of three different Bursts per character that can be used as ultimate abilities for boss fights or quickly finishing of unpleasant foes, and they all share the same burst meter. You even have two skills for each character which can be used outside of combat to guard you from dangerous hazards or give you a buff for the fight you are about to enter. Furthermore, combat is done in a typical RPG manner but with not so typical RPG elements and the game combines all of them very well. Use status ailments like bleeding, chill, or haste that can positively or negatively effect combat and allow for some sick combos. 

Battle Chasers offers a wide variety of interesting enemies even though most of them have, in typical old-school RPG manner, just different colors so one can tell them apart from each other. On the world map, monsters aren't encountered randomly like most RPGs do, they have fixed positions allowing one to skip some of them and you can even chose to skip lowly monsters entirely. While in exploration areas and dungeons you have the choice to separate enemies and fight them one at a time or rush in to take on the whole group at once. There are also fights with multiple waves of enemies which can be pretty harsh. This is used most notably in the arena where you have to fight many waves back to back until you reach the boss of that tier. Also, bonus streaks award more experience based on certain conditions met like one-hitting enemies or getting a double kill with one attack. Fights reward you with gold and crafting materials which are needed to craft, buy, and enhance equipment. Typical rarities often seen in RPGs, like uncommon, rare, epic and legendary, evoke the urge to constantly upgrade your gear and experiment with different stats.

Besides the deep combat, Battle Chasers utilizes a unique crafting system where you just have to get needed materials to craft something or simply take more materials from one component and increase your success chance without having all the materials you would normally need to craft it. You can increase your success chance up to 300% by giving it even more materials to craft rare or even epic gear, and the same can be done with weapon enhancements which grant passive bonuses to your equipment.
 
The bestiary rewards the player with passive unlocks for all characters by slaying monsters a given number of times and also provides information about health, attacks, and loot drops after a certain amount of kills which also changes the enemies health bars from ??? to their actual values and shows specific skills that they will be using next. 

All of the six characters have two passive perk threes with 18 different passives each allowing for a specific role like tank, healer, or damage dealer, and you are free to mix between them. Moreover, customization towards your prefered playstyle starts to really open up mid-game where you have enough perk points to setup some nice combos. Perk points are earned through leveling or by buying/finding books that grant them.

There are eight dungeons stretched across the world map that may be played on Normal, Heroic, and Legendary, and they can be a real challenge the first time you visit them. While filled with loot and monsters, each dungeon also attempts to spice it up with puzzle elements here and there where you actually have to use your brain. A boss lies at the end of each dungeon and drops items that can be traded for tokens, which also come from a fun fishing minigame and bounties (“hunts”) you can take out on certain enemies. These tokens can be traded for many things like the perk books, random gear chests, or even different outfits for your characters. 

[h1][Graphics/Presentation][/h1]
While cutscenes are in 2D with awesome comic style drawings, Battle Chasers in-game visuals remind me very much of Torchlight but with way more polish and atmosphere. The world map is in a completely different style from the rest of the game, with a nice storybook feel to it.

Combat showcases gorgeous animations that feel both fluid and impactful, but at the same time tend to get old quickly and stay like that until later in the game. I do appreciate that each different weapon has its own unique visual style during combat and everywhere else, I just wish they would’ve done the same with armor.

[h1][Story][/h1]
While the story is alright as it is, I would’ve wished for far greater character development which was sadly lacking, apart from the little scenes while resting in an inn at night, that’s it. I do appreciate those little conversations though, they give you some sense of the characters’ personalities.

[h1][Music][/h1]
The soundtrack is beautiful, energetic and fits the tone of the game just right, often reminding me of Bastion’s greatness. I never got tired of hearing any of the songs over and over, they’re just that good!

[url=https://clarkpowell.bandcamp.com/album/battle-chasers-nightwar-original-soundtrack]Checkout the Bandcamp page for a preview![/url] 
 
[h1][Conclusion][/h1]
I can safely recommend this game to anyone who enjoys RPGs with a mildly challenging combat system and a simple but gripping story. Just remember, if it’s too slow for you, you can use Cheat Engine or similar software with twice the speed for a more tolerable experience until they finally implement a speed up button.

It's a fun game, period. While enemy models are frequently recycled, they still have enough style to them that it doesn't get too tedious. It's clearly a game designed on a budget, and should be respected as such.

Battle Chasers is simple, fun, and a solid classic RPG title.

38462139.review:
Empecé este juego con muchsima ilusión.
Fué un lanzamiento del que no sabía nada y me sorprendió muchisimo.

Me encantan los JRPG clasicotes, por turnos y todo apuntaba a que lo iba a disfrutar como un enano pero no ha sido así, por desgracia.

El juego tiene un sistema sencillo. Poblado a modo de Hub donde abastecerte y mejorar. Caminos que salen de el con enfrentamientos y mazmorras.

En cierta parte me recuerda un poco a Darkest Dungeon.

El sistema de combate es muy bueno, clasico por turnos, con todo muy bien especificado. 
Personajes con carisma.

Donde está lo malo entonces???

El sistema de dificultad es pésimo y que las mazmorras sean aleatorias en cuanto a salas y enemigos provoca situaciones super injustas.

Personalmente me cansé de repetir las mazmorras para poder farmear EXP. y Equipo, el cual te dan de cualquier personaje, aunque no lo estés usando.

El equipo da igual que sea verde, azul, morado...el caso es que sea del maximo nivel disponible. Mejor un verde de 16 que un morado de 13...

Por último en una mazmorra me tocó en una sala pasillo 3 enemigos de los que ya 1 por 1 dan guerra, en estos juegos estan los grupos de 3 "masillas" y el tipico fuertote que con tus 3 heroes matas 1 solo. Me tocaron 3 de estos juntos, imposibles de evadir. Me canse de que me matasen  y de esa situcion injusta. Lo dejé.

Una autentica pena, con un poco mas de mimo, un poquito mas de darle vuelta hubiese sido un gran juego.

its a good game, nothing great, but worth playing.

Dont like to see a spider reskined 10 times in my playtrough, more enemy models and variety would be nicer
The items are fixed on certain lvl's like the enchants, not a fan of that.
More uniqe items would be nice, dont like to get the same items just with different rarity.

The game is getting pretty unbalanced near the endgame, where you became to strong for everything, strong mobs are like flies waiting to be squashed by your bulldozer (deleted the last boss under 1 min or so)
Game shines at the low and mid, where its hard, and you try rlly hard to kill a pack of mobs, with using every resource you have.

Replay value is almost non existent, maybe new game+ with charakters that you havent played your main playtrough.
And i must say the dungeon system and the dungeons itselfs are fantastic, that was the best part of the game for me

i give it a 7/10. i think there will be some part 2 action (i hope) and will make the game richer in content and add more diverse stuff (enemys, more uniqe items, not fixed lvl for items/enchants), then this game would be a fantastic gaming expirience.

38401099.review:
If you’re a huge comic book fan, love Anime, and remember Joe Madureira Battle Chasers, yes 20 plus years ago, a book never quite completed. Then Battle Chasers may rekindle your love affair for that title. Battle Chasers: Nightwar tackles the tedium of traditional JRPG turn-based combat by turning the battles into epic tactical gameplay. As a parent, my reviews are always my experience only on a game for other parents and young gamers to review. Many new people come to Steam and may not know what to do with reviews, so here goes. There are some wonderful Pros and some annoying Cons. 
PROS
• A: It is refined and a beautiful game with a great Anime feel to it. The Graphics are first rate in execution and gameplay. 
• B: It does give you a comic icon tutorial as you make your way around to what is what, but mistakes will count. 
• C: It has smooth controls for mouse or controller and the gameplay is smooth and clear cut. Save and Exit feature. 
• D:  It will have a WOW this is cool first-time effect on all players as our in constant battles. You will at first get into every punch, every Bam! Pow! and Spell effect as debuff and buff stack, classic Tank, Shooter and Fighter type mechanism and clear animated visuals that will keep you invested.
• E: The parties can be altered too, so you can have your own builds based on their abilities to explore• and you have altering equipment crafting and RPG elements that you keep adjusting as you go. 

CONS
• This has some spike balancing issues that I do think they will alter down the road with patches and I am sure future episode expansions. 
• Grinding-Though the dungeon support replaying and you find ways to grind away. After a while those WOW effects can get tedious and hurt the game experience after a while. This I do think will change in time. 
• Lack of Bestiality diversity-after a while you will get sick of the same enemies over and over. Beautifully done of not. The Codex of beast glossary is great, but if you’re going to grind you want 100’s of different enemies. Bats, Wolves, and Goo can get tedious again after a while. Something I do think they will expand on with expansions, but a small con for me.  
Nuetral-Old Final Fanstasy Manga gameplay: Though I am sure the three party system is nothing new and sadly nothing they expanded from. True turn based tactical gamers like massive parties of 6-9 and much more expanded battles with plenty of tactical choices and outcomes. Unfortunatly your altering from 6 members to three small parties what developers miss is if you going to make extra members. Having them non active beats the purpose of a tactical turn base model.
  
OVERALL
UPDATE: I am giving Battle Chasers a positive review simply because I don't think they are near to being done. The effort and passion is clearly in display. The overworld map, encounter map, and dungeon maps are all done well and everything from an execution stand point is well done. Kids will love this game. Daughter adores the story telling and presentation. I do think they will adjust as they go and future episodes will build on the template created here. You may see more updates and events to improve the base game enough. Always See the VIDEO above discussions to preview the game prior to buying at a discount is wise. I would also advice getting this during sale events. If you love Disgaea for it's story telling presentation, Final Fantasy for it's 3 party encounters, Phantasy Star or classic Japanese 3 party rpg then Battle Chasers is right up your ally. A wonderful comic book rpg come to life. A nice start template to build on. My GRADE 3.9 stars out of 5.

Un juego que para los amantes de los RPG ya sea de mas antiguos o mas modernos puede enamorarte.

Lo bueno

- Combates por turnos muy entretenidos
- Una variedad de héroes muy diferenciados

Lo malo

Conclusion:
Un titulo que a pesar de ciertas carencias no lo hacen nada malo solo te deja con ganas de mas, se hace muy entretenido y liviano dado que su dificultad esta muy bien implementada, yo lo recomendaría tanto a fans como a gente que quiera probar un buen RPG.

38373708.review:
Les RPG, dont les escarmouches se déroulent au tour par tour, pullulent. Cependant, la majorité n'est que la pâle copie d'antiquités vénérées.

Réservé à une caste masochiste, Battle Chasers sacrifie la trame scénaristique pour se concentrer sur les confrontations qui constituent l'ossature d'un corps décharné. Réduite à sa portion congrue, l'histoire qui n'affiche ni originalité, ni densité, se dilue.

De manière conventionnelle, on se déplace sur une carte composée de zones à déverrouiller au fil de la progression. Un village sert de camp de base, hébergeant différentes boutiques tenues par des personnalités atypiques. En arpentant ce monde cloisonné, on croise des adversaires à occire pour parvenir jusqu'aux donjons qui sont les épicentres de l'action. On s'inscrit dans un sillon scénaristique étroit et linéaire et rien ne permet de s'y soustraire, le contingent des objectifs secondaires étant réduit.

Tout repose sur les combats qui se multiplient jusqu'à saturer le joueur. Sachant que le groupe déployé n'incorpore que trois des six personnages proposés, les absents n'engrangent aucune expérience. Ainsi, parcourir plusieurs fois les huit donjons s'impose.

A ce stade de la présentation, l'asymétrie dénoncée apparaît rédhibitoire. Pourtant, j'ai tenu le choc jusqu'à m’essouffler. Pourquoi ?

La direction artistique est aussi soignée qu'inspirée, fourmillant de détails et d'animations. Visuellement, le déroulement des affrontements est somptueux et dynamique. Techniquement abouti, aucune faille n'est à déplorer et naviguer dans le menu s'avère limpide.

Le système de combat s'affiche aussi dense que maîtrisé. Autant au niveau du déroulement que des à-côtés, on tutoie une forme d'excellence qui rompt avec la médiocrité de la plupart des productions contemporaines. La tactique prime si on tient à en découdre sans se faire rosser. La palette des options et des compétences se révèle riche et l'utiliser à bon escient est la clef du succès.

Cependant, alors que l'épilogue se profile, les affrontements basculent trop facilement en faveur du joueur. Dès qu'on dispose des armes légendaires et qu'on tutoie le niveau maximum, l'intensité baisse d'un cran et la monotonie s'installe dans le dernier quart de l'épopée. On écrabouille l'adversité mécaniquement sans que soit sollicité la science tactique.

Battle Chasers échoue à convaincre car le déséquilibre est trop marqué. Ses qualités esthétiques, le dynamisme et la profondeur des combats, ne parviennent pas à masquer la vacuité d'un scénario étriqué. On enchaîne des combats jusqu'à l’écœurement, l'intérêt de ses derniers déclinant aux portes de l'épilogue.

Ma note finale est subjective car, malgré des défaillances rédhibitoires, le système de combat et leur mise en scène m'ont séduit. Souhaitons que la suite en gestation intègre le rééquilibrage nécessaire pour en faire un incontournable.

-= 14/20 =-

38358546.review:
Hello everybody, End World Gaming here to share an excerpt from my review for Battle Chasers: Nightwar by Airship Syndicate and THQNordic.

Battle Chasers Nightwar is a turn based RPG that’s not only based on a popular comic book series that originated in the 90’s but also heavily inspired by popular JRPG’s from the time period as well.

The story follows 5 unique characters named Gully, Knolan, Calibretto, Garrison and Red Monika. The story starts with our heroes arriving on a mysterious island and are immediately attacked by a group of bandits. Their airship is ultimately destroyed and they become entangled in the island’s troubles after they learn of an evil woman gathering the island’s artifacts for an unknown purpose. So, the heroes set out on a journey across the island to stop her.

The game features a turn based combat system, very similar in style to classic Final Fantasy games. You can take up to 3 party members into battle and each one has unique abilities which have various effects in a battle.

Attacks are split into two areas. The first are instant skills and the second is charge skills which take a turn or more to pull off. Skills also have buffs and debuffs that apply to enemies and party members. Enemies are also capable of applying these debuffs to your characters and they can easily alter a battle’s outcome.

There’s also special abilities that require the use of the boost bar. The boost bar fills up as you attack and use abilities. When it’s charged you can unleash a powerful ability. Some abilities purify and heal while others buff your party’s defenses. It’s a good idea to use them frequently, especially against stronger enemies.

The game also features an in-depth crafting system where you’re able to craft weapons, potions and enchant your items. You can purchase skill books from vendors to allow you to craft new and better equipment as well.

There’s also a beastiary in the game which actually has an effect on gameplay. There are beast perks which unlock as you reach milestones. For example, if you kill 50 bats you get a 1% increase in haste for all party members. So killing numerous enemies actually has a benefit to you during battles.

When your character’s level up they’ll sometimes get new skills as well as new perks (And perk points) to equip. Perks have a wide range of different effects such as increasing attack power or increasing haste or even defense.

One thing that I will admit about this game is that it’s better played in short sessions. I’ve played it for mostly long sessions in an attempt to complete the game but it gets quite boring after a while because there’s a lot of repetition in your actions throughout. You’ll be spending most of your time in battles no matter where you are in the game. Whether it be on the world map or inside of dungeons. There’s not much in the way of gameplay changes so it can’t keep my attention for over 2 hours.

Overall, Battle Chasers Nightwar has some excellent features and one of the best turn based battle systems that I’ve seen in a while. The only downside is that it does get pretty repetitive after 2 hours of play time so it’s best played in small chunks rather than long play sessions. If you’re in the market for a fun RPG with some great characters and a ton of battles then Battle Chasers Nightwar may be right up your alley.

If you're interested in checking out the full review or finding out my final score, you can find the review here: http://www.endworldgaming.com/rpg/battle-chasers-nightwar-review

Thanks for taking the time to check out the review folks and happy gaming!

作为一个日式RPG爱好者玩了几个小时来评测一下，游戏很棒，角色天赋可以随意组合，而且不同角色可以随意组队，玩法自由度很高
地下城可以自由选择难度，越难奖励越多，难度不影响剧情所以可以过剧情之后再回来挑战获取高级奖励

------------------1月23日更新------------------
新鲜感过后过渡到中期明显感觉到怪的难度增强有点不平滑，而且等级设计也有问题，千辛万苦宰BOSS跑支线打竞技场出来的紫装居然还没有几级以后的蓝装绿装厉害，甚至导致锻造系统成了鸡肋. 

附魔系统中规中矩还算满意，药水合成系统太复杂，除了需要收集材料还需要准备不同种类的瓶子（直接一个瓶子搞定会死？），而且我觉得药水合成出来之后效果甚至还没有战斗前吃个料理好.

还有一样必须要吐槽的，就是队伍成员更换只能在酒馆进行而且战斗的时候后备成员不会获得任何经验！明明剧情设定是整个队伍一起在旅行的，换人只能回到酒馆这是什么操作？如果我想试试别的队伍组合，还得拖着低等级人物去练级不然实力太弱拖队伍后腿，虽然前期还不明显但是越到后期越逼肝，到现在因为肝的枯燥我甚至不想去尝试新的阵容了

地图和地图技能的设计非常出彩，在两个世界之间来回切换解决机关很有趣，地图技能可以在打地城的时候创造先手优势进入战斗，但是感觉某些非指向性的技能很难命中（我用手柄玩的），所以如果以后更新可以加入瞄准线或者静止瞄准就更好了

到目前为止这个游戏我还是推荐的，前期研究各种机制，打地城打支线可以轻松沉迷几个小时，但是越到中后期越乏味，总的来说我觉得游戏内容还是值这个价格的

. [strike]Não há opção para desligar a vibração do controle[/strike]
. Não é possível definir as posições/ ordem dos membros do grupo no menu e batalhas (estilo FF7)
. [strike]Quest para a ultimate weapon de Gully[/strike]
. Alguns diálogos/ textos avançam sozinho e sem pausa para a leitura
. As centenas de poções do jogo são totalmente desnecessárias do início ao fim
. Zonas de ação exigem um processamento/ hardware infinitamente superior ao mapa e batalhas
. Opção Buy Back do vendedor acumula todos os itens do jogo interferindo na performance do jogo

- Lista de bugs:
. Alguns Key Itens duplicados ou infinitos
. Alguns Key Itens já utilizados continuam no inventário
. Inimigos dentro de parede ou fora do cenário
. Inimigos presos no ar ou travados
. Algumas armadilhas com loop/ erro no acionamento
. Arquivos continuam nas Dungeons mesmo depois de coletados e registrados
. Menu de Guia de Pescas gera glitch durante a pesca
. Inicador de evento (!) travado na cidade durante todo o New Game Plus
. Indicador de inimigos restantes em uma zona de ação travado (caveira vermelha)
. Indicador de evento em Zona de Ação é exibido em área "sem evento"
. Drop frame rate
. Glitch ao visualizar personagens via menu durante efeitos de relâmpago ou fogo
. [strike]Travamento/ congelamento no indicador de status durante batalha[/strike]
. Dispositivos e baús travados após acessar opção "Save and Quit to Menu" ou alternar mundo dos mortos
. No mapa a camera bugar e não sincronizar com o botão B (XBOX) precisando abrir e fechar o menu para resolver
. Entrar em batalha enquanto interage com objeto pode travar "TODAS" as interações na Zona de Ação
. Salvar manualmente durante uma Zona de Ação pode bugar os eventos de toda a Dungeon

Conclusão:
Battle chasers é um jogo magnífico, mas com um número excessivo de bugs.
Da forma como foi lançado o jogo parece mais um Early Access.
É evidente o lançamento precoce, sem os devidos testes.
Comprei o jogo no lançamento e até o momento em que escrevo essa análise foram lançados três patchs de atualização.
Pouca coisa foi corrigida, os problemas mais gritantes persistem.
Do lançamento ao presente momento podemos definir o jogo em uma frase: Um magnífico jogo comprometido por uma quantia elevada de bugs e um "lançamento antes da hora".
Aos desenvolvedores sugiro que corrijam os bugs a tempo de proporcionar todo o prestígio que o jogo merece.
Eu realmente gostei do projeto, torço para que esses graves erros sejam corrigidos e, assim, o jogo se torne um sucesso.

38223809.review:
After beating the game once in about 50 hours - and now finishing new game + at about 76 hours. Yea I reccomend this game. It might not have the scope of a classic final fantasy game - but damn the battle mechanics and group synergy-effects are fantastic. Even after 70 hours I still liked the battles (as the story was already known to me).
Some people said the game is too easy. Ill say maybe - if you overlevel and run dungeons multiple times it is not very challenging. But new game + really pumped up the difficulty. Honestly i think the game would have been better if it intruduced harder difficulty settings from the start.
So if you like the classic RPGs and get your hands on this at or below 30 bucks - dont hesitate. It will be worth your time.

38217339.review:
A delightful, well-paced and managably-sized game that leaves me sorry to finish, but excited for a sequel. Clean, fun gameplay, nice art, an upbeat vibe, and systems that aren't so mind-bogglingly complex that you need a lifetime of JRPG experience to understand them. Strongly recommend.
Only two downsides: dungeons take time to clear, and it's difficult to save the game and resume mid-way through. Slightly annoying but certainly not a major issue.
Second, the end-game comes a bit quickly. In essence, I'd have liked to have been at peak power a bit longer before the game wrapped. 
Beyond that, I hope they make another!

38207065.review:
Eines Vorweg: Battle Chasers ist wirklich ein klasse Spiel.

Es transportiert wunderbar das schnörkellose Spielgefühl von früheren JRPG und dennoch gelingt es dem Spiel dabei nicht altbacken zu wirken.
Besondere Highlights sind dabei definitiv die toll gezeichnete Präsentation und vor allem die Kämpfe. Diese warten mit gutem Balancing und tatktischem Anspruch auf. Und außerdem liebe ich Spiele mit NewGame+!! ;-)
Was aber sind die Schwächen? 
- Die Spielwelt ist relativ klein, linear (bietet aber auch Potential für ein Add-on?!) und hat kaum Interaktionsmöglichkeiten (Stichwort Städte, NPCs, etc.)
- die Story ist nur "ok"
- man hat manchmal das Gefühl, dass den Spielmechaniken der letzte Tiefgang und Konsequenz fehlt, als Beispiel die Dungeonfähigkeiten, die man nicht zur Bewältigung der Dungeons benötigt

Also für wen ist das Spiel geeignet?
Wer bei seinen Spielen gerne den Fokus auf rundenbasierte Kämpfe, Charakterentwicklung und Verbesserung von Ausrüstung legt, kann bei diesem Titel nichts verkehrt machen und wird definitiv eine menge Spaß haben!

38195071.review:
Bom dia a todos os gamers!

Pare alguns segundos e leia esse review, pois foi feito com carinho para os jogadores que gostam de RPG's old school como eu.

[b] 1) Jogabilidade: [/b] Trata-se de um RPG por turnos (gameplay clássico de jogos da franquia Final Fantasy que fizeram tanto sucesso nas décadas passadas), com uma nuance diferenciada que é o sistema único de sobrecarga de mana e incríveis Explosões de Batalha (Leia-se Limit Breaks - com o diferencial que a barra é única para equipe toda).
 
Sua equipe é composta por 3 personagens por vez, mas ao todo são 6 personagens jogáveis, não citarei nomes para evitar Spoilers.

O jogo é bem linear e possuí diversas "sidequests", algumas extremamente necessárias para o máximo aproveitamento do game. Apesar de os produtores falarem que as dungeons são gerados aleatoriamente, é uma falácia, pois em duas "Runs", você já percebe e desvenda direitinho as particularidades de cada uma.

 Contudo, as vezes buscar um evento específico em uma masmorra pode ser bem cansativo (aqui está o fator aleatório).

 Por fim, vale ressaltar, sistema clássico que não inova, mas é sempre prazeroso para os antiquados como eu. Nota: 8/10


[b]2) Gráficos:[/b] Condizentes com o valor do game, não se trata de uma grande produtora, logo me supreendeu positivamente. Nota: 9/10


[b]3) Sons:[/b] Aqui para mim o jogo foi nota 10, excelente e não chega ser enjoativo.

[b]Avaliação Final:[/b] Daria uma nota 8,5 e considero os R$ 55,00 bem gastos e garantida umas boas 30h de diversão ou umas 50-60h para platinar o game.

38188015.review:
一周目正好30小时，收集要素基本齐了，全员满级~ 收集强迫症的小伙伴可以参考一下。

节奏慢和流程略短这两个问题，就不赘述了。

个人觉得有点不足的地方

第一个点.小怪和BOSS的强度设计太不合理了。。

正常状态下，全员合击都打不死同等级的普通小怪。。导致清小怪异常头疼。。而且JY怪太强，一旦多个JY怪一起参战就血崩。

技能天赋设计得环环相扣，然而并没有什么可发挥的地方。因为BOSS实在太弱。。。满BUFF角色一个技能直接打掉半血。。。完全没爽到BOSS就挂了啊！！打小怪呢又不舍得用蓝，后期主力DPS 剑士和盗贼蓝都只有100出头，只能靠普通攻击攒出来的过载（临时的蓝）放技能，所以你技能再屌还是要老老实实先普攻。法师蓝多，但是技能又要普攻先叠debuff。。。


第二点.装备的强度设计也有点的鸡肋。

装备分绿色 蓝色 紫色，基本对应FB的3个难度，想多刷紫装就要不断地刷传奇难度。而传奇难度的小怪真的难打，FB流程和陷阱也多了不少。然而这么辛苦刷出的紫装，强度被下个FB的绿装完爆。。。而绿装呢，又能正常通下个FB的普通难度。导致刷传奇难度FB有点没有意义。。。


第三点.作为一个单机，素材获取是不是太难了...

首先如果走正常流程要锻造同等级的装备材料是基本不够的，导致要刷多次fb，而且紫装要的材料是绿装的三倍。。。。参考前面说过的紫装淘汰的速度。。。这就导致锻造非常鸡肋。。。

关键是。。这个游戏需要素材的还不只有锻一个。。。附魔和炼金通通要材料。FM需要的个别稀有材料还是剧情流程需要的，说的就是你上古吸血鬼之牙，这货只有一个后期FB一次才刷3只的远古吸血鬼才掉，还不是必掉。。。

炼金的需要的瓶子也是很奇葩，分了8 9种对应不同级别还贼贵。。。然后这个游戏满级才30。。。。分那么细干嘛啊。。。。而且后期女主小loli上万的血，最高级加血也才加1300 1400，完全不实用啊。就不谈加100 200攻击的药剂了，后期人物有4000多攻啊。。。

好了吐槽那么多。。。。但是瑕不掩瑜，游戏还是非常值得一玩，画风非常讨喜，动作帅酷，打击感也到位。FB的桥段也很巧妙，基本没有重复，第一次通的时候，到处透着惊喜。
