Fun game!  You play a small group of raiders who descend on an innocent island and immediately set about slaughtering its citizens, using their body parts to build new and terrifying  weapons to prolong the massacre.  You start out with a war machine, a large-fisted midget and some dude, but eventually you can add an old guy, a mysterious guy and some eye candy.

Although the islanders mostly attempt to defend themselves, there are a small handful of traitors who are happy to purchase your excess booty [spoiler] (for more about excess booty, google Red Monika) [/spoiler] and give you tips on where to find more sentients to kill and take their stuff.  Eventually you'll get strong enough to execute the island's leader whose crime was wanting to not die.

Also fishing, riddles [spoiler] and Red Monika [/spoiler].

38119903.review:
It's a good 5$ game, you know? I understand that given the visuals it's not 5$, but at the end of the day - it's a game and not a cartoon. We pay for the game. 

TL;DR
-Collectible scripts writer (small parchments you find in the game) - GOOD
-Music - GOOD
-Art - GOOD
-UI - GOOD
-Localization - GOOD
-Loot design - Awful, Rare/Epic loot comes in loot boxes, RARILY of enemies. IN A SP GAME. 
-Crafting - meh, destroys loot, by giving better items than ANY loot
-Story - meh, just meh. If there wasn't any you wouldn't notice. 
-Characters - steriotypical. Intersting? No. 
-Progression - GOD NO. That's not NOT how you make progression in a Single Player RPG game. 
-Enemies - after 1/2 TOO MANY reused assets and simple NPCs are stronger than bosses by miles. Question: What's the purpose of bosses then? They don't even drop anything that is stronger that you have equipted. 

Detailed Review:

Really enthralling for the first... 10-14 levels but then it's just becomes a thing of "meh". Basically the developers artificially increased the game's length to fit the pricetag, or whatever. It reflects in the story and character developement AND progression. Which is the most relevant thing to an RPG game. Progression becomes stunningly boring and you start feeling like you're "wasting" time instead of "spending" it on this game after 1/2 of the game. 

I have no idea how a game can start at 100 and go to -50 in a matter of it's 1/2 length. Why did you even make the second half of the game? It's simply not fun to play nor to finish it after that. 

I didn't finish the game simply because I tried 3 times(after the first 1/2) and just got soooo bored that I can't be bothered. Nothing in this game draws you to finish it nor to find out about it's characters. Again, after the frist half of the game. 

On sale - I don't know. If you have to. If it's like 5$ - you won't regret it. 

Full price - GOD NO. This game does NOT cost 30$. If you want to support the composers and art designers, then buy the fan pack dlc but that's it. Game design is just too lazy and poor for that price tag. It's a good try, which gets detroyed 1/2 into the game. 




PS. what i mean by boring is that the game FORCES you to grind, if you want to have a good experience and puts WAY too many encounters in later dungeons. It just gets annoying and you notice how it's simply there to make the dungeons longer. It's a SP game, not MMO, i don't want this $hit in my game.

38110559.review:
I'll give my tldr bullet point list here and give a more detailed explanation later if you want to read the whole thing.

Verdict- If you can get past the grind there is a lot to love here. Get it if you don't mind some grinding.

Pros:
-Amazing sound design. I can't think of a game that sounds better than this one.
-Great art direction. Everything looks really good.
-Interesting cast. I really like all the characters and I'm sad I can't use them all.

Cons:
-Grinding. You will grind xp and repeat dungeons and the game will expect you to be happy about it.
-Archaic xp. Characters you don't use do not get xp so even more grinding if you want to be able to adjust your party.
-Combat gets repetetive. I have yet to feel the need to change my tactics 17 hours in. 

The first and most important thing you need to know about this game is that it is a grind. You will be grinding for xp. You will need to repeat the same dunegeons multiple times on harder difficulties. There are some roguelike aspects to it as diferent events will occur but they do not feel varied or interesting enough to make the dengeons feel worth clearing 3 times. Also enemies do not scale to you. You can be overlevelled and walk through a duneon with your eyes closed or you can be underlevelled and have no choice but to go back and grind more levels/better gear. If you can't deal with that don't buy this game. Combat is standard turn based combat with some minor twists like overcharge that lets you overcap your mana to cast abilities and lots of reliance on status effects to deal maximum damage. I have yet to feel the need to change up my tactics much after 17 hours so if you want deep, interesting battle mecahanics look elsewhere. Another frustration is using the outdated and not missed mechanic of not giving the party members who are not in your active party xp. They will sit in town and fall farther and farther behind necessitating that you either grind a ton more to keep everyone levelled or using the same 3 members for the entire game, making the already repetetive combat even more so as you can't change up your party. Exacerbating this problem even more is the fact that you don't get xp for fighting enemies too far below you. So if you want to leech up your lower level characters your high leveled ones will get little to no xp for it. Why they thought this was a good idea I will never know.

But everything else about this game is so good. The art style is beautiful and striking. The sound design is the best I have ever heard in a game. I can't remeber ever sitting there playing a game other than this one thinking "God damn this game sounds so cool." I can't praise this enough. The game sounds awesome. In addition, the characters are all interesting which makes it even more annoying that you can't use them all without tons of extra grinding. Despite its flaws the combat is not a weakness. Its just not a strength, but to be honest you can pretty much always know what to expect going into a game with turn based combat.

38038749.review:
Hinweis:
Wer nicht grinden will sollte tunlichst das spiel meiden. Spätestens ab dem 4ten Dungeon muss bereits in den vor -dungeons gear und mats gefarmt werden für besseres Eqip. Außerdem ist das Endgame etwas zu kurz gekommen.

Das Balancing ist ganz in Ordnung. Die Helden sind alle einzigartig und haben untereinander verschieden "combos" bzw. Fähigkeiten welche gut zueinander passen. Es gibt hierbei (später!) auch keine gewungenen Rollen wie Heal, Tank, DD. 

Die story ist so, naja. Ganz nett, aber mir fehlt eindeutig mehr Quests und interaktion mit den Helden untereinander. Die kämpfe sind gut anzuschauen, allerdings etwas langsam. Ein Dungeon-Durchgang kann schon mal 20-40 Minuten dauern. 75% davon sind Kämpfe die es in die Länge ziehen.

Die Dungeons sind teils-zufallsgeneriert und haben selbst in mehreren durchläufen pro dungeon immer wieder neue Interaktionen und Rätsel.

Das Crafting hat vieles was es richtig und einiges was es falsch macht. So kann man für alle Helden Gear craften. Die Rezepte findet sich als kaufbares Handbuch für wenig Gold bei den Händlern in dem Dorf. Allerdings sind die Rezepte meist begrenzt auf 2-3 Helden. D.h. man kauft sich ein Buch, in dem findet sich bspw. für die ersten drei Charaktere 3 Waffen für Stufe 13. die anderen Charaktere haben nichts für die Stufe 13 zum craften. Das kann manchmal nerfend sein.
Als Entwarnung - später gibt es für alle Helden gear zum Craften. Auch hat jeder eine besondere Waffe (legendär), die er durch quests später craften kann.


Für den Preis und den Inhalt kann ich getrost sagen das es ein gutes Spiel ist.

38032142.review:
Игра в стиле JRPG. Получилось ли хайпануть, на чувствах ностальгируюших 30 летних детей, чье детство сделали счастливым японцы? Нет.

Девчонка, её голем, а так же их свита в виде старого мага, мужественного война и обворажительной разбойницы  путешествуют с целью раскрыть секрет волшебных перчаток вышеупомянутой девчонки. Вам не нужно знать их имена потому что они не имеют никакого значения, это не имена Дарта Фелда или Клауда Страйфа (его меч в игре кстати есть), которые фанаты помнят и любят до сих пор со времен PS1. Сюжет обрывается сразу после пролога. Секрет перчаток вы так и не узнаете, ведь сюжетные рельсы внезапно поворачивают в сторону противостояния мага крови и вызванного им демона, а ваши перчатки их не интересует от слова совсем. Чем заканчивается противостояние этих двух вы к слову тоже не узнаете, потому что даже этот второй по счету сюжет так же обрывается на середине. 

О геймплее. На удивление, здесь меньше всего претензий - Final Fantsy VII не так то просто испортить, хоть они и очень старались. Да, он не сбалансированный, некоторые приемы совершенно бесполезны, другие напротив суперэффективны, но в целом играется бодро.

Самое больное место Battle Chasers: Nightwar это геймдизайн и общая конва повествования. Настолько отвратительного говна я даже не мог и представить. Давайте вспомним как это было например в The Legend of Dragoon - герой возвращается в родной дом после долгих странствий и обнаруживает свою деревню разрушенной, а его подругу детства схватили и бросили в тюрьму. Дарт расправляется с местными захватчиками,и бросается на выручку своей нареченной, в процессе увлекательных приключений он обзаводиться необычными друзьями, совершенно неожиданно для игрока теряет некоторых из их. Все герои попадают в разные интересные ситуации: ссорятся, миряться, влюбляются. Обязательно есть сюжеты из прошлого, создающие нерратив и многое другое.
Ничего подобного в этой игре нет. О самих персонажах у нас есть 2 строчки текста в начальном меню, каждый из них по сути это просто сухой набор характеристик. Вместо крутых приключений и красивейщих локаций у нас есть процедурно генерируемые подземелья. Это не мультиплеерная игра, но да, здесь надо крабить данжи, чтобы прокачивать персонажа и продвигаться по тому, что в Battle Chasers: Nightwar называется сюжетом.

На открытие всех достижений вам понадобиться более 60 часов, при условии, что все сделаете правильно с первого раза. Если нет, но вы любите доводить дело до конца, готовтесь отдать до 100 часов своей драгоценной жизни в этот бездушный продукт. 

П.С. Хотите поиграть во что нибудь этакое? Если не играли в FF VII, купите здесь же в стиме ПК версию, выйдет дешевле и удовольствие получите большее, несмотря на устаревшую графику или скачайте эмулятор PS1 со встроенным The Legend of the Dragoon совершенно бесплатно - в интернете полно ссылок.

38031748.review:
Je dois bien avouer que je suis déçu... Ce RPG au tour par tour est sorti depuis 2 mois maintenant et il est passé au travers de mes recherches malgré mon addiction pour ce genre de jeu !

Petit détail avant de commencer la lecture, le jeu est en français intégral voix comprises.

Pour ne pas spoiler quoi que ce soit, [u] aucun élément du scénario ne sera révélé ici [/u], je vais donc rester très générique sur ce point.

Vous vous retrouvez ainsi à la tête d'un groupe de personnages relativement attachant et au background agréable, groupe qui s'étoffe au fur et à mesure de l'aventure.


[h1] Déplacement [/h1]

Vous devrez explorer les lieux à l’aide de trois phases de gameplay différentes : en mode carte, le groupe se balade sur la map, en suivant les différentes routes possibles. La carte possède des points d’intérêts fixes (villages, donjons, téléporteurs) et certains éléments changent à chaque fois qu’un joueur sort d’un donjon (emplacement des montres, objets, coffres...). L’avantage de cette phase est que les combats ne sont pas aléatoires, on voit ce qui nous attend sur le chemin, on peut ainsi éviter certains combats au besoin.


[h1] Exploration [/h1]

La seconde phase de jeu est le dungeon-crawling à l’intérieur des fameux donjons/zones d’exploration qui servent de marqueurs d’histoire et qui dévoilent une partie du scénario. Tous ne seront pas accessibles dès le début du jeu. Il faudra d’abord en terminer un pour déverrouiller un accès sur la carte qui conduira au suivant, et ainsi de suite. A l’intérieur des donjons, le gameplay change pour adopter une vue isométrique et des déplacements libres. Ici, les monstres se baladent librement et réagissent dès qu’ils vous ont dans leur ligne de vue. Attention à ne pas attirer trop d’ennemis à vous, car ils s’empileront dans la partie combat.

Plusieurs puzzles dans diséminés dans ces donjons générés aléatoirement que vous allez traverser (soit pour ouvrir une porte, pour débloquer un trésor, etc...). Mais attention, si vous échouez à certains, le butin sera perdu, définitivement perdu...


[h1] Combat [/h1]

Au-delà du bestiaire déjà agressif (comptez plus de 150 créatures ou ennemis différents), les pièges mortels tendus par l’environnement sont nombreux. Enfin ce n’est rien à côté des combats. Que l’on soit sur la map ou dans les donjons, le jeu passe dans un mode JRPG tour par tour d’aspect très traditionnel, mais qui a bien y regarder est vraiment excellent !
Chaque personnage ou ennemi va taper à son tour, jusque là rien d'exceptionnel me direz vous.
A disposition : des attaques classiques, des compétences qui consomment du mana et un pouvoir spécial par personnage qui se charge en fonction des coups portés. Sauf que le jeu bouleverse en profondeur ces fondamentaux. Au fur et à mesure du gain de niveau, on débloque de nouvelles attaques qui rajoutent des états : saignement, poison, ébranlement, etc.

L’originalité du jeu vient du fait que vous pouvez combiner des compétences qui vont tirer partie de ces états pour rajouter des dégâts supplémentaires, créer des barrières de protection ou soigner votre petite bande.
Une autre capacité, la surpuissance, vient rajouter une brique de plus à l'édifice : ces points générés par certaines attaques "de base" servent de réserve bonus de mana qui se vide à la fin du combat. Pratique pour ne pas gaspiller son précieux mana, mais aussi mettre en application d’autres synergies avec des héros exploitant la surpuissance. Un excellent gameplay, d'autant que la mise en scène l'est tout autant !


[b] En résumé je ne peux que vous conseiller ce RPG innovant, magnifique, agréable et plaisant. [/b]

37982164.review:
Greetings and salutations!

I was one of many individuals that contributed to the Kickstarter campaign and fortunately (unlike Mightly #9) haven't the slightest of regret, quite the opposite really; Battle Chasers: Nightwar comes highly recommended for fans of the JRPG/RPG genre.
I was also quite impressed with the soundtrack - tracks such as "The Beginning", "Dreaming of Crits", "When the Smoke Clears", "A Hidden Dagger", "In Harms Way", "A Matter of Time" to name a few really supplemented the gameplay and have now found a new home on my Zune.
I also applaude the voice acting and polish invested in the gameplay and art style - Joe Madureira and the art team did a fantastic job with the detailed, vibrant environments and animations.

Several individuals complained of the "grinding" factor towards the later portion of the game but I didn't feel it was -that- bad...however... 
My one complaint (and warning) is that any teammates not in your active party WILL NOT level alongside everyone else - so in that regard, this does tend to become somewhat tedious when having to cycle out members simply to level. 

I'm extremely proud of Airship Syndicate, their contribution and effort placed into Battle Chasers and eagerly await additional releases from the developer (with hopefully several more sequels/DLC to Battle Chasers in the near future) 

Thank you for your time - I hope this review convinces you to purchase this lovely game.

37981363.review:

The only thing I can complain about is the ending.  I won't spoil it, but there better be a sequel.

TL/DR: 5$ game.

Cons: 
1) Low amount of content(the game has very short storyline and non existent end game thrills as the main threat is the last boss who is killable in 3 turns without max level and random gear)
2) NG+ doesn't offer much except an intencive for minmaxing traits that break an already easily broken game). Legendary dungeons are easier than anything you can think of in your first playthrough
3) Game has been so broken at release that it has been patched, but broken mechanics(that you use by reading characters abilities and not watching youtube or whatever) remain exploitable, just a tiny less what the fuckesque.

Pros:
1) Decent story pace and arts, despite beeing childish
2) Decent retro feel
3) OK character design
4) OK soundtrack

37821412.review:
I'm thoroughly enjoying Battle Chasers. The art style is beautiful, the interface is intuitive (would definite recommend using a console controller) and the game play is fun.

Only negative is the JRPG style combat becomes a little same-y against the base creatures. That said there are plenty of genuinely different creatures to discover, the animations and mini cut scenes in combat are great and the boss & special encounter battles are well worth it.

On top of all that, there is an immense crafting system :-D

Highly recommend you give Battle Chasers a go!

37816944.review:
В целом - неплохо.
Глобально - ничего грандиозного. 

Локально :
- отличная музыка (парочка в трек листе уже с первого "услыханья")
- атмосферно и любителям всего рисованного/диковинки/комиксов порадует все фибры души
- в целом добрая и дитю можно прикупить для общего развития 
- практичная для нашего быстрого ритма жизни
После работы идеально заходит к примеру. Ключевые подземелья можно хоть до уср*чки проходить и прогресс при выходе не будет теряться, то есть - недопрошёл (залип там с джойсиком на диване, жена захотела интимного внимания или просто устал от игры, ибо однообразие порой гонит в скуку всё таки, а в этой игре оно имеется, так как жанр позволяет). Просто выключил. Включил на следующий день и продолжай пробираться сквозь тьму немытых волосатых пещер и сооружений древности местого мирка в поисках прекрасной музыки, крупиц сюжета, люлей от босса и последующей за этим всем награды.
- в целом несложная, но если увлечься и не быть предусматрительным, глядя в будущее. Быстроразвивающийся сюжет ("сюжет" это конечно громко сказано) никак тебя не вознаградит и не подготовит даже к обычным рядовым мобам в новой локе, которые нагнут всю твою самоуверенную шайку, которая, в свою очередь, пару часов назад покорила "половину средиземья" и заслужила почёт и уважуху у местных бомжей-селян. Немножко гриндить вообщем надо.
- сюжет такой - тупенький, как большинство комиксов п*ндосов из которых эта игра и пошла собстна. 
Он тупой, но по-детски. То есть это как сказку почитать, которую бабушка перед сном вычитывала из древней, как и сама бабушка книги в сладком детстве. И это в целом расслабляет после трудового дня. Но немножко разочаровывает в купе с остальными мелкими недостатками, на которых будет зацикливаться лишь конченный юзер, который видит лишь х*р перед своими глазами, как в жизни, так и в виртуальном пространстве.

По моему скромному мнению - это игра притягательна для того, кому нравятся красивые вещи. З*дротам может понравится гринд и возможные совершенство своей труппы на протяжении десятков часов. Но всех их может разочаровать то, что вы сами хотели бы ожидать от игры просто взглянув на картинку. От неё не стоит ожидать ничего грандиозного и сверх нового. 
В играх уже кончается то, что можно придумать :) 
Не очень усидчивым игрокам - не стоит брать эту игру. 
Тем, кто хочет сюжетища в кубе помноженным на сочную похабную старшеклассницу Юлю - тоже стоит воздержаться.
А те, кто всегда рад познавать новое и радовать себя тем, что им нравится. Сильно не пожалеют ибо у них, помимо "игор", есть куча дел.

(ну вроде для значка сойдёт)
Играйте в то, что нравится.
Живите, как хочется (ну или стремитесь к этому)

И конечно же, Бобра :)

37768529.review:
Очень качественная и интересная игра. Крайне приятная рисовка, отличные персонажи, много интересных механик, очень удобный ui, очень крутая анимация персонажей и противников в бою.
Но есть одно но. Бои в абсолютном большинстве своём слишком однообразные, и слабовариативные, в них очень мало тактического разнообразия. Большинством способностей героев я так и не пользовался (хотя и постоянно пытался найти им применение), ибо они в любой ситуации проигрывали небольшому набору действительно нужных способностей. Значительная часть противников — это те же самые враги, только с другими скинами и немного изменёнными характеристиками. В итоге, бои часто воспринимались как гринд.
В завершение хочу сказать, что я получил немало удовольствия, играю в Battle Chasers. Ещё бы побольше разнообразия боёв в ней... и было бы вообще шикарно.

37741888.review:
En achetant ce jeu je savais que je n’allais pas être déçu. Pour autant, il a réussi à me surprendre dans le bon sens par bien des choses.

Il est tout ce qu’on peut espérer d’un J-Rpg au tour par tour. On le croirait tout droit sorti de cette époque fabuleuse où Squaresoft était capable de nous pondre plusieurs chefs-d’œuvre du genre à l’année.

Airship Syndicate aime son jeu. Battle Chasers à une âme et fourmille de bonnes idées. Graphisme, OST, univers attachant, feeling des combats, stratégie, durée de vie, multitudes de secrets… tout y est. Vraiment. Comme si la recette oubliée par tant d’autres était là, juste sous nos yeux, attendant d’être réanimée pour notre plus grand plaisir avec une touche de modernité qui convient parfaitement aux nouveaux joueurs que nous sommes devenus.

Si on ne peut qu’être un brin désillusionné par le classicisme du scénario et quelques problèmes de rythme dans la progression, c’est un jeu qui mérite d’être mis en valeur pour le travail excellent qui a été fait. J’encourage les développeurs à 100% dans la voie qu’ils ont choisie.

37550569.review:
Though not without it's issues and as someone who generally does NOT like JRPG style gameplay I have been playing this long enough that I definitely think it is a thumbs up rather than down.

This is a good, not great, game and is probably one of the most consistently gorgeous games I've ever played. I am stunned that they can maintain the art style while also giving us procedurally generated dungeon crawls. I tend to like the overall character design and stories even if Red Monika is basically every female game character trope rolled into one. I realize these are originally comic book characters but that isn't a far cry in terms of character archetypes. 

The biggest problem, and this is probably something JRPG fans are used to living with, is the repetition. There is no autobattle for easy encounters, no way to skip or speed up animations, and it feels like the game is constantly pausing. Despite a fairly solid story, good characters, amazing setting, there is no flow to the game due to what feels like constant interruptions and tedious encounters. However, this is counterbalanced somewhat with the lack of necessary grinding most games of this type has. 

Overall it was well worth the money even though I have not played all the way through as of this writing. I usually don't praise games for their visuals but this game is amazing in that department.

37397099.review:
[h1]Joe Madureira Strikes Back [/h1]

Como dice el encabezado de este análisis, Joe lo ha conseguido ha plasmado su maestria en los cómics en un videojuego , muy notable todo el juego en general no solo es que el juego visualmente merezca la pena sino que hay mucho más que un juego bonito. 

Un factor importante es que el videojuego basa la mayoría de los personajes protagonistas en un cómic muy famoso a finales de los 90 Battle Chasers asi que antes de adentrarse en materia es fundamental tener en cuenta esto. Ahora centrandonos en a que género peternece pues es un RPG inspirado en los mejores juegos del género. Adéntrate en las mazmorras, lucha por turnos con el formato clásico de los JRPG; y sumérgete en una historia que progresará a medida que explores el mundo del juego.

[b]Características:[/b]
- Combate por turnos y planifica bien cada estrategia para afrontar a los enemigos con diferentes tácticas.
- Explora un mundo repleto de mazmorras, jefes, y amigos y enemigos.
- Mazmorras aleatorias. Usa las habilidades exclusivas de cada héroe para afrontar mejor a los enemigos, sortear trampas o empezar las batallas con ventaja
- 6 Personajes exclusivos del mundo Battle Chasers, cada uno con sus propias características, ventajas, objetos y habilidades
- Fabrica tu propio equipamientos y objetos
- Doblado al castellano
- Mazmorras aleatorias con tres tipos de dificultades
- Minijuego de pesca
- Misiones secundarias, cacerías donde te enfrentas a enemigos únicos y desafiantes,asi como diversos secretos que te invitan a explorar mazmorras 
- NG +
- Personaliza tu personaje según las ventajas que vayas desbloqueando subiendo de nivel o completando el bestiario

Me gustaría destacar la calidad del doblaje al castellano me parece muy loable que un juego de estas características se haya currado un doblaje tan bueno tanto a nivel de personajes principales como de npcs. Por otro lado la selección musical me ha parecido muy buena algunos temás merecen reconocimiento e incluso te sorprenden porque inconscientemente acabas por tatarearlos. Pero no todo es bueno en el juego hay ciertos bugs que por suerte se presentan poco me he encontrado en alguna mazmorra sin poder presionar el botón para interactuar con cofres, alguna ralentización tambien he experimentado pero por suerte son casos aislados. Por ir terminar decir que soy un de los backers del KS ,estoy encantado con el juego me parece que han hecho un gran trabajo en general y que espero ver una segunda parte porque los seguidores y los jugadores fans del rol tenemos aqui un buen representante del género.

37353935.review:
This game is a good, solid, turn-based-combat RPG.  Game mechanics are easy to grasp, combat's fun but challenging if you're not overleveled to the nth degree, enemies are nicely varied for a small setting (the entire game takes place on a single island), the artwork and character designs are gorgeous, and the story, while nothing to write home about, isn't some convoluted mess that makes no sense (*cough*FFXV*cough*).  You're a band of adventurers stranded on an island, stuff happens, and you set out to fix things.  

Where Battle Chasers has some fun with things is the character archetypes: for example, your first three characters are set up in the classic tank/healer/dps setup, but instead of the war golem or the badass swordsman with the BFS being the tank, it's the tiny little blonde girl with the big gloves who tanks, the swordsman is your (rather squishy) DPS, and the golem's most valuable contribution is it/he can toss out heals better than anyone.

All in all, like I said above, a good, solid game, and one I heartily recommend.

37127175.review: This is a great RPG for people who embrace the New Game + grind.  NG + changes the game from an easy flowing overleveled experience into a more difficult battle feeling underleveled and undergeared at all times.  Rolling over the perk points might sound overpowered and easy but it will feel like the only thing keeping you alive for a good while.  I played every dungeon, as I got to them, on new highest difficulty and it was much more challenging and satisfying.  You will no longer be able to walk through normal mobs with ease and unlike the first playthrough you will need to think more about strategy and team compositions.  Even in the endgame dungeon you will be 3 to 4 levels lower than the mobs since you are capped at 30 and they are not.  Worthwhile time investment to get to NG + where the real challenge can begin.

This game exceeded my expectation. I waited a long time to find a turn base game that i like. This one was the best game that i played since final fantasy X. It remind me of old school JRPG. The strategy in combat and the choices to build your characters are well done. It feel like your choices suites your play style and they actually matter. The story is also good. It isn't revolutionnary but it does the job. Graphic wise, the game is beautiful. I like the cartoony art style they choose.

However, IMO, the game is too short. The cap at level 30 is too low. NG+ help a bit but not that much. I would have taken more.  The map is also too small. It would have taken a bigger continent to explore. 

This game is not perfect but its a good starting point for the future. I just hope they add content to it or work on a sequel. 

Overall, i really liked this game and i recommend it if you like turn base rpg with strategy involved.
I give it a 8/10

Я всё же поставлю положительный отзыв, потому что у игры есть много плюсов. а я её просто "переждал". Я правда очень давно ждал эту игру, очень давно увидел на неё трейлер, задолго до того, как её анонсировали на Switch и все внезапно о ней заговорили. Для меня в игре то по сути 3 минуса
1) очень медленное передвижение внутри данжей, персонаж будто сквозь воду двигается, это сделано для того, чтобы было сложнее избегать ловушки и уворачиваться от нападений противников, но это очень замедляет и тяготит геймплей, когда тебе надо пробежать по данжу в противоположные комнаты и туда нет портала (а такое почти всегда)
2) намеренная задумка повторных прохождений данжей. Возможно это не было бы минусом, если бы не первый пункт. но меня раздражало по ним бегать повторно ради лута и в некоторых обязательно вначале пробежать налево, потом через весь данж направо обратно, возможно уже патчами это поправили, но я пока более не играл.
3) это скорее такой себе минус, но...он касается оригинальной истории. Оригинальный комикс BattleChasers не был окончен и обрывается посреди сюжета. И логично было бы хоть как-то вначале игры обрисовать, хотя бы короткими обрывочными флешбэками как герои оказались на дирижабле и отправились в путешествие (потому что комикс заканчивается вообще не на этом), но нет. Возможно я не знаю о каком дополнительном выпуске, который связывает события комикса и игры, тогда простите за незнание

А в остальном, мне всё нравится. Боёвка простая, понятная и горячо любимая из старых игр. Сам факт возможности персонализировать героев шмотками и разными скиллами, тоже радует. Какие то неленейные события в самой игре тоже, в зависимости от ваших действий, пусть и мелких. Ну и стиль, игра очень визуально приятная.

36806696.review:
This game was such a tasty donut for me. I haven't been so pleasantly surprised in a long time by a game, and I feel like it's necessary to explain how much. I had [i]zero[/i] interest in this game. The trailer seemed a little bland, although the art style was certainly distinctive, reminding me a bit of Darksiders (as it turns out, this is because they share a common art director in Joe Madeuira), but not enough to draw me in. The game came out, my friends raved about how good it was, but I remained unconvinced. One of them wound up buying the game for me, and then I begrudgingly tried it out... and didn't put it down for hours.

Battle Chasers is clearly a game made with love and is a better title in the classic Final Fantasy turn-based style of RPG than some Final Fantasy games. Combat is satisfying, with attacks having weight to them and half the fun being creating synergies of buffs and debuffs that make your party wildly powerful in combat. The art is gorgeous, with beautiful environments that I never tired of seeing and hand-drawn cutscenes that looked good and evoked Battle Chasers' origins as a comic series. The real gem in this package is the soundtrack, with Jesper Kyd creating perhaps his best work yet.

This game does have a few pitfalls: Combat difficulty can be a bit of a roller-coaster ride, spiking up and dropping down based on gear choices and whether or not you've done enough Arbitrary JRPG Grinding for the area you're in. Conversely, as XP gains are based on challenge, with trivial foes providing no XP at all, you can find yourself in a couple of spots where the answer is to either slam into the wall of difficult content or just grind, baby! The writing is a mixed bag: While there are some touching moments between characters, the greater plot is a Quest for the Magical Plot Device and its clever quips are YMMV: I [i]despised[/i] the idea that the town is literally called Harm's Way (get it?), but my friends appreciated it.

In short, Battle Chasers isn't reinventing anything, but it's damn good at what it tries to do, and is an excellent entry at the $30 mid-range price point that is well worth the price of admission.

36678096.review:
Yeah, Battle Chasers isn't perfect but it's still worth picking up (in time).

Overall, the gameplay is solid.  Mechanics are well thought out and there's a lot of interesting interplay going on for some tactical depth.  There's some wonkiness with how turns work (Selecting abilities and when a non-instant ability fires off are considered two separate turns) which messes with how DoTs, Buffs, and Debuffs function in a way that I don't consider to be intuitive.  There are definitely issues game balance and it's mostly that you can make very simple side-by-side comparisons of abilities and pick a clear winner.  Some abilities don't seem to scale as well as others and its really obvious by the end of the game.  Other than that, Calibretto is Too Damn Good and I don't think he ever left my party.
Overcharge is a good mechanic.  I really appreciate that the game is proper turn-based and not some garbage ATB thing.

The biggest (and currently most commonly brought up) issue with the game is that battles are long and there's a lot of them and it makes dungeons and even overworld travel feel like a slog.  It also aggravates some other issues with the game.  XP isn't shared with non-active party members.  XP Gains are also relatively low for the time spent in battle.  Scaling in the game is fairly steep; damage and hit point values jump up significantly every couple of levels.  Underleveled and undergeared characters are literally dead weight if you bring them into a dungeon (with that said, even corpses in your active party will gain full xp... silver lining?).  All these things put together means that keeping all of your characters leveled up is a humongous chore.  I have just under 3 million games on my backlog, Knolan, I am not going to bother leveling you up old man.
Anyhow, the easiest fix is to have an option to speed up battle animations (2-3x).  I'd also like to see Any % amount of XP given to non-active party members... alternatively, removing level restrictions on equipment would do a lot to alleviate what I will dub as "The Knolan Problem."  Also, Also, I would like to see fewer but more significant fights.  Combo Battles are interesting and there aren't enough of them.

The game is very visually pleasing.  Each character and monster model are detailed and look great.  Attack animations have a real weight to them.  Colors are vibrant and delicious to my eyeballs.  Red Monica's boobs are fine, I don't understand why it's such a point of contention for some reviewers.
The music is okay.  I really like the boss track but the rest of the soundtrack is fairly generic.

The UI is fantastic as long as you're using a mouse to navigate through all the menus.  Otherwise, using your Keyboard or a Controller can be a bit of a hassle.  You can play the game with one hand with the keyboard, which I consider a positive.

Story is pretty sparse.  The character moments you get in the inn are good, but it'd be nice to see more stuff out in the world too.  

Overall, I like the game and I like its potential and presentation.  This is the most solid old-school JRPG that I've played in years.  If there's a sequel, I'll kickstart that too.

36677648.review: Turn based RPG battle system done right!! Excellent loot system, clean UI and easy to navigate. Theres nothing to dislike about this game!! its fun to play

36676110.review:
This is a mashup of two staples of my childhood as this title combines american comic book characters and artwork with JRPG party based video games.

It's a really good but not quite great game in my book. I like the battle system and think they did a good job to build on the old JRPG turnbased systems of yore. The story is solid and in line with the comic book it serves as a sequel too. The artwork and animations are top-notch and the highlight of the experience in my book. It would have been nice to see a heavier focus on cutscenes and videos to really play up the experience but what's here is great to be enjoyed.

Although I found much of the game outside of combat to be enjoyable it does get a little repetitve for the last 4-6 hours. Kudos for making the exploration of dungeons, the world map, and various areas done in way that feels somewhat meaningful. It's meaningful in that you will see all enemies before you fight them and have various abilities that can help you avoid traps or give some bonus once you've engaged them in battle. I found this aspect of the game was a little undercooked in that the basics of interacting with the world outside of combat are pretty much fully explained and explored after a few hours. Using skills and avoiding traps is fun but not as smoothed or polished as it could be.  It doesn't take anything away from the game but  I feel like this was a great idea and a missed opportunity for brining this game to classic status. If they do make a sequel I hope they decide to make this aspect a bigger part of the overall experience.

It's good gameplay for a great price and really pretty package. It's got some flaws but I've been more than pleased with it.

So Objectively it's a 7/10

.... if your into the art style bump it up a notch.

Subjectively 8.5/10 was where I wound up by the end of it :).

Um dos melhores RPG's que já joguei, Battle Chasers: Nightwar consegue juntar o clássico combate por turnos com exploração de masmorras, além de ótimas animações e uma bela arte.

Como falei é um RPG por turnos, com status e habilidades que vão definir o seu combate. Os personagens são bem variados e todos possuem habilidades únicas, que geram uma boa vareabilidade de estratégias possíveis. E as animações de combate são uma beleza e fazem o jogo ficar bem fluído e bonito.

Em boa parte do jogo você vai estar explorando masmorras, que estão cheia de segredos, missões secundárias, itens raros e também textos engraçados que contam um pouco da história do jogo. Como as masmorras são geradas aleatoriamente as vezes você vai precisar repeti-las buscando por um certo item ou evento acontecer.

Armas e itens são bem variados e balanceados, dificuldade é bem ajustada por áreas (você também pode escolher a dificuldade nas masmorras) e não tive nenhum problema técnico durante o jogo.

Battle Chasers: Nightwar é perfeito, do meu ponto de vista. O único problema que tive foi buscar um evento específico em uma masmorra, o que me custou 20min de entra e saí da masmorra. Ainda assim o jogo é muito bom, perfeito para qualquer um que goste de RPG.

-Excelente banda sonora que te acompañara durante toda tu experiencia por el juego sumergiendote en el mundo de Battle chasers.

36473479.review:
It's probably the best JRPG style game I've played since FFX (or FFVII). That said, I like the dialog writing better.

The storyline is quite straightforward, though... not many sidequests, and it's impossible you miss the main story getting distracted by other things to do. Still, it's a good story, and you're along for the ride.

There's a grind part to level up the characters, but is not as bad as in other RPGs. Here, combat is actually fun. The neverending combinations between characters has made me level up all of them, and when I can't beat a specific boss with some characters, a different combination may prove better for that purpose. It's a pity you can't change them on the fly during combat, or in the middle of a dungeon (unless you leave and go in again).

Visually enticing, I really like the looks of it. They make justice to the spectacular original comics. The fact that they choose some comic-style cutscenes instead of videos is a wink to its origins, and I couldn't be happier about it. Pity that they weren't done by Madureira himself, though, but the artist is competent.

Now, my complaint is the unstability of the game. Sometimes I can get a few hours straight of playing, sometimes I can't play for more than 5 minutes. I have a load of error logs due to the game freezing and crashing 10 times in a session. Then maybe next time runs flawlessly. I don't know if there are any bad interactions with other software or what, but it is the same for both my desktop computer and my Surface Pro 4.

When the day is right, though, it plays perfectly in both, using the best graphics configuration (My Surface has Intel i7 with 16 GB of RAM and Intel Iris graphics, my desktop has an AMD Phenom II with 8 GB of RAM and a GeForce GTX 750 Ti). Depending on the combat there might be a slight lag in loading the 3D models for it, but it's like a hiccup that lasts less than a second, in any case.

Best played with controller (I have a Logitech F710), but it's fine with keyboard and mouse. I only wish it could be played entirely with point-and-click, because then I could play with the Surface in tablet mode entirely. I already can do that in combat, and it's like it was designed for it, but moving the characters in a dungeon or in the map needs either the controller or the keyboard. Food for thought.

In any case, despite the bugs and freezes and crashes, it's still a great game, and I'm afraid that I'll be left wanting more when I finish. So I really hope for either DLC content, or a full-fledged sequel. I'd get it without any further thought.

Very recommended.

36470077.review:
Я, как это часто бывает, сначала посмотрел пиратку, потом купил в стиме. Из-за этого у меня ноль часов наиграно.
В целом игра очень приятная и я ее рекомендую всем, кому нравится такой геймплей. Игрушка легкая, ненапряжная, в ней мало чего раздражающего. Ее приятно исследовать, разбираться. В целом у меня получилось где-то 50 часов на ее исследование, что, на мой взгляд вполне достаточно.

Из недостатков - какого-либо баланса в игре нет. И какой-либо глубины тоже. То, что в игру интересно играть, почти полностью заслуга дизайнеров уровней и персонажей. После прохождения игра предлагает начать НГ+, но никакого желания делать это нет. Возможно, игра будет посложнее и потребует больше усилий. Но глядя на алхимию баланса какого-либо ожидать не приходится. Алхимия бесполезна почти полностью, за исключением зелий воскрешения.
Еще пример из баланса, Гаррисон может сделать под конец игры крит где-то на 250-300к одни ударом (+часть этого урона будет идти в виде кровотечения). Максимум жизней у последнего босса - 25к.

Еще из некоторых недостатков. Хотя рандомность уровней идет как плюс, но иногда требуется найти конкретную комнату. И за 10 переигровок уровня вы можете ее не встретить. Это не позволяет выполнить некоторые квесты или собрать легендарное оружия. И это очень дико раздражает.

Но в целом это все придирки, так как достоинства игры не в этом (тем более многие недостатки исправят патчами, как с личем, требующемся для перчаток Галли). В нее просто приятно играть и исследовать. Но один раз. Возможно, если баланс патчами доведут до ума, то и больше.

36467140.review: 在体验了数十分钟传闻天下第一神界原罪2后，发现并不是自己的菜，游戏主题bgm非常好听，画面也极其精美，但最被玩家们津津乐道的极高自由度的战斗系统让我有点无所适从，可能以后出官中会再努力感受下。某天无意中发现了这款偏日系的rpg小品战神夜袭，立马被清新的画风所吸引，毕竟从小受到日式游戏的熏陶，一见如故。看了下评价虽然不多但都还不错，便立刻加1.因为明显是小成本制作，游戏有诸多不足，人物刻画和剧情比较单薄。人设也没什么亮点，上来就被盖伦亮瞎了。还有游戏节奏很慢，主要体现在战斗技能前摇和大地图移动速度缓慢，流程也不够充实。然后来说说优点，游戏的战斗系统是一大特色，还算丰富的技能配合过载系统很有新意。最值得叫好是天赋系统，非战斗状态可以随时洗点，升级获得强力天赋后提升很明显， 每个人物有特色鲜明的两系天赋，可玩性很不错。锻造、炼金、附魔、橙武等系统使我游玩过程中总有一种在玩wow单机版的既视感哈哈，但因为有动画背景并没有山寨感，徒增了几分情怀。强烈推荐给喜欢日式rpg的小伙伴。ps：这次经历过后又明白了干什么都不要跟风玩游戏亦是，理智加一，健康游戏。昨天终于在花了75小时后一周目通了p5,果然是近年jprg的巅峰太棒了，果断又下单了dq11，完美的双11哈哈。

36406416.review:
It sucks that Steam doesn't allow you to give a game anything other than a thumbs up or down. This isn't a good game, make no mistake, but it is worth a look if you're a game designer and want to study what not to do when trying to make a JRPG.

It's almost painful, specifically because you can't get through ten minutes in Battle Chasers without feeling the love for the genre and games in general just wafting off of the creators. Joe Madeira has managed to crib almost every rule in the JRPG playbook but he doesn't understand the fundamental concepts behind those rules.

First of all, the game is slow. It's so slow, that I imagine if the game had been designed better most people would take 10 hours to complete it, rather than 20. There are pauses when you enter combat, before you can make an attack in combat, between turns. More popular RPGs like Persona or Pokemon can get by with turn-based combat because of how quick they are designed, especially if you're smart. Do yourself a favor and time the average combat in Persona 5 or Pokemon and measure it against Battle Chasers and you'll see what I mean.

In addition, the characters move at a middling pace. Normally you wouldn't notice movement speed being slow, but there's an awful lot of backtracking required to accomplish every single side quest, and the space between locations will begin to wear down on you. This is especially egregious on the main map, where locations are spaced far apart with little to nothing to do in between them except gather from one or two nodes, and the occasional fight. At higher levels you can skip these fights, which just demonstrates how long it takes to walk between any two locations.

And despite there being a map, there is no indication of where you are on the map, so you can get lost. Normally this would be good, as overwrought UIs are a problem with many modern RPGs, but since the overworld map is a little less Final Fantasy VII and a little more Candyland, it's an exercize in frustration. There is absolutely no reason for the map to exist this way, other than the programmers obviously had a problem with it.

This is a Kickstarter game, and while the visuals do get a lot of polish, there's some serious frame dip and stuttering, especially going to and from combat.

A lot of people have been asking if the game is easy or hard. The game is easy, but it can feel hard due to all the grinding you'll have to do. Normally for me, I'm ok with grinding if I can speed up the process by playing smart. But there aren't very many choices to make from turn to turn in this game. There's an overcharge system, where you can get a discount on spells, or cast spells for "Free" by using the overcharge, but overcharge is raised through combat, and does not persist between combats except for one ability for one character.

I bring this up, again, to point out that many JRPGs can have boring and tedious combat, but oftentimes they're boring and tedious because you're trying to save up MP for the boss fight of a dungeon. Battle Chasers is the same way, but spells all have cast times, and with overcharge being as lucrative as it is, and MP being so low for all characters, the ONE path you would normally take in a JRPG to speed up combat is made actually WORSE in Battle Chasers.

In addition, enemy types are repeated consistently, especially with slimes. And while the designs are great for the characters and many of the monsters, they're also very stale in the mid to late game when Battle Chasers throws the same stock standard undead minions you'll see in Warcraft.

To really hammer in how boring the title is, the music is very poor and mediocre, and that's when the music plays. Most of the time there are no tracks. However, the ending theme is the one standout tune that's interesting to listen to. Otherwise anyone could compose better tracks with Frooty Loops and a month's worth of experience, which I expect is how much experience the two music composers had between them.

Ok, so all that sucks. It's slow and boring and full of bad design. So what's good?

Well, obviously, the art is good, and the character designs are spot on. Even random NPCs get some great touches here and there. The sound effects are also top shelf, whoever did sound design for this title deserves to work at a better studio. The post processing effects are good, with subtle color and special effect cues that make the visuals pop even more. And, wouldn't you know it, the voice acting is surprisingly on point. That said, nothing coming out of the mouths of these characters is particularly pithy or clever, but the voice talents sell their characters well.

Oh, forgot the most important part of a JRPG, the plot. It's generic, sloppy, and uninteresting. The interactions between the party are really the only thing this game has going for it in regards to good writing. The main cast are pretty cynical, apathetic or dickish, but they have a rapport with one another that's very charming. Of course all that goes out the window when Alumon shows up and throws wet dishwater all over what was a fun little game about friends on a cursed island.

That's all I have to say about this game. I hope the designers read this (won't, I know) but I hope they could read it and maybe it would help them see where to focus their efforts in the future? They setup this game to end on a cliffhanger, but before making a Battle Chasers 2, maybe they need to rethink how RPGs are put together first?

As sad as it is to say, there are RPG Maker games better than Nightwar. Let that sink in. A high schooler with minimal knowledge about game design could do just as well or better than what's on display here. All Battle Chasers has is a production budget.

Dang, didn't even go into the fishing minigame or the crappy UI. Guess I put as much thought into those as Airship Sindicate did...

36380650.review:
[h1] This game missed two potential market audience groups. [/h1]

The first audience group this game missed is the group that likes games to be difficult. If you go to the discussions for this game, you can read post after post where people complain the game is too easy.

The second audience group this game missed is the group that does not like to be sweating bullets when they play video games. Since I am a part of that group, I will explain why people rage-quit this game.

But first, here are some pros and cons for the game.

[b] Pros [/b]

+ The art direction for this game is very good.
+ The music is above average.
+ The voice acting is above average.
+ Randomly-generated dungeons is a nice touch.
+ Fast-travel! Blinkstones transport you to places you have been on the map.
+ Red Monika. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the sexy rogue as a hearty boon to the game's cast of heroes.
+ Having the ability to exit a dungeon, rest, and come back to the dungeon before the enemies respawn is a must-have for this game.

[b] Cons [/b]

- This game needs to go a LONG ways towards telling players how to play the game.
- The game lacks story depth.
- As I mentioned, I don't know what audience the difficulty of the game targets.
- The game's economy is something I could never figure out.
- Why put level requirements on weapons and armor in this game? It makes no sense to me.
- The perks system is unlike anything I have seen in video games. That wouldn't be a negative thing if I could understand how any of the perks actually help any of the heroes.
- Many people have complained about the long battle animations and tedious loot rewards screen.

Note: The game maker has recently added a patch to punish people who skip the loot rewards screen. Clearly, the game maker has not been reading the discussion posts, for that recent addition is something no gamer wants.

[b] The Rage-Quitters [/b]

When you get to level 10, the game difficulty spikes. That is when many people head to the forums to see what they are doing wrong. I have read the posts that tell players to start repeating dungeons. That is what I did. But when it came time to repeat Junktown, I found my team getting wiped and wiped and wiped. My team members are the same level as those I am fighting. I shouldn't be getting wiped.

This is what I am encountering in Junktown:

1) One enemy group has two healers and one damage dealer. The healers can heal 50-70 percent of the WHOLE TEAM'S HP in one spell. Compare that to my team heal spell that heals 20 percent of the team's HP.

2) Another enemy can one-shot two of my three team members. Meanwhile, he takes a ridiculous amount of the top damage-dealing spells from my team before he falls (if I can actually beat him).

3) I can't buy or make revive potions. I can't make any health potion that heals more than 15 percent of the average member of my team. I can buy two "moderate" health potions that heal 30 percent of the average member of my team between every time I clear a dungeon. That is nowhere near enough. I can't make ANY mana potions, and I even invested in the curio shop in order to be able to buy more recipes. 

4) I have maxed out investments at the smithy, but all the high-end armor I can't equip because I am not high enough level.

5) There was a quest to go down and fight slimes under the tavern in Harm's Way. Normal slime mobs were a bit tough, but nothing out of the ordinary. The boss, however, is WAY over the head of my team. I had no way of knowing that before I went into the dungeon. Furthermore, the option of fleeing was not an option for the fight. So what happened? My team wiped, and I lost 300 gold. That is incredibly frustrating.

How can an average gamer read the above list of experiences and NOT be hugely frustrated? I just don't understand that.

36370948.review:
In short: this game is a blast. The visuals are stunning, the voice acting is great, the music is awesome, and the gameplay... oh, the gameplay. Battle Chasers' combat system is the best I've encountered in recent turn-based RPG's. Fast, strategic, fun. The crafting system is as deep as it is original. 

Of course it has its drawbacks. You're going to need a good amount of grinding, since the characters you don't carry in your party don't level up, so you'll find yourself revisiting dungeons in order to have them at the same level of your usual party. The overworld map consists of predefined paths, which is a letdown at first until you realize there's more possible routes and hidden corners than such system may suggest. 

Battle Chasers is an indie game, but unlike most indie games, it has tons of content, great visuals and, most importantly, an awesome gameplay.

Buy it if you're into classic JRPG's but don't mind a modern twist.

36369551.review:
На мой взгляд, очень достойный продукт. Сочетание мультяшного комикса и тактической составляющей битв - отличное сочетание! Сюжет тоже присутствует:) Правда, на мой взгляд, есть минусы по балансу, а именно:
1) задержка лечащих сил голема (нет смысла ждать и терять один его ход, если проще скушать эликсир);
2) не совсем понятна механика побочных эффектов (кровотечение, горение и т.п.). Если в отношении своих героев все понятно (сколько написано, столько и отнимут), то в отношении врагов, тут темный лес (пишется 133, а наносится 18)...
3) бесполезность некоторых умений... например: бросок камня главной героини Талли! Дамаг до безобразия смешной, но есть один полезный эффект - нанесение урона соседним отрядам! Т.е. при применении данного умения можно бы было обнаружить невидимые отряды, но нет, это умение будет готовиться до тех пор пока ниведимки себя уже сами не обнаружат.
4) почти бесполезные умения героев на карте подземелий (кроме лечащего умения голема). Было бы очень полезно добавить, либо изменить некоторые умения в сторону возможности разделения врагов, иначе даже умения Гаррисона "оглушение" не разделяет их, а только замедляет на 0,5-1 ход. И в результате ты получаешь туже КУЧУ, только несколько замедленную...
5) отсутствует возможность пропустить ход, или отдать его другому персонажу (было бы очень удобно для лечения своих персонажей, да и для тасовки умений тоже)
     Это были даже не минусы, а моё субъективное мнение на процесс игры:) А теперь о плюсах... собственно вся игра один большой плюс!!! Мне всегда импонировали игры типа 3х3 и т.д. только это было отдано на откуп мобильным игрушкам, а тут примерно так же, только увлекательно, красочно, да еще и подумать нужно... иногда конечно:) Всем советую!:)

36309263.review:
[h1]Ojo, solo apto para fans del cómic[/h1]

Battle Chasers: Nightwar es un videojuego secuela de los cómis de Battle Chasers, y es obligatorio leerlos antes de jugar al videojuego ya que la mayor parte de la trama no se explica a menos que lo hayas leido.

A parte de ese detalle (que no es el motivo real para no recomendar el juego) el juego empieza bastante bien, el sistema de combate al principio es divertido, el mapa de estancia en vista isométrica es fabuloso (y también el mapamundi). En general tiene muchos elementos para ser un juego al menos aceptable... las 5 primeras horas.

Después de llegar a la mitad del juego ya no se siente fresco ni entretenido, se repiten mecánicas, combates que se solucionan pulsando la X/A y la trama parece no avanzar. Y llegando a la parte final del juego hay una subida de dificultad muy interesante (por no decir injusta), pasas de enemigos de nivel 16-17 a enemigos con nivel 26 (el nivel máximo del juego es el 30). Lo que te obliga a lootear y farmear DEMASIADO tiempo, una curva de dificultad muy mal hecha. Y eso se llama ''alargar el juego sin motivo''.

En la parte gráfica y de música es dónde solo queda quitarse el sombrero, el dibujo que caracteriza a Joe Madureira es sinónimo de calidad, y eso es algo que ha conseguido con trabajos previos.

Ante todo es un buen juego, si te gustaron los cómics y lo encuentras en rebajas no dudes en comprarlo. Pero para los demás no lo compréis por 30€.

36287076.review:
いろんなメディアで取り上げられていように、古き良きJRPGの様式美を備えた作品だが、ただの懐古的なだけの似非レトロゲーではない佳作。素晴らしい！
絶対に日本じゃ売れないのに、ローンチから日本語音声まで付けたゲーム製作者の心意気を、どうか皆にも汲んで欲しい。そして買ってあげて欲しい…。

魔法と古代文明が同居する超王道ファンタジー世界を、個性豊かな仲間たちと冒険し、ダンジョンを探索し、無数のロマン溢れるアイテムを入手しながら、純粋悪を倒す。いずれも日本のRPGが誇り、そして完全に失ったものが、このゲームにはある。なぜアメリカ人にこれが作れて、日本人には作れなくなってしまったのだろうか。「儲からないから作らないだけで、やろうとすればできるのではないか」という反論は的外れだ。事実、スクエニが作った似非クロノトリガーやら、ネオトラディショナルRPGとやらよりも、遥かに本作のほうがJRPGしているではないか！

ただの似非レトロゲーではないことは、きめ細やかに調整されたゲームバランスから感じられる。（極端にレベル差がつかなければ）ボタン連打では雑魚戦を切り抜けることができない。各キャラクターにピーキーなロールが備わっていて、スライムが相手であっても、それを戦略的に運用することが求められる。
ダンジョン探索時のリソース管理が重要で、HP回復の手段も限られるし、無計画に魔法やスキルを使うことができない。一方でエクストラチャージのお陰で、通常戦闘でもその後の戦闘を気にせず大技をぶっぱなせる
楽しさは得られるし、むしろそう運用しないとダンジョンクリアまでMPが持たないという良い塩梅になっている。
装備品もレベルが上がると単純な上位互換になっているわけでもなく、キャラクターの育成方針に合わせてあれこれ考えられるのも楽しいところ。

世界観やキャラクターのデザインは本当に素晴らしい。原作がカルト的な人気を博したコミックだというが、王道的な文脈は抑えつつしっかり個性が立ったキャラクターはどれも魅力的だ。それでいて、狙ったあざとさもない。無駄に冗長な台詞で設定が語られることもない。キャラクター同士の掛け合いも、アメリカっぽい皮肉とジョークが効いていて小気味よい。
カリブレットとガリーがお気に入りだ。ガリーの素人くさい声の演技もクセになる。ンンーズズズ…。

荒削りな部分もある。
移動がもっさりしている上に、戦闘がそこそこ時間がかかるので、２回目以降のダンジョン探索は非常にストレスを感じる。レベル補正がかなりキツく、敵より１～２レベル下なだけで戦闘がかなり長引き、逆に敵より１～２レベル高いと歯ごたえがなくなってしまう。無駄なレベル上げをしなかったので終盤までそれなりの楽しめたが、しかし装備を揃えると終盤ボスやラスボスはあまりにもアッサリ殺せてしまってつまらなかった。DLCで裏ダンジョンとか追加してくれないだろうか。そんないびつなバランスなので、初見の敵だとパーティーが半壊することもままある。
また折角、性能面でも個性豊かな仲間がいるのに控えメンバーには一切経験値が入らないせいで、パーティーメンバーが事実上固定されてしまうのも勿体無い。せっかくだし色々運用してみたかった。

ガットパンチかっこいい。

ギャリソン脳筋すぎる。一方で見た目に反して装甲がペラペラになりがちで笑える。幼女に守ってもらうマッチョなオッサン…。

フレーバーテキスト盛り沢山なのも嬉しいところ。

ミニゲームといったら釣りですよねー。わかってるぅー！

ОГРОМНЫЙ + за саундтреки
ОГРОМНЫЙ + за ласт босса 31 лвл-а, поджёг 5-ю точку.


Минусы:
-одообразность

-бесполезные чары в 90% случаев
-бесполезная алхимка в 90% случаев

36244838.review:
1. Game description.
2. The bad.
3. The good.
4. Verdict.

1. Game description.
You have a couple of heroes and move around on a map. When you touch enemies, the game changes to a combat view, where you can choose your heroes abilities in turn based combat in order to defeat the enemies. Then you get some XP and loot. The heroes level up, gain new abilities and points you can use to specialize them. There are also dungeons, in which you walk around, doing more fights, find more loots, solve some simple puzzles. Sometimes you also fight bosses, sometimes there are cut scenes as well. You can find all kinds of crafting materials, and use them to craft new items for your heroes or improve items they already have.

2. The bad:
[list][*] The crafting system is at times insanely annoying. You might want to craft an item and need just one more reagent. It might be available at a shop but it might also not be. It could drop from certain enemies but it might not. And said enemies might just have spawned or they might not be around at all.
[*] The difficulty level is a bit odd. Sometimes the game is super easy, and then you meet an enemy that grinds you to a bloody pulp with his left pinkie. 
[*] The game manual that comes with the game is lacking. Some concepts are not explained at all.
[*] Some textures would have deserved a higher resolution.
[*] The cut scenes feature voice actors for the characters, but the other dialogues would not. It would be nice if there'd be voice actors for all dialogues.
[*] The game is in general at times quite grindy.
[*] Some side quests are unlikely to get solved without making use of the internet to get some information on what to do where.
[*] You can't skip the animations of the characters super abilities.
[*] As most of the fights are quite easy, and you can't skip them until you are waaaaay more powerful than the enemies, they sometimes get a bit annoying, as you just want to get to a certain location, and yet get tangled up in fights with enemies that can't scratch you.
[/list]

3. The good:
[list][*] The soundtrack is great
[*] Voice acting and sound effects are fine too.
[*] Animations are good.
[*] It took me about 50 hours to finish the game, which I think is a decent amount of content.
[*] Even though the story is always the same, there is some replayability here, due to: random dungeon layouts, different characters to choose and a higher difficulty level to pick.
[*] You can change your characters specialization whenever you want to, which is nice as you can then try things out. 
[*] The combat is satisfying, killing bosses is fun.
[*] The enemies are quite varied.
[*] There is some flavour text (snippet of description or background story) for every ingredient and every enemy.
[*] The game is quite nice to play on a relaxed evening, as the fights are turn based.
[/list]

4. Verdict
I finished the game. I think that's quite something, as my list of steam games is full of games I haven't completed. The game quite easy most of the time, and is somewhat grindy at times, but it's also fun and you want to explore more of the world, fight more monsters and unlock more abilities. While the game might surely bore some people, it's fun and relaxing for others.

36164550.review:
Greetings!  I had hoped to review this game much sooner but at the same time wanted to play the game to conclusion.  So, 99 played hours later…what do I think?  Really?  99 hours played and you think what?  I didn’t like the game.  Silly reader… To be transparent I want to say that I backed this game on Kickstarter and am a huge fan of classic JRPG style games.  Suffice to say I played for 12 hours straight the day this game was released.

Haven’t seen your kind around here:  What we have here is a genuine classic RPG from the days of the early Final Fantasy’s with modern mechanics, graphics and storytelling from an indie development staff looking to accomplish this very task.  And…I love it.  The game is more difficult than many RPGs (and I enjoy this) overall, though many optional bosses in some games easily trump that.  The game also includes development for each of the 6 playable characters with equipment, perks, and abilities.  None of the characters play the same or even fulfill the roles in the way you’d typically see.  For example there are three characters with healing, each have minor mechanics that make them very unique despite having the goal of restoring hit points.  The game also explains things, not in a tutorial way (there is a small one and an online book) but in information provided through tooltips and having  clean, understandable mechanics giving you the ability to fine tune what you want your party to do and how best to attack an encounter.

Blood for the Blood God, Skulls for…wait what:  This game definitely draws from a lot of inspiration.  From items, plot points and even the music this game feels like it was made by a group that loves gaming in all its forms.  It was done so well, so seamless that I caught myself going ‘wait, is that a tribute or am I looking too deep’.  Every step of the game felt like a familiar game but fresh and exciting at the same time.  I can’t wait to see what they do for expansions and possibly sequels.  I wish more games would also use the same method to do conversations.  Yes, highly detailed cinematics are great and fun but let’s not waste the entire budget on them.  I’m perfectly okay with beautifully drawn characters in freeze frame talking across each other (though I would have like to have heard more voice over’s).

There's your problem:  So what are the problems?  To begin with (as of this review) there is an odd stuttering issue affecting many players.  It’s not a huge issue but the game will freeze for what is probably a millisecond or so but both Steam and other third party frame-rate programs don’t seem to detect it.  This seems to happen mostly on the world map and aside from that my computer ran the game at 35-60 fps without issue.  There are a few other minor issues:  The one I found the most annoying is what appears to be a lack of items throughout the game, primarily in the beginning levels.  Many times I’d have a level 6+ character running around with level 3 items.  Though not a huge issue I’d like to see more items released.  One slight annoyance is the game doesn’t seem to have any level 30 items, I found all the ultimate weapons (Gully’s quest for hers really needs to be revamped, I shouldn’t have to farm low level dungeons for random encounters).  I’d also like to see the way that rooms are randomized revamped, I think going through a dungeon three times should be more than enough to see every room, maybe I’m wrong.  The inventory manager could use an overhaul, makes no sense to have multiple locations for weapons, armor and accessories.  To be fair all these complaints are easily fixed and I am confident they will be, the developers are very vocal on the forums and are releasing patches frequently.

It’s not really complicated, if you like RPGs, especially those of the classic ATB style you need to get this game.  I’d argue you should buy it at full retail if nothing else than to support the developers with the hopes of more content down the road.  The game does have a few small bugs (I can’t complete the bestiary due to a choice I made much earlier in the game) and I’d like to see a few changes but the game is worth every penny that is asked, highly recommend.  I did want to note real fast that I have not begun the New Game+ my goal is to give the game a few months for new content, balances and bug hunting before starting a new game.

36163861.review:
Number of times censored by shills: 2.

Downvoting because this is yet another example of a game that seems ok for slightly more than 2 hours before revealing its true colors after it can no longer be refunded so you can cut your losses and simply leave.

I beat the whole thing anyways, seeing if it would get better. It didn't.

So why the negative review?

1: The game is trivially easy, even on the highest difficulty setting. One good attack will kill just about any normal enemy and most mini bosses. 2 will kill the rest of the mini bosses and most bosses. 3 will level just about everything.

2: As is always the case for these types of games, difficulty is replaced with grind. Grinding through meaningless encounters that are unskippable unless you are at least 4-5 levels higher, grinding through very slow and unskipable attack animations that take a good 70% of your combat time, and grinding through very slow and mostly unskippable walking animations that take a good 70% of your non combat time. Of this 29 hours I would say about 9 hours was actually playing the game and making some sort of decision or at least clicking stuff and 20 was watching the game play itself either through me using the same few slow attacks or the enemy using the same few even slower attacks.

3: As an addendum, most of the side quests consist of more grind, be it finding something in some obscure corner of the world or doing something x times or finding a randomly generated event somewhere in a dungeon and likely resetting after multiple completions before you get it.

4: Game balance is virtually nonexistent. You mostly just spam damage. I'll give it some credit, you do sometimes need tanking and damage amplification makes your damage better but the only status that is even marginally useful is bleed and then only because you can get it for free on a number of high damage attacks anyways. A good half the abilities at least are not worth using at all and most are marginal... leaving you mostly using the same few. So while not as one dimensional as say, Derpest Dungeon it is still narrow enough that the combat mechanics can't carry you through repetitive, copy pasted, palette swapped enemies. Which is certainly possible, I have seen games with high volumes of repetitive fights and even slower combat remain interesting for far longer than 29 hours via the strength of the combat mechanics and the difficulty involved but that is a very rare talent.

5: "Why are so many attacks so obviously mathematically worthless?" Oh, the devs have ties with Rekt Hook studios and other incompetent SJW devs. That explains everything. Rekt Hook invented 5 damage = 50 damage after all. Hey Airship Studios, assuming you're not knowingly complicit those bad relations are harming your reputation hard in the eyes and minds of intelligent gamers.

6: Because also like all games of this type, I can see the potential and how easily it can be realized, yet it didn't happen. While Airship hasn't engaged in a 3 year long campaign of censorship and shillery as a smokescreen, all that means is that I am merely disappointed with them for dropping the ball instead of actively fighting back against obvious and strong corruption and collusion. Meaning I will leave this negative review here, but unless the situation is escalated via the devs or those working under them that is as far as it will go.

Now you might have noticed I mentioned a lot of things concerning the game mechanics and gameplay and did not mention any other aspect of the game. That's because mechanics and gameplay ARE the game. Stuff like art, music, etc is at best a side dish, and one you can get without sspending 30 dollars. So it doesn't much matter how good they are, and with hipster devs using them as a smokescreen you gotta see right past them or you're gonna be fooled a lot more often than I am.

You might have noticed I also didn't mention the censoring of a female character's breast size. Yes it did happen, yes it was provoked by SJW bullshit, I'm far more concerned with the nature and censorship of users than content.

In hindsight I should have researched this one better. In particular this dev's ties with known corrupt company Rekt Hook Studios would have been an instant deal breaker. I didn't, and that's on me because damn fool that I am I just wanted good, high quality games without SJW bullshit and did not do my due diligence against convergence. However the weak design and suspicions are not on me, so the review stands.

36125282.review:
I had this game on wishlist since march 2016 so i wa a little hyped when it finally come out.
Maybe too much...

Dont get me wrong,i liked the game but some QOL improvements are really needed.

The game is a classic JRPG with a simple story and gorgeous art style.
If you dont care about achievements and 100% you'll get between 20-30 hours out of it, without the need to grind.
I completed each of the 8 dungeons 2 times for an achievement but with the latest patch you can select directly the hardest difficulty if you want. 
Otherwise you'll be fine running them only 1 time, i was never severely underleved and if i was i just did some of Hunt sidequest with really no need for an insane grind.

The real time sink for me was the 100% : i spent almost 20 hours trying to find 2 monsters and 1 fish in the related minigame, it was really frustatring and almost took out of me the joy i had playing until then.

There is a nice crafting system for weapon/armor, potions and enchantments : a very simple "side job".

The major flaws for me were the speed of some things ( end of combat animation, nice  first time, really boring the 1000 times after, even mashing the skip button ... it doesnt skip enough ) like the movement on the map ( there's fast travel at least ), said map without any indication or names of places and your position.

Each of the six character is flexible and can do 2 roles ( usually everyone can dps and then make as tank or healer ) but once you have your party the non selected members dont level up at all. As i said i had no need to grind so i always kept the same 3 people til the end. And it's a pity cause each character has abilities that synergize well with othe teammates but you are not incentivized to experiment, unless you farm to level up unused characters.

NG+ was not challenging at all ( but i dont care, i'm not an hardcore player ) because even if you lose all gear and levels you start with all 6 characters from the start and with all the perk levels ( perk are like talents ) so if you played well on NG they'll be powerhouses on NG+.
It was a breeze and i only die 3 times on the final boss ( these were the only 3 deaths on Ng and NG+ combined ).

Even with these little problems the game is worth it, the combat is nice and the journey overall enjoyable.
Just keep in mind that If you want to 100% the achievement you'll face a lot of hours of boring grind at max level.

36109824.review:
Красочно нарисованный комикс. Если вам нравится графика и пошаговый бой, а также у вас в запасе есть 30-40 часов, то советую ее к покупке. А теперь поподробнее:
[b]Сюжет[/b]. Довольно интересный, незаставляющий ломать мозг сюжет повествует о злом враге, которого надо всеми силами уничтожить.
[b]Мир игры[/b]. Небольшой. Карта состоит из одного главного города и нескольких подземелий, где вы и будете проводить большую часть времени. К этому стоит еще прибавить парочка исследовательских зон и скрытых локаций.
[b]Геймплей[/b]. Мы прокачиваем группу героев из 3 штук (на выбор всего 6). Оснащаим их всё более крутыми вещами и талантами. Бой происходит в пошаговом режиме.
[b]Локализация[/b]. Все видеовставки озвучены полностью и некоторые ключевые реплики. Остальное - субтитры.В целом пртенезий к переводу нет.
[b]Это же финалка?![/b]. Нет, это абсолютно не финалка. Многие её пытаются сравнить с ней, то это две совсем разные игры. В финалке основной акцент был на исследовании мира и раскрытии сюжета. Здесь же акцент на боях и гринде.

В целом перед нами довольно качественно-сделанная игра в стилистике комикса. Так как цена относительно невысока, а контент в ней качественный, она получает мою рекомендацию к покупке.

Análisis completo: http://limitgamers.com/index.php/battle-chasers-nightwar/analisis/

NOTA: 8.1


LO BUENO

-Su fidelidad con el comic
-Los combates por turnos aun no han muerto
-Sus mazmorras generados de manera procedural
-Los combates: estratégicos, divertidos y con ritmo
-Su doblaje al español, impecable

LO MALO

-El argumento no es nada del otro mundo
-Su sistema de progresión, muy simplón
-Si buscas innovaciones aquí no los vas encontrar...

CONCLUSIÓN:

Simple, directo, sin innovar pero correcto, un titulo ideal para los nostálgicos que amamos los RPG de antaño. una buena muestra que el sistema de combates por turnos sigue siendo una modalidad a explotar. Destaca su fidelidad con el comic original y su ñ´l.excelente doblaje al español (castellano). Un firme candidato para convertirse en un juego de culto en el sector, espero ansioso ver los futuros trabajos de Airship Syndicate, su debut en el sector no ha podido ser mejor.

36094775.review:
This was a game i so badly wanted to enjoy, but didnt. 

The art and animations are positively GORGEOUS and quite simply some of the best I've ever seen in an rpg. 

But there are so many weird things holding it back that I just couldnt trudge forward anymore and bailed. 

1. The combat is built around using basic attacks to build "overcharge" aka free mana, and mana recovery on its own is very very rare. This encourages kind of boring gameplay as you cant use abilities often or you risk running the mana dry long before you ever have a chance to get more. 
2. skills are wildly imbalanced. Some heals will heal your group for literally like 1% of your health? Why is it so weak? Some shields are STRICTLY better than other shield skills, some attacks are STRICTLY better than a similar attack in your same arsenal, and its just oddly imbalanced and shows lack of attention to detail.
3. Exploration is a complete nightmare. You dont have access to a map except in designated spots, and even in the overworld nothing is labelled until you are on top of it, and you can only scroll the map in a small radius from where you are. There is also no legend for anything on the map so you dont have a clue what some of the icons indicate. This is the main reason i quit playing, as i was spending ungodly amounts of time just trying to figure out where the hell i needed to go.
4. Inbalanced difficulty. Some fights you can win in a couple hits, others will nearly knock a party member flat in a single turn, in the same spot in a dungeon or on the map. There are also some side-bosses with a recommended level notice, which is just plain wrong. I went to two of them at their "Recommended level" and they quite literally one-shot my entire team, through a group shield. 

It's just not a good game. It drew me in with the gorgeous aesthetic and then let me down nearly everywhere else.
