Je vais simplement plussoyer l'évaluation de Kervala, une jolie découverte pour ma part, on passe un très bon moment sur le jeu, il a tout dit sans rentrer dans les détails, on vous laissera découvrir le craft, les pièges et l'humour fort sympathique.

Pas de choix de difficulté dans les menus, en effet, dès lors que vous déciderez d'entrer dans un donjon, trois difficultés vous seront proposés à ce moment là, enfin deux au départ, puis une troisième si vous réussissez la seconde, avec bien entendut une récompense à la hauteur de l'effort.

Un système de combat original, se démarquant de la concurrence sans pour autant être l'idée du siècle..

Une bonne optimisation de chaque classe qui permet de réellement jouer et adapter le rôle que l'on souhaite à chacun.

Les donjons sont à génération procédurale.

Le jeu se complique réellement vers le niveau 12, ou l'on passe d'une promenade de santé, peut être un peu longue au passage, à un réel challenge dans sont niveau de difficulté max en donjon.
Un point négatif néanmoins concernant les boss que j'ai trouvé souvent plus simple voir trop par rapport à certaines patrouilles..ainsi que le temps qu'il faut passer pour terminer un donjon.

J'ajouterais également la problématique d'xp des classes je m'explique, plusieurs perso. disponibles mais uniquement trois dans une équipe, ce qui pose problème pour ceux que nous ne jouons pas étant donné qu'il ne prennent pas d'xp et qui peuvent rapidement se retrouver à la rue par la suite, moi, ca ne m'intéresse pas de revenir en arrière pour pex un retardatère d'autant plus que les donjons ne s'adaptent pas à notre niveau..
Cela est fort dommage car j'aurais souhaité changer d'équipe parfois..

Une histoire intéressante pas exceptionnelle non plus, la lecture se fait naturellement sans être rébarbative, lourde ou longue..

Je rajouterais pour toutes les pleurnichardes qui Pouce rouge à tout va dès que quelque chose ne va pas, en l'occurence le problème de l'azerty, qu'il suffit simplement de faire Alt Shift, une commande vieille comme le monde afin de basculer Ingame.

Le jeu vaut son prix, on est pas volé, il a une réel identité mais ne plaira pas à tout le monde.
7/10

Je stream le jeu sur Twitch et souvent de la nouveauté à cette adresse pour ceux qui voudraient peut être se faire un avis.
https://go.twitch.tv/ocb5lim

35458872.review:
Overview: This is a pretty good game. I have played around 32 hrs and got to the cave place. The good things about this game is that it is fairly innovative, and you wont see much games like it. The most special thing about the game is its overworld feature, which I am sure no other JRPG game has. This game is very easy, and fairly grindy, but the griding process is fairly easy. Enjoyment is fairly high, solid 8.5/10.  Would reccomend this for around 60hr of play time

Pros:

-Innovative overworld, threed characters with resources that can be harvested, there is only a specific way to go though
-The animation is pretty nice, yet not japanese enough

-The dungeon system is fairly innovative, and the dungeon skills is a unique take on character abilities

-The monsters look pretty good

-The game is fairly easy, so I only use the overcharge, and I never use stored mana

-The overcharge system is fairly cool and alot of common turn based rpg elements are in this

-Crafting systems are found within dungeons, which is fairly unique, yet the items crafted are very obsolete

-There is a quest system for beast master, ye it is linear and can only be done once

-The dialogues are fairly well done, missing some dialogue for beta though

-The fish system is nice, yet shadow coins are easily earnt

-Garaunteed alot of playtime to finish game

-intereseting in game/battle mechanics

There decent amount more pros to the game

Cons

-All the monsters are fking skinned, bairly any variation

-Laggy, but i play on mac so :0

-Grindy, but it is still pretty fun

-not smooth, have to wait long time to transition

-Map is really small

-Very easy to do things, very hard to die

-Pirates are very op to beat

-Spells are useless for me

-The game is very linear, although it does not claim to be so

There are a few more cons, but i dont feel like listing them

Brief overview of game.

Monsters: You can find them as icons on the overworld, and as moving monsters in the dungeon, in the overworld, they are stationary, while in the dungeon they can move about, and can even attack you

If there are alot of monsters they would attack you in waves

Traps:Cant see them, invisible so hard to detect and are hard to dodge

Materials:Drops from monsters. Stationary icons on overworld, threed versions in dungeon


Difficulty: Does not really affect much, except loop will have higher rairty and u would get better chest from completing


Mana and health: If ur health is depleted, character would die, if all characters die, you would lose money and go back to inn, but progress should be saved. If in legendary, you lose your items. Mana can be used to use abilities that are stronger than your normal ones


Overcharge: A system where you gain extra mana, only appicalble to one battle, u can gain it only from normal abilities

Status effects: You can have damage upgrades, defense upgrades, status effects, heals per second, more xp, free overcharge every round, target, and stuff like that. Debuffs include poison, sunder, so higher damage percentage of enemy attacks, magic sunder? where you recieve higher percentage magic attacks. U get these sunder debuffs from the non green slimes i think, so fight them off one by one. There are still abit more



Airships: These guys appear in overworld, they fly to u, they are the same levlel as u, they are fairly op if ur like me, who does not use stored mana. I have only beaten one, and they only dropped artifact


Artifact: Traid for shadow coins from collector to buy stuff from him.

Fishes: Traid in fish monger for shadow coins and money, main income of shadow coins.

Npcs:They are jsut some random people who do stuff, no need to mind them, they are all rigged and they dont give you anything good.

Dungeons: COnsists of traps and secrets, can only get secret rooms if u use gully, which some people might  not use. Rarely can u find a legendary chest in threed. I recommend u use the all meelee squad, as knolan is useless, and healing is done buy the robot, while monica probs betray me. I dont have the finally demon character character


Lights and beacons: useless, but beacons drop some crate, and I was only able to get one, and the other two dissapeard


Thats about it really


In this game, you can never fight something your level as it is too hard, so I have like level ten gear when my characters are lv sixteen

Overall this game is decent, i would recommend on like two fifty price. A bit over priced but I am fine with it. THis is a jrpg with no good looking women, since they dont look anime at all, and so I feel sad. Gets grindy after a while yet it is still enjoyable to one shot the monsters and get all that xp. Very satisfying.

35458230.review:
Que decir? creo que cumplió las expectativas del kickstarter con creces. éste es un pre análisis de las versión beta. he jugado unas 17h a ella y creo que es suficiente para poder decir que se nota el trabajo de Joe Madureira, genial el apartado gráfico, se nota el dibujado a mano y el cariño puesto a los escenarios,dungeons, mapa y sobre todo al diseño de los personajes! brutal el diseño y las animaciones tanto de éstos como de los npc y los enemigos. detalles como cambiar una espada al pj y ver como cambia tanto en la hoja del personaje como cuando lo ves en el mundo te hacen ver que han cuidado hasta el mínimo detalle. 

sobre el combate por turnos decir que tienes muchas opciones y se ve muy completo. En las mazmorras puedes elegir entre normal y difícil (que ya supone un reto) y una tercera dificultad Legendaria que se desbloquea al pasartela por primera vez en dificil. 

La forma de moverse por el mundo, con ciudades donde puedes mejorar los edificios y tendrás mejoras por hacerlo, encontrarás mazmorras que tienen trampas, zonas de pesca y secretos. También indicar que hay un sistema de crafteo genial. tanto de equipo como de pociones. el juego tiene muchas sorpresas y siempre vas desbloqueando cosas nuevas y nunca te aburre, me parece muy redondo.

otro dato importante es la traducción al español y decir que también están dobladas las voces así que genial!

35458205.review:
At last, after years of waiting for a turn based rpg worth grinding for.
This is it. Fantastic music, graphic and animations. Lots of depth in the battle system and the characters leveling.
Difficulty seems to be well balanced.
I love that the dungeon don't auto level with you (you actually get a feeling of power by levelling, and you can farm loot more easily if you wish to play like that).

Looking at the kind of game being made nowadays en masse, I guess this one is rather an ovni and will not be for the latest generation of gamers. But if you are old school, annoyed that most nice looking rpg are free to play on mobile nonesense, then jump on this.
It's a dream come true.

Edit 2 weeks later: 
Finished main game, now into NG+ (where you don't keep level and items but keep abilities, perks which is also nice and perks points are worth grindings in first playthrough because of this).
I am far from done with this game. It's a master piece.

35457168.review:
O jogo é fantástico, as animações são soberbas e a música cai muito bem com a ação. A história segue um bom ritmo e o sistema de batalha realmente tem algumas inovações muito bem vindas no gênero, como a utilização da sobrecarga..
É um jogo que me surpreendeu muito, tendo sido financiado pela comunidade sinceramente esperava menos, e foi uma grata surpresa que os produtores entregaram até mais do que prometeram em termos de qualidade.
De ponto negativo (mas que não desabona o jogo, opinião pessoal minha) fica a velocidade de caminhada nas dungeons e e no mapa mundi, mas entendo que uma "acelerada" nas dungeons envolve todo um retrabalho nos vários puzzles e armadilhas já criados.
Fica a minha recomendação de um ótimo RPG para todos que gostam do estilo.

35456837.review:
This game is sweet.

The graphics are modern and remind me of a darker torchlight 2 with sharper textures and hand drawn overworld maps.

The gameplay is very much like Breath of Fire 3 or other turn based RPGs with a twist. Characters learn interesting attacks and have combo-like synergy attacks (one attack applies sunder and one exploits it etc.)

I have been playing the game for an hour, so far the story is nicely illustrated, the world seems alive and huge and with lots of secrets you cannot get to at the start. Seems there is a lot to do and some choices even emerged that can be taken or dismissed.

The sound is very atmospheric and matches the game. The combat music pumps you up.

There are even cinematics even at the very start. From what ive seen they are high quality and are made in a "moving comic book" kinda style.

I can absolutely recommend this game. 10/10 for me!

THQ Nordic honors their name once again since Titan Quest!

35455491.review:
取り急ぎの人柱レビュー

アートワークにときめいて、吹き替え付きでローカライズされてるっと知ってしまい、ついつい開発。

まさに古き良きクラシカル(完成された)なターン制JRPGです。
ザックリと表現するとSAGAシリーズと概ね合致するシステムです。

まだまだ序盤なので、今後の展開次第ではあるのですが、序盤の戦闘でも十分戦略的です。攻守選択の面白みに加え、リソース管理、技を使う際の溜め時間管理っと、考える要素が複合的で面白いです。

正し、前情報から伺い知れたとおり、戦闘モーションのスキップがどうもありません。故にレベリング的な反復戦闘時にはモッサリ感が否めません。

アイテムに関しては、ハクスラ要素があるので、ランダム・ダンジョンへもぐる楽しみがあります。

このグラフィックで聖剣２がリメイクされたら、っとおっさんは思いました。

■ある程度進めての追記
全体的に骨太です。思い立った事を箇条書き、、、、

・セーブの仕様が自動保存と任意のセーブのみでロードがありません。複数の選択肢を試したい展開などがあるのですが、この仕様の為不可能です。

・レベル8前後からレベリングが失速しました。もらえる経験値が渋く、レベルがなかなか上がらないうえに、１レベルでも敵とのレベル差があると、敵の攻撃がとても痛く(雑魚の一撃で１/3持ってかれたりする)、リソース持越しの仕様も相まって頭を抱えることに。

・強敵と戦った際、全体攻撃一撃で全滅しました(笑)技モーションを察知して、全員防御とかの必要性があった模様。

・パーティーメンバーが３人なのですが、待機メンバーには経験値が入らない仕様です。上記したようにレベリングが辛めなので、かなり面倒に感じました。

35455359.review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。未クリアの為、クリア後に追記予定。

[u]今作は1998年から2001年まで海外で連載されていた同名のコミックが原作になっている。 主人公は偉大なる冒険家であった父の強力な力の宿った「こて」を受け継いだ少女「ガリー」。彼女の父は失踪してしまい、ガリーは冒険の途中で出会った仲間たちと共に父を探す旅の途中、というのが今作の序盤だ。[/u]

[u]日本語化は字幕、吹き替え共にイイ感じだ。[/u]

[h1][b]良い点[/b][/h1]

・グラフィックは美しく、似ているゲームを挙げるなら「トーチライト」系のスタイルだろうか。原作者自らの美麗なアートもストーリーの重要なシーンで所々見ることができる。

・BGMは所謂、和風（アジア系）な旋律が多く、序盤は穏やかな物が多い。勿論、戦闘時は激しめの音楽も。

・戦闘のバランスが程よく、敵が強すぎず弱すぎずと切妙だ。各プレイアブルキャラクターも個性的なので、どれを使用してプレイするか悩む。例えば、主人公の「ガリー」であれば、所謂タンク系のキャラクターなのでボス戦では重宝する。ボスに挑発を使用し、自身にはシールドを張り、そのスキにギャリソン等の攻撃特化キャラでボスを倒していく事ができる。

・ダンジョン探索が楽しい。今作ではアイテムクラフト要素があり、クラフト用の素材はフィールドで入手したり、敵がドロップする。更に今作には所謂トレハン要素もあり、ダンジョン内の宝箱等からレアなアイテム、強力な武器を探すのが楽しくて何度もダンジョンに潜ってしまう。中毒性が高い。

・ダンジョンへ入る時に難易度を選択可能。高難易度であればあるほど入手できるアイテムは質の良いものになる。ダンジョンの構造はクリアしてから再度侵入することで変化する。

[u]他にも良い点は沢山あるのだが、キリが無いのでこの辺で[/u]

[h1][b]悪い点[/b][/h1]

・アメコミが原作ということもあり、人によってはアートスタイルに違和感を覚えることもあるかもしれない。

・プレイに支障はないが日本語化時に一部説明文で統一されていないものがある。例えば、「流血ダメージ」と「ブリディングダメージ」同じものなのに何故か別の文になっている箇所がちらほらとある。

・戦闘に参加していないメンバーには一切経験値が入らない。おかげでメインメンバー以外のレべ上げが少し面倒だ。

[h1][b]総評[/b][/h1]

全体的に良く出来た作品になっている。JRPGを意識して作ったとのことだが、確かに良いトコ取りをした印象だ。RPG好きであれば是非ともプレイする事をオススメする。値段以上の価値は間違いなくある。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/rVaqnPitEeE]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

35454655.review:
[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[b]Battle Chasers : Nightwar has been an excellent JRPG so far.  It's beautiful to look at, and has a solid story with good voice acting.  The deceptively easy to learn battle system is well paced, but the game overall is in desperate need of multiple difficulty settings for the game overall, and not just the dungeons.[/b]

~ [b]Graphics[/b]
[i]Deep, rich use of color with environments and characters who feel unique and original.  It's hard to pin down exactly what it is about a game's visual presentation that makes us realize right away "This is something special"  ..but this game has it, loads of it[/i]

~[b]Character Development[/b]
[i]While I believe that the game takes a little longer than it should to open up the "perks" system, I still think it's great overall.  They work a great deal like talent points from most every RPG.  Allowing you to add small bonuses to each hero with larger bonuses at 20/40/60 and so on.  

One thing that I really like is that you effectively have 2 talent trees for each hero.  One is defensive/support in nature, and the other is for Offensive enhancement.  Players don't need to worry about making the wrong decision either as you are able to redistribute them, at no cost, whenever you want as long as you're not in Combat.[/i] 

~[b]Story[/b]
[i]I admit that I am just experiencing the story for the first time.  I never read the comics when I was younger, although I wish I had now.  Again, the game seems to have that X-factor quality which sucks you in right from the start.  It's a breath of fresh air after playing so many games recently that are jam packed with cringe-worthy dialogue.[/i]

~[b]Crafting[/b]
[i]As for how useful it is, I couldn't honestly tell you.  Because the sadist that designed the system decided that putting the crafting tables in town is just too convenient..  so they hid them in the F****** dungeons.  Making them wildly impractical and nearly useless.[/i]

~[b]Battle System[/b]
[i]The battles use a mechanic wherein you have 2 basic functions that revolve around "overcharge".  With that resource being something that allows you to temporarily exceed the maximum mana available.  This in effect allows you to utilize some abilities for free.  Although any overcharge you have disappears at the end of the battle.
As for the 2 functions, you have builders (Moves that don't cost mana, and build overcharge) and spenders (moves that cost mana, but are more effective).  It's a cool system, but it takes a litte practice to get it down so that you aren't ending a battle with a bunch of overcharge that goes to waste.
The other mechanic involves your team's super moves.  A gauge fills each time you take or deal damage (persists through fights) and allows you to use a powerful ability with one of your characters once it's full.  This was done well because it charges fairly quickly, between 2-3 fights at most, and the moves are powerful without being over the top.[/i]

35454310.review:
[h1]A game that does AAAAALLLLLLLL THE THINGS! It's a gloriously inconsistent all-you-can-eat buffet of RPG, dungeon crawling, quests, crafting, fishing(!), cartoonery, turn-based combat and probably other stuff I haven't even discovered yet. Not to mention three different types of fancy graphics.[/h1]

I have a confession to make. When I picked this game I didn't pay all that much attention to the store page, I just thought "nice graphics and turn-based combat, I'll have some of that!" To me, turn-based combat usually means pushing characters around on a grid with battles strung together by a storyline. Well, I got a lot more than I bargained for as all the items, menus, abilities, upgrades and miscellaneous bits and pieces showered down on me, like when you open an over-stuffed cupboard and all the toys fall on your head.

Sometimes in situations like this I'm overwhelmed and disoriented, wondering what to do next or how to progress (I'm looking at you, Stellaris) but here it was easy to dive in and make decent progress right away without worrying too much about the intricacies. All the items you collect and the weapons and abilities and everything else are there on the side, waiting for you to gradually discover and use them at your own pace. Like a child on Christmas day, it's not necessary to play with all your toys at once, you have all year to enjoy them.

Anyway, enough of the silly analogies, I'll try to explain how this all works. Please bear with me because I'm a little confused just thinking about it.

So first of all you get some cartoon animations, very professional TV-quality stuff, and these characters reappear in story-progression dialogs throughout the game, sometimes with voice acting, other times not (are they going to fill out the missing bits of voice acting later? I dunno). Then the graphics style changes (think Don't Starve) and you're on the main map area that's a network of pathways connected to town areas and guarded all over the place by enemies. In the towns you can buy and sell items, upgrade weapons, craft things, talk to NPC characters who give you the quests and so forth. Then a pointer appears on the map and you follow it to your quest, battling enemies along the way to clear the paths towards your quest... or anywhere else on the map you want to visit, you don't have to tackle your quests right away.

Eventually you'll reach a dungeon entrance. When you enter, the graphics style changes again and you have a free-roaming 3D nicely-lit environment. Here you explore everywhere to pick up items, open chests, discover lore, do some fishing - yes, this is a thing - and decide whether or not to tackle the free-roaming enemies wandering around looking menacing.

[h1]Combat[/h1]

This can happen not only on the fixed pathways on the main map, but also when you bump into enemies in the dungeons. It's like two different games but with the same combat. The graphics change yet again, you have your crew on the left and enemies on the right, beat-em-up style. This is the turn-based combat phase. Your characters have health bars and mana bars that get depleted as enemies attack them, and they don't refill after a battle so you have to carefully ration it all. You can tell each character to use normal attacks, healing, special abilities (that use up mana) or even fleeing is an option. The attack animations are great, there's all kinds of burning, bashing, slashing, poisoning, bleeding and fighting shenanigans going on. Once the battle is won, your characters get XP and eventually level up, giving them extra attacks and abilities.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

There are multiple types of graphics and they're all fantastic. It feels a bit disjointed and chaotic with all the transitions between styles but for me this all adds to the bonkers charm of it all. You'll certainly never accuse this game of being boring or samey, as it hurls bananas at you from the sidelines.

When you press the menu button there's a big book with eight different tabs neatly displaying all the various stats, crafting items, quests, lore and everything else you need to know about your game progress. See, there is method to all this madness!

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

It will become difficult at some point I'm sure. The enemies are becoming tougher and I'm levelling up to meet the challenges ahead. However, I don't think it's the type of game where you'll ever get stuck and not be able to progress one way or another because there are so many different avenues and methods to explore. Encounter a tough barrier? Forget it and try something else. By the time you come back to it you will have levelled up and be able to deal with it more effectively.

[h1]Steam[/h1]

48 achievements - like I said, there's plenty to get your teeth into here - Trading Cards and Steam Cloud. At time of writing, Linux support has been a yes and then a no, so not sure. More chaos haha! Love it!

[h1]Value[/h1]

It has a pretty steep price tag but you're getting a lot for your money. Not only is it top quality in all departments, but there are loads of those departments! Whatever game genre you're a fan of, there's something here for you - crafting, beat-em-ups, turn-based strategy, open world discovery, you name it. It's like several games rolled into one. I'd pay full price for it, no problem.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

I'm sure that once I build up some more experience the game will eventually develop into a multi-layered objective-driven, character-levelling challenge. I have to say though, this is one of those rare occasions when I'm loving the game in the early stages before I have any real clue what I'm doing yet. It's a lot of fun right from the start, and can only get better with time.

[quote]More reviews at SaveOrQuit.com[/quote]

35453324.review:
Конечно, рано писать обзор основываясь только на первых впечатлениях. 
Однако тяжело сдержаться, чтобы не похвалить шикарный арт дизайн игры. Это вообще основная причина, почему игра была куплена.
Ну и это прям такая классическая JRPG (аж сердце йокает пока вспоминаешь всякие ранние финалки или chrono trigger), но не японская, и с удобным управлением на клавомыше. Это вторая причина.
Боевая система в игре приятная, радует количеством абилок и комбинаций их. В ролевых элементах отдельно еще есть таланты (+3% к атаке, +2% к лечению) с помощью которых можно строить билд и менять почти на лету. Ну и конечно, заявленный крафт здесь довольно обширен, но иногда для него придется пофармить ресурсы.
Но даже без фарма боев здесь много, очень много (jrpg же, камон). Постепенно будут открываться персонажи с новыми абилками, но все же к концу игры схватки могут утомить, особенно с рядовыми врагами на глобальной карте.
Кроме глобальной карты есть отдельные локации и данжы, где мы бегаем одним персонажем (с возможностью сменить на лету), используем уникальную абилку (лечение пати, телепортация на короткие расстояния), уворачиваемся от ловушек, находим сокровища, решаем простенькие загадки и натыкаемся на врагов.
Данжы отдельная тема - в них можно получить увеличинную награду выбрав сложность побольше. Они довольно продолжительные и дают попотеть.
Сюжетно это героическое фэнтэзи с хорошими ребятами и плохими. Не сказать, чтобы сильно увлекал, но в целом мотивацию двигаться вперед дает. Сам по себе мир интересный, персонажи забавные, а в пути попадаются небольшие, но занимательные квесты с разными исходами.
Думаю многих порадует полная русская локализация на старте. Однако здесь озвучены (не на русский, а вообще) далеко не все диалоги и фразы. Жаль, в бою хотелось бы побольше высказываний голосом, а не текстом.

35453298.review:
Backed the game after Kickstarter campaign.

Many years ago I played Final Fantasy IX. I loved it so much! I was fond of it. It's definitely one of my favourite games if not the most.
Many years after that I was trying to find a game which could give me similar feeling and emotions which FFIX was giving me for more than 100 hours at the time.
And finally I've found Battle Chasers: Nightwar.
Everything in this game speaks to me! Gorgeous artstyle, charming characters, deep gameplay mechanics, amazing soundtrack, extremely satisfying animations and sound effects! I love it!

The game has its flaws, though. For example, questionable random mechanic on the skills, which hit nearby enemy (it's so hard for me to not hate it, but I'm trying); confusing characters stats; inconsistent position of All Items category. I guess, it's just me being extremely picky because I love the game so much I want it to be perfect in every aspect :)

Recommend the game to everyone who love JRPGs, Turn-Based Combat, Dungeon Crawlers.

35452989.review:
Gameplay footage 2 hours in: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kzWs3lmVqBM

Battle Chasers: Nightwar is awesome. This is an in-canon JRPG continuation of the comic book series Battle Chasers. The game looks great, it sounds great, and it plays well. The characters and backgrounds just look awesome. The music and voice acting is well done.

JRPG combat is 3v3 with a turn order format. Characters can do instant actions or stronger abilities that will take place later down the turn order. Actions can build up overcharge, which can be used in place of mana or for added effects with abilities. You gain more mechanics or skills as you level up in the game. At first you just have a few actions and abilities, but eventually you get an AP-skill tree and a burst attack. Burst attacks use a meter that builds up through combat that does big moves that can turn the tide of combat.

Movement in the game is done in an overworld, exploration areas, and dungeons. There are no random encounters, the enemies are visible for you to encounter at all times (unless they're hidden for an ambush). At first you know nothing of your enemies, but the more you fight them...the more knowledge you gain of them. In the overworld, you're going from area to area; enemies will be on nodes in the overworld, sometimes you can take alternate paths or choose the lesser of two evils...or attack everything. In exploration areas and dungeons; there are traps and puzzles and enemies to encounter as you find treasure or are making your way towards an objective.

I've been spending every free moment I have to play this game, I like it a lot and really want to read the comics now. I recommend it 100%

35452962.review:
[u]Disclaimer:[/u] I am a low tier Kickstarter backer of this game.

[u]Game Description:[/u]
The game consists, gameplay-wise, of ...
[list]
    [*]the world map, a grid of connected dots that connects you to towns, dungeons, teleporters, and the like. Please note: this is no free-form exploration but rather a "street map" where you decide which turn to take.
    [*]exploration dungeons, pretty much connected rooms where you loot treasure, evade traps, find in-game lore, and meet enemies
    [*]combat, where you fight enemies or waves of enemies in turn-based classical JRPG fashion in a satisfying tactical manner as you need to manage your resources (mana and health), your initiative (you need to decide between using immediate "normal" attacks and abilities that are executed with a delay in regards to which character acts next and when)
    [*]fishing, a small optional mini-game where you catch fish
    [*]crafting, an optional side activity to obtain loot or potions
    [*]character management where you designate perk points, loot, unlock abilities through character progression, etc.
[/list]

[u]Game Review:[/u]
The art style speaks for itself, this is a really nice looking game (which is no surprise given the artists previously worked on the Darksiders game series). The presentation layer overall of this game is top notch in every regard (animations, visual effects, sound effects, game music, overall art style, personality of game characters, ...).

The different gameplay layers work well together and contribute to an overall great JRPG game. Highly recommended!

Theh only downsides are that pacing for character progression and in-game economy balancing are still a little off, however the developer has already mentioned in its latest Kickstarter update that they are working on improving this.

[u]My Rating:[/u] 8.7/10

35452914.review:
Review from 20 minutes into the game:

Runs very well on my GTX 1050 (2GB) - High setting (All)

Love the art style, it is more like torchlight but better.

Walking on the world map and interact with object, places and monster reminds me of Chrono Trigger.

The battle itself is a turn based just like many japanese RPG and each skill have a description comes with it.

Very keyboard and mouse friendly.

Storyline, it is not like other RPG where protagonist fresh start set to an adventure because of something evil or someone dead. In this game we are already IN the middle of our adventure. The prologue of the game does a good job explaining a story.

Multi language in subtitles and audio (including character voice), the devs done a pretty good job providing so many languages choice. 

Will play more to dig into the game and perhaps update my review sometime in the future.

35452674.review: An undoubtedly awesome RPG with rich and colorful visuals so far. The comic book feel is nailed perfectly and transitions nicely between the story and exploration. Combat is very fluid and the animations are top notch. Character progression is smooth, may be a touch grindy for some people towards the end, but there is certainly enough character/skill choices and enemy variety to keep you interested. Offers quite a bit of replayability with NG+ and respawnable randomized dungeons for even more loot, materials, and puzzles with optional legendary difficulty for harder challenges. Overall, a fantastic experience and can't wait to see what else Airship Syndicate come out with for this franchise!

35452444.review: I've been playing the Kickstarter Beta and so far the game has been an absolute joy. The mix of isometric RPG and JRPG, mixed with some light puzzles, has been nothing short of pure bliss. Not to mention has amazing the game's art is. Definitely recommended.

35452277.review:
I will update the review once I played more.

Finally a well made turn based RPG again in the likes of Final Fantasy VI/VII. The characters are interesting from the get go, the voiceovers well done and the enviroments have an awesome comic-like feel to them. For now the game is living up to it's promises.

Pro's:

- Customizable characters with perks (making characters offensive or defensive)

Con's:

35452170.review:
En tant que fan des comics Battle Chasers de Joe Mad, j'attendais avec impatience tout ce qui était prévu pour la série. J'ai vraiment été surpris lorsqu'un jeu a été annoncé et j'ai tout de suite soutenu le projet d'autant plus qu'il annonçait aussi une suite des comics.

J'ai pu jouer au jeu depuis la beta et j'ai vraiment été impressionné par la qualité du titre. Les personnages principaux sont les même que dans les comics sauf le dernier (Alumon) qui est inédit. Chacun a ses points forts et faibles qui respectent leur background (Gully est une tank, héritage de son père, Garrison et Red Monika des damage dealers, Calibretto est un soigneur et donneur de buffs, et Knolan est un mage multi-fonction, mais moins puissant en soins que Calibretto).

Le character design est de toute beauté et très similaire à celui des comics, les musiques sont magnifiques et bien dans l'ambiance, les personnages sont doublés en français alors que ce n'était pas prévu à l'origine, le gameplay est aux petits oignons (et reprend des bonnes idées d'un peu partout), et la difficulté est là. Il n'est pas rare de devoir recommencer plusieurs fois un combat contre un boss afin de tester plusieurs stratégies et combinaisons de personnages, jusqu'à ce qu'on puisse le vaincre.

L'histoire est assez classique dans le genre heroic-fantasy (même si c'est plutôt steampunk), je veux dire par là qu'elle est très bien faite, que les dialogues sont très sympas, mais que pour l'instant (après plus de 50 heures de jeu avec mes personnages au niveau 15), il n'y a pas réellement de retournement de situation majeur.

Bref, je m'éclate beaucoup et je pense que je suis loin de l'avoir fini :)

35452059.review:
I adore this game. As a long time fanboy of Joe Mad and the Battlechasers comics back in the day, I jumped at the chance to help fund this game through Kickstarter. All jrpg fans of the old SNES classic games, i.e Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana, ect, will fall in love with this game. Beautiful rich animation, character models, and over all tone of the game is very much what you would expect from a Joe Mad created game. His passion for the game shows through amazingly detailed art , beautiful music and soundtrack; game features tough boss fights, crafting system, combo attacks, monster beastery,  New Game +. Telling a story of good vs evil as old as time itself. 

Run time took me about 22 hours on my first playthrough, and because of the level system, it's worth playing a second time to 100% the game.

The controls are smooth and responsive, I didn't run into any technical issues. ( using a gtx970/6gb card.)
Highly recommended for any fan of the comicbooks and jrpgs alike.

35452031.review: Battle Chasers: Nightwar brings together some really cool character design with a very enjoyable, intense and, at times, punishing combat system. It’s handling of progression is just right, with maybe a slight slip towards the end, thanks to its stream of new abilities and variants of foes that require a different way of going about punching their faces. There’s enough to do without it feeling overbearing. Time-wise, you’re looking at 25+ hours of gameplay, easily. It’s true that the characters could have used more fleshing out. The story didn’t receive enough attention, either, and it stands as the game’s biggest missed opportunity. The inconsistent leveling requirements towards the end may also feel a little strange and put off people looking for a fluid, straightforward experience. However, when drawing the line, Battle Chasers: Nightwar’s stylish approach to visuals and intense, strategic combat make up for these slights, resulting in a bundle of JRPG goodness.[url=http://www.noobfeed.com/reviews/1361/battle-chasers-nightwar-pc-review] Full Review[/url].

35451914.review: excellent superbe jeux tres bon graphisme

35451907.review:
Overall, I recommend this game to any one who enjoys Turn-Based RPGs (It solidly earns its current $30 price tag), if you're only a marginal fan of Turn-based RPGs or are looking for a "first foray into the genre" - I would wait for it to go on sale ($20-ish).

Pros:
- Goregeous Aesthetics
- Intuitive Controls
- Unique Characters (each character feels distinct and alive, something a lot of turn-based RPGs lately lack - even the NPCs have a decent personality, albeit flatter than the characters)
- A solid balance of Core content and Side Content (side missions, collections, crafting, etc.)
- Good RNG design (RNG plays its role, but never in a manner that feels "unfair" or where you're relying solely on it to do something - you'll never win/lose because of RNG )
- Good Voice Acting
- Decent amount of non-voice acted "side exposition" through staying at the inn and exploring "side-quest" areas.

Cons:
- Combat is a little simple (there's a number of buffs/debuffs, but they generally aren't a means to an end, more just a "nice added effect" to another ability) - the only buffs/debuffs that are really important are taunt/defend, and to a lesser extent burn/bleed/poison (the rest are "nice, but not necessary" such as chill, stun, sunder, etc.)
- [strike]Some aspects of the game could use better explanations[/strike] [they are adding to the in-game manual for this]
- there is a DX9 "safe mode" - though I would recommend using a card that supports later DX versions (DX9 version still has some "blurry cam" issues in a limited number of areas)

Neutrals:
- Has some limited replay value in discovering secrets, leveling, NG+, and repeatable semi-random dungeons.
- Semi-linear (not a real problem, just worth noting, there isn't much in the way of possible sequence breaking)

Episode 1 of my blind playthrough so you can get a feel of the gameplay (full playlist on channel if you want to see all the characters):
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1138464212

35451833.review:
[h1] Battle Chasers: Nightwar - Review [/h1] 

Del comic a los videojuegos. Joe Madureira ha demostrado una vez más su indiscutible calidad al momento de entrar al mundo de los videojuegos. En su momento se lució con los diseños y el concepto de DarkSiders,  esta vez regresa a casa, a sus viejas raíces con el Comic que le dio la gloria a fines de los 90s. Battle Chasers: Nightwar es una carta de amor para todos los fanáticos del comic y especialmente para los seguidores de los JRPG. Por lo tanto, gira alrededor del clásico concepto de luchas por turnos con los tradicionales potenciadores de mana, ataques normales y especiales, pero también refuerza esta ideología con un carismático grupo de guerreros. La cifra asciende a 6, cada uno de ellos cuenta con un perfil muy variado con el que explotar al máximo múltiples destrezas. Tirar por la violencia desmedida, o jugar a lo estratégico con una buena defensa y pociones. Tal vez, los combates tengan un desarrollo algo genéricos, con ataques que van y vienen desde ambas direcciones, pero las animaciones y sus rafagas de ataque rápidamente lo diferencian de la media. Eventualmente permiten exponer increíbles imágenes con un diseño artístico bien cuidado, aunque con una bajísima carga gráfica. 

A todo esto, la construcción de escenarios, es uno de los atributos más importantes de Nightwar. Cada una de sus mazmorras es un escenario totalmente separado del mapeado original y toma lugar en un plano propio en las profundidades del místico continente llamado, The Grey Line. Una de las grandes cualidades de las mazmorras es su concepción. No son simples habitaciones a las que entrar, coger botines, matar al jefe de turno y alejarse, nada de eso. Las mazmorras toman un diseño más similar al de la saga Diablo, con habitaciones bien elaboradas y estructuradas por trampas, enemigos, fragmentos de notas y cofres. Otras también rompen con ese habitual patrón y presentan mesas de trabajo donde concebir nuevas armaduras y armas e incluso introduce momentos de ocio al permitir la pesca en su interior. Es medio insólito encontrar estanques en el interior de un castillo o cripta, pero se le permite por el afán de originalidad. Eventualmente, las mazmorras se convierten en el pilar principal de Battle Chasers: Nightwar y para nuestra fortuna lucen extraordinariamente bien. Además, invitan a probar nuevos desafíos, ya que al regresar a sus interiores el diseño principal cambiara, y será completamente diferente al de nuestra aventura inicial. Momento en el que tendremos que utilizar nuestros dotes de herrero para mejorar nuestro arsenal, y así tener un equipo equilibrado para la desafiante tarea de turno.

En fin, no hay prácticamente nada demasiado severo para reprocharle. Nightwar cumple con todo lo que se propone al ofrecer un sistema de juego amplio, variado y con un enorme margen de rejugabilidad. La historia es aceptable y la consistencia de su narrativa afianza el interés a descubrir sus célebres misterios. Sin mucho más por agregar, Battle Chasers: Nightwar es un juego sumamente competente, es como jugar Diablo, pero por turnos.

[url=https://pcindiemrace.com/2017/10/03/battle-chasers-nightwar-review/] PC Indie Master Race [/url]

35451796.review:
[quote=author] He recibido este juego departe de THQ Nordic, sin embargo este hecho no hara ningun cambio a mi análisis [/quote]

Battle Chasers: Nightwar es una lanzamiento que puede pasar desapercibido al no venir acompañado de una gran campaña promocional, un padrino con demasiado renombre o una franquicia famosa. Pero está realizado con un cariño sincero a mecánicas e ideas que han funcionado durante tantos años en la industria del videojuego que es imposible que deje insatisfecho a los amantes del género rolero, tal vez sientas que el juego va lento pero al final te acostumbras tomando el ritmo normal de los RPG, tiene un toque clasico de mazmorras con recompenzas que te pueden ayudar en la aventura.

Puntos a notar.
-Graficamente es hermoso, movimientos fluidos, escenarios con movimiento, como para sacar un fondo animado en WallpaperEngine.
-La jugabilidad puede que sea repetitiva pero al verlos con las animaciones, voces y todo en general hacen que sea un deleite ver las batallas.
-Variedad de personajes con distitas habilidades.

Puntos negativos.
-Puede que si quieras algo frenetico y rapido, tal vez este no sea tu juego adecuado, sería mas bien para quien despejarse un ratito de tanto shooter, te invita a volver al clasico tomate tu tiempo. 
-El precio la verdad me parece un poquito elevado para quienes busquen algo calmado, se que $270 pesos puede que no sea mucho pero estamos hablando de un juego INDIE, publicado por  THQ Nordic, espero que en ofertas pueda bajar un poco mas el juego para que el publico pueda probarlo. 


8.8/10
-NEBFLUT
